description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 3 In the solitude of an empty track, Roosevelt Raceway staged an eerie program of harness racing tonight after parimutuel ticket agents had gone on strike and forced the track to shut its doors to the public.

title: BLACKLIST FUROR ANNOYS THE ARABS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 3Arab businessmen and investors are annoyed by the uproar in the United States and Western Europe over the continued Arab blacklisting of foreign companies and banks that deal with Israel,

title: KillList Exemptions
description: The first life I remember taking belonged to a very young chicken. It was trailing its mother under a widemesh wire fence I happened to be descending and I stepped on it. It was a shattering experience. I was restored only after earnest maternal assurances that it was a deed done without malice or intent and didn't matter anyhow because it was only a chicken.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 4, 1975

title: Merle Alcock, a Contralto At Met in 1920's, Is Dead
description: Merle Alcock, a contralto with the Metropolitan Opera from 1923 to 1929, died Saturday at her home in Phoenix. Ariz. She was about 85 years old.

title: At School in Mexico, Withering Regimen
description: GUADALAJARA, MexicoSomeone once called them medical wetbacks.

title: C. R. Carpenter, Psychologist, MonkeyBehavior Expert, Dies
description: Dr. Clarence Ray Carpenter, psychologist and anthropologist, who studied monkeys and apes for the clues they gave to human behavior, died Saturday in Athens, Ga., where he lived. He was 69 years old.

title: NursingHome Costs Rising for State
description: New York State taxpayers are losing about $7,500 a day in matching funds from Medicaid as a result of administrative delays and conflicting court orders that have blocked enforcement of the Federal Life Safety Code on six nursing homes, an informel computation indicated yesterday.

title: MISTRIAL IS DENIED IN OKLAHOMA CASE
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March (UPI)The chief witness for the prosecution in former Gov. David Hall's trial in charges of briberY and extortion, said today that he was helping prove Hall was a crook, prompting the defense to move for a mistrial. The motion was overruled.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE 3D SESSION IN ROW
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market rose again yesterday for the third session as traders appeared to be increasingly influenced by tumbling interest rates. Volume also rose on both markets.

title: Buckley Sees Options in 76
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)Conservative politicians and businessmen banding together with the 1976 Republican Presidential ticket in mind will not automatically back President Ford and are generally opposed to Nelson A. Rockefeller, Senator James L. Buckley, RepublicanConservative of New York said today.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1975, by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: Medical Study: Few Chosen
description: Don Kurth runs to his mailbox six times a day.

title: STEEL OUTPUT IS UP 13,000 TONS IN WEEK
description: Steel production in the week ended March 1 rose to 2,723,000 tons from 2,710,000 tons in the previous week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The latest index was 111.6, up from the Previous week's index of 111.1.

title: FOX NAMES YABLANS TO HEAD UNIT HERE
description: Frank Yablans, the 39yearold former president of Paramount Pictures, has joined 20th CenturyFox, it was announced yesterday by Dennis C. Stanfill, chairman of the board, and Alan Ladd Jr., vice president in charge of worldwide production.

title: West Siders Told Of 17% Crime Rise In 20th Precinct
description: Reported crime increased by 17 per cent in the 20th Precinct on the West Side last year, Deputy Inspector Joseph Pluchino, the precinct commander, told members of the West 78th Street Block Association last night.

title: Rip Torn Is Commanding in The Father
description: NEW HAVEN  The Father was partially a response to what Strindberg considered to be Ibsens scandalous attacks on the male sex, particularly in A Doll's House. In The Father, which this weekend entered the repertory at the Yale Repertory Theater, Strindberg shows a man ensnared by a cannibalistic wife. Referring to his own situation, the father, known: as the Captain, says, It's like going into a cage of tigers.

title: Envoy's Views Criticized
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 3 A Congressional factfinding group left here last night with at least four of its eight members reported dismayed by what they considered to be a lack of objectivity by Ambassador Graham A. At )n the Vietnam issue. At least two of them were said to be

title: RAYMOND M.FOLEY, EXHOUSING HEAD
description: Raymond M. Foley, Federal HouSing Administrator and head of the Housing and Home Finance Agency under President Harry Truman, died Sunday in Cottage Hospital, Grosse Pointe, Mich. He was 84 years old.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. See the Conquering. Hero Comes, Handel; Love in Bath, HandelBeecham.

title: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries
Books of The Times
description: By now it's almost trite to say that the functions of traditional fiction have been replaced by sociology. Yet the point comes at you freshly sharpened when you read Paul Wilkes's Trying Out the Dream: A Year in the Life of an American Family.

title: MERRILL LYNCH ASKS PRICING EXEMPTION
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the brokerage house, has asked the Securities and Exchange Commission for an exemption from the Investpent Advisers Act of 1940 to clear the way for it to charge separately for 10 individual services, it was reported yesterday.

title: Bid to Get $ 110Million for U.D.C. Stalls
description: ALBANY, March 3Governor Carey's request for $110million to allow the Urban Development Corporation to pay its bills stalled in the Legislature today. The leaders were in apparent agreement that $110million was more state money than the U.D.C. needed to stay alive right now, but in a series of meetings throughout the day they could not agree on how much was enough.

title: BankerRecruiter Censured by Big 8
description: An Oklahoma banker threatened yesterday to institute a $10million suit against the Big Eight Conference for violation of my civil rights and restraint of trade after

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The actions of a New York State Supreme Court justice. Who held a predawn bail hearing at which he ordered the releaSe of an acquaint mice charged with attempting to bribe two police officers is under investigation by the state commission that monitors judicial conduct, a police official said.

title: Gurney Jury Selection
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 3 (UPI)Jury selection in the trial of former United States Senator Edward J. Gurney, Republican of Florida, and four codefendants moved into its second week today. So far, 54 prospective jurors have been dismissed or excused.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS SEEK BROAD PLAN FOR ENERGY USE
description: WASHINGTON, March 3The major elements of a possible energy compromise between the Ford Administration and Congress began to take shape today at a House Ways and Means Committee hearing.

title: DEFENSE MINISTER IN CHILE IS KILLED
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 3 (AP)A helicopter crash today killed the Chilean Defense Minister, Gen. Oscar Bonilla, and six other persons.

title: INQUIRY ON AIRLINES PLANNED BY RUTH
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)  A spokesman for the Special Watergate Prosecutor, Henry S. Ruth, said today that allegations by the former chief of enforcement for the Civil Aeronautics Board concerning possible election law violations by some United States airlines will be investigated.

title: Title Match Referee Chosen
description: BELGRADE, March 3, Reuter Paul Klein of Ecuador, an international chess referee, has been named chief referee for the proposed world title match between Bobby Fischer of the United States and Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union. It is still not certain that the match will take place. Final confirmation from both contenders is still awaited. The rules require confirmation by April 1.

title: Costs Will Rise te $4,100 At Cellege in Massachusetts
description: GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass., March 3 (Ap)Tuition, room and board at Simons Mick College, already $4,509 a year, will rise $200 in September.

title: Car Output Plunged; By 34% Last Month; March Rise Is Seem
description: DETROIT, March 3 The United States auto industry, cutting production to reduce a record inventory, built 371,058 cars last month, down 34 per cent from 562,238 cars built in February, 1974.

title: Ranger Ice Puts Club on the Rocks
description: Singlegame insurance policies similar to the flight insurance available at airports ought to be made available to players skating on Madison Square Garden ice. The

title: Now Terrycloth Is Going Formal
description: Wear a towel to a party, Dick Kallman advises women he meets on his tour of such stores as Martha's in Palm Beach. Often they do. His towels.

title: Pennsylvania Town Weighs Effect of Losing Railroad
description: PAXTONVILLE, Pa., March 1If the railroad goes, the truckers will have you by the neck, said Jim Leeser in the Reigle brothers feed store here.

title: Roosevelt Struck. Races Go On for OTB
description: WESTBURY, L. I.,March 3 In the solitude of an empty track, Roosevelt Raceway staged an eerie program of harness racing tonight after parimutuel ticket agents had gone on strike and forced the track to shut its doors to the Public.

title: Standings in British Soccer
Turkish Airlines Offers $10Million in Crash Suits
description: Turkish Airlines offered $10million yesterday toward a proposed $100million outofcourt Settlement of damage suits groWing out of the crash of DC10 outside Paris exactly year ago in which 335 passengers died.

title: RUTH L. MORITZ
description: Ruth Leila Moritz, who retired in 1971 as assistant professor of Spanish literature and Romance languages at Hunter College, died Thursday in Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 68 years old and lived here.

title: Major Commodity Exporters Ask Oil Producers
description: ALGIERS, March 3The major commodityexporting countries, whose prices are falling sharply as economic recession spreads, are looking to the meeting of chiefs of state of the oilproducing nations here for financial aid to stabilize commodity prices.

title: Shelton Assesses Effects Of Blast on Its Economy
description: Continued From Page 1, Col. 3

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (Reuters)The value of new construction completed in January fell 2.7 per cent or $3.5billion, to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $128billion, the Commerce Department reported today. Private construction expenditures fell $1.6billion, or about 2 per cent, to seasonally adjusted rate of $88.4billion.

title: Police Describe Suspect in Plant Blast
description: SHELTON, Conn., March 3Lawenforcement officials investigating the bombing of a, rubber plant here late Saturday are looking for a welldressed, darkhaired man who delivered several cartons to the plant seven hours before it was destroyed.

title: Chicago Tribune Is Winner Of Editorial Writing Awaro
description: ATLANTA, March 3 (UPI)The Chicago Tribune was named today as the 1975 sweepstakes winner in the William Allen White editorial excellence award program at the Inland Daily Press Association spring meeting here.

title: Ford Extends, Assurances To Visiting Israel President
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (Reuters)President Ford assured President Ephraim Katzir of Israel today that the United States remained committed to Israel's security and wellbeing as he searched for peace in the Middle East.

title: Gas Pipeline Routes at Issue in Alaska
description: PRUDHOE BAY, Alaska, March 3The proposed pipeline to carry Arctic natural gas from this snowcovered tundra to the lower 48 states has not aroused the storm of controversy that the longdelayed oil pipeline did.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: JOB OFFERS DROP FOR ENGINEERING
description: College graduates in engineering, who were in great demand last year and were able to pick their employment from numerous offers, are finding that jobs are scarcer this spring than they were a year ago.

title: COURT UPHOLDS LAW ON OBSCENE MOVIES
description: TRENTON, March 3 (AP)A state appeals court ruled today that the state antiobscenity law permitted the prosecution of indoor movie theaters that showed alegedly obscene films.

title: Law Is Urged to Require DrinkContainer Deposits
description: A state agency yesteraay proposed mandatory deposits on all beer and softdrink containers, including bottles, cans or cartons, but with a delay in enactment this year due to the serious economic conditions in the nation and the state.

title: 19 Killed in Phnom Penh In Rash of Rocket Attacks
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia March 3 (Reuters) Communistled insurgents killed 19 people and wounded 25 in a rocket attack today on Phnom Penh and nearby Pochentong Airport.

title: Corporate Bond Prices Rally After Early Drops
description: Corporate bond prices, weighted down by plans of the General Motors Corporation to raise $600million in the debt market, were depressed in early trading yesterday. Later in the day, however; their losses were pared. Underwriters led by Morgan Stanley are expected to market the G. M. package of $300million in 30year debentures and $300million in 10year notes during the week of March 17. It would rank as the largest debt offering ever of any industrial company.

title: Higher Costs Cited
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 4The Argentine Government devalued the peso by 50 per cent today, raising the official rate from 10 pesos to a dollar, to 15 to a dollar.

title: John Mayali and His Band Appear at the Bottom Line
description: John Mayall, currently touted blues, is actually more of a maverick. He proved it again Monday at the Bottom Line.

title: FIVE HOMES LOSE MEDICAID MONEY
description: New York City suspended Medicaid payments yesterday to five nursing homes and ordered them not to accept any new Medicaid patients pending a clarification of their status under the Federal Life Safety Code.

title: Rockland to Fight TV Licenses Here Over Local News
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., March 4 (UPI)The Rockland County Legislature voted this evening to challenge the license renewals of New York's six local television stations before the Federal Communications Commission on charges that the stations ignore Rockland.

title: Europe's 9 Fail to Reach Accord on Oil Price Policy
description: BRUSSELS, March 4The foreign ministers of the nine Common Market countries agreed here today on the need to support the development of alternative sources of energy. But they made no concrete decision to adopt a plan, like those suggested by Secretary of State Kissinger and the Common Market Commission, to insure that the price of oil does not drop below an agreed minimum price.

title: $87Million Aid Program Urged for Public Housing
description: ALBANY, March 4Directors of five of the state's largest public housing authorities called on the Legislature today to enact a $87million program to stem the deterioration of public housing and to meet rapidly rising costs of fuel and utilities.

title: Stock Trading Soars
description: Trading on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday reached the second highest level in history34.14 million shares. Price closed at their highest point since Aug. 12. The highest volume  35.16 million shareswas reached Feb. 13. Page 53.

title: BOTH GERMANYS JOIN GENEVA ARMS TALKS
description: GENEVA, March 4  West and East Germany joined the Geneva disarmament conference today and pledged to play an active role in the search for arms accords.

title: EUROPEANS AGREE ON REGIONAL AID
description: BRUSSELS, March 4The foreign ministers of the nine European Common Market countries reached agreement today on the final details of the community's longplanned regional development fund.

title: A HOSPITAL STRIKE VOTED BY INTERNES
description: A union representing 3,000 or more internes and residents at 11 voluntary hospitals in the city voted last night to go out on strike on March 17 as a resuit of unresolved contract issues.

title: Lillian Espy, 75, Is Dead; Former Aide at Y.W.C.A.
description: Lilian Espy, former assistant executive director of the national board of the Young Women's Christian Association, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital following cancer surgery. She was 75 years old and lived in Hartsdale, N.Y.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 5, 1975

title: Holdup Man Tells Detectives How to Do It
description: His face hidden by a shabby tan coat, the career holdup man peeked out at his audience of detectives and then proceeded to lecture to them on how easy it was to succeed at his trade in New York.

title: Article 5  No Title
News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 5, 1975

title: JobShort City. . .
description: For New York City the recession started even sooner than for the rest of the country. One New York worker out of every ten is now jobless, the highest rate for any major city except Detroit. Many of the city's idle have been out' of work so long that State Industrial Commissioner Louis L. Levine puts at 40,000 the number who will have exhausted their full year of extended unemployment insurance benefits by the end of April.

title: Braves Set Back Sonics
description: BUFFALO, March 4 (AP)Bob McAdoo scored 13 of his 39 points in the fourth quarter tonight to help the Buffalo Braves protect a 10497 National Basketball Association victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: TeenAgers Cater Dinners to Delight of Guests
description: MALIBU, Calif.It was Shortly after noon on a piercingly bright sunny day. California champagne flowed with spigotlike generosity into the glasses of guests on the brick and concrete patio attached to the home of Burgess Meredith and his wife, Caja. Carroll O'Connor, Archie Bunker himself, was there with his wife, Nancy. So were Charles Lloyd, the great jazz musician and Robert Mondavi, proprietor of the distinguished vineyard that bears his name.

title: U.S., Aussies Resume Rivalry In Aetna Cup Play Tomorrow
description: One of the great tennis rivalries over the years, the United States versus Australia, always stirs world attention. The Aussies love to beat the Yanks in headtohead battles, and vice versa. In Davis Cup team competition: the score is 1513 in favor of Australia.

title: Food Cost Dips 1.4% Here As Job Losses Cut Demand
description: Food prices dropped 1.4 per cent in New York City last week, one of the largest declines of the recent inflationary period, which began with the feed grain crisis of 1972. The drop was exceeded in magnitude only by the 2.1 per cent decline of the week of Aug. 20, 1973, produced at that time by the meat boycott.

title: $90MILLION AID FOR U.D.C. VOTED
description: ALBANY, Wednesday, March 5The State Assembly early this morning, with considerable bipartisan support, approved a $90million appropriation to keep the insolvent Urban Development Corporation alive through April. The vote was 112 to 34.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: House Votes to Direct Fed To Increase Money Supply
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (Reuters)The House of Representatives voted today, 367 to 55, to direct the Federal Reserve Board to increase the nation's money supply to lower longterm interest rates.

title: Byrne Estimate of Revenue Too Low, Legislature Told
description: TRENTON, March 4  The State Office of Fiscal Affairs, the Legislature:s fiscal agency, told the joint SenateAssembly Appropriations Committee today that Governor Byrne has underestimated the revenues from state taxes in the next fiscal year and as a result had overestimated the budget deficit.

title: A 3CONCERT SERIES BY STUTTGART TRIO
description: Three and a half Years ago the Stuttgart Piano Trio made its debut here in Carnegie Hall's Jeunesses Musicales series and was much admired. The ensemble, made up of Monika Leonhard, pianist Rainer Kussmaul, violinist, and Peter Hahn, cellist, is back, no longer wearing its Musical Youth badge, and it opened a threeprogram series at Carnegie Recitai Hall on Monday night. Each program is including works by Haydn, Beethoven and Brahms.

title: GOODYEAR OFFICIALS REPAY ELECTION GIFT
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 4Russell De Young's former chairman of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, B. M. Robertson, a director and A. E. Firestone, a former director, have repaid the company $87,000 taken from a secret Swiss bank account that was used for illegal campaign donations from 1967 to 1970.

title: F.P.C. Sets a Plan Of 8 Points to Spur Natural Gas Output
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) The Federal Power Commission proposed today an eightpoint program to stimulate natural gas production, beginning with the revocation of its own authority to regulate natural gas prices.

title: TRIAL DATE IS SET IN I.B.M TRUST SUIT
description: Impatient with further delay, Chief Judge David N. Edelstein yesterday set May 19 in Federal District Court here as the new starting date for trial of the Government's massive sixyearold antitrust suit against the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: GOVERNOR ATTENDS FITZPATRICK RITES
description: POINT PLEASANT, March 4 (UPI)Governor Byrne and 500 other mourners paid their last respects today to State Assemblyman William P. Fitzpatrick, who was killed in a beadon collision last week.

title: Contraception Study Slows as Costly Testing Curbs Industry's Prospects of Profits
description: The development of new and safer methods of contraception for American couples is being seriously hampered by a combination of factors that has removed the drug industry's main incentive for developing new products: the prospect of a profitable return on research investment.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LEND AN EAR To listen is to learn, and New Yorkers have ample opportunity to learn today on a number of lecture fronts, with subjects ranging from musical Broadway to da Vinci, the crisis of hunger, the art of comedy and the business of law for the layman. Most lectures are free.

title: Positions of Arabs and Jews Harden In Israeli Occupied West Bank Town
Simon and Dent Go to Moscow Next Month to Discuss Trade
description: MOSCOW, March 4  A Soviet trade official disclosed today that Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon and Secretary of Commerce Frederick B. Dent would visit the Soviet Union next month to discuss SovietAmerican trade.

title: Thunder on The Right
description: WASHINGTON, March 4President Ford is fighting hard these days to hold the middle ground of American politics but he's getting into serious trouble with the huge Democratic Congressional majorities on the left and with an increasingly critical Republican minority on the right.

title: Parisians Cite Wohlhuter
description: PARIS, March 4 (UPI) Rick Wohlhuter of the United States was named world athlete of the year for 1974 today by Athletisme Magazine. The Tanzanian middledistance runner, Filbert Bayi, was second and the Polish. sprinter, Irena Szewinska, was third in the voting for the honor. Journalists for the sports magazine have voted the award annually since 1969.

title: Suspect Found Guilty in Slaying Of Priest in Robbery in Paterson
description: PATERSON, March 4Juan Colon, a 21yearold unemployed factory workerand drug addict, was convicted today of firstdegree murder in the fatal beatingof a 79yearold Roman Catholic priest hert on Oct 29.

title: TV Football Brings S.E.C. $2.3Million
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., March 4 (AP)The Southeastern Conference reaped a record total of $2.3million during the 1974 season from 13 televised appearances in National Collegiate Athletic Association football games.

title: PARTIES DEADLOCK ON 3 REGENTS JOBS
description: ALBANY, March 4An attempt to fashion a bipartisan list of three nominees to the Board of Regents, the state's education policymaking board, collapsed today, and Republicans and Democrats picked opposing slates.

title: Holdup Man Tells Detectives How to Do It
description: His face hidden by a shabby tan coat, the, career holdup man peeked out at his audience of detectives and then proceeded to lecture to them on how easy it was to succeed at his trade in New York.

title: 3Year Pact Ends Roosevelt Strike
description: One of the more bizarre stories in American sports historyan evening of harness racing unfolding in front of a deserted grandstandended yesterday when parimutuel clerks voted to halt their strike against Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Pentagon Will Shift Sub Radio System Out of Wisconsin
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)  The Pentagon announced today that it would build the Sanguine communications system for submarines in Nevada or New Mexico instead of in Wisconsina move that may increase the costs by $700million.

title: Amtrak Passengers Tell A Hearing of Grievances
description: A New Jersey mart' who found cockroaches on the dining table of his Amtrak train to Florida, a Manhattan more who said she spent more time in a swaying Amtrak coach moving side to side than forward, a minister who sat up all night with his family when the sleeping car he paid for was never added to the trainthese and other dissatisfied Amtralc passengers declared their grievances here yesterday at a Federal hearing into rail passenger service.

title: PEDRO ALEIXO, 73, BRAZIL AIDE, DIES
description: BELO HORIZONTE, Brazil, March 4 (AP)Pedro Aleixo, who was deposed as Vice President by the military in 1969 to prevent his succession to the presidency, died yesterday of a heart attack following emphysema. He was 73 years old.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation has won a $100million order from the Southern California Edison Company for four steamturbine generators for the Kaiparowits Power project in southern Utah.

title: Industrial Diversity Helping Midwest Fight Recession
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 4The ripples from the nation's depressed automotive and construction industries are beginning to wash over the Middle West at a quicker pace as unemployment in the major cities of this region rises.

title: Bridge:
description: A world record was set at the Greater New York Bridge Associations tournament here Sunday, but the names of the recordbreakers will have to remain shrouded in anonymity.

title: People in Sports
description: David Thompson of North Carolina State and Bobby Knight, coach of Indiana's undefeated and top  ranked Hoosiers, earned top honors on the collegiate AllAmerica basketball team selected by The Sporting News yesterday. Thompson, a senior, was named player of the year and Knight was selected coach of the year.

title: Soviet and American Changes Apparent in Track Relations
description: RICHMOND, March 4Angel Doyle finally changed her mind. Yes, she admitted, the thrill of reaching the finish line first in a race now has overshadowed a winning jump shot at the buzzer.

title: Prices for Futures Of Gold and Silver Register a Decline
description: Gold and silver futures prices dropped sharply yesterday in heavy trading, reflecting a stronger value for the dollar abroad.

title: CHRYSLER OMITS OFFICER BONUSES
description: DETROIT, March 4 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation's top officers received pay increases in 1974, but gave up more than $4.5million in bonuses because of the company's $52million loss last year, the worst in its history.

title: Henry G. Leader Is Dead; Public Relations Man, 58
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Henry G. Leader, media relations coordinator for the American Petroleum Institute in Washington, died yesterday of a heart attack while driving to work from his home in Annapolis, Md. He was 58 years old.

title: Pupils Get High Grades, Cooking Dinner at School
description: At the last minute, the crme caramel wound up in the oven (it melted), and the 10yearold cooks forgot about the lobster they had put on the stove (it boiled eight minutes too long).

title: 228 Desk Officers Assigned to Combat Crime in the Streets
description: The Police Department has taken 228 officers out of headquarters and classroom posts to bolster its street crimefighting force in an attempt to offset the impact of the city's hiring freeze, Commissioner Michael J. Codd said yesterday.

title: People and Business
description: The nation's commercial bankers, in the midst of reducing their prime lending rates and watching businessloan demand sag, were urged yesterday by John E. Sheehan, a Federal Reserve Board governor, to become more accommodative in their lending policies.

title: $90Million Bill to Help U.D.C. Gains in Assembly
description: ALBANY, March 4After a day of closeddoor negotiations and suddenly convened meetings with bankers, the Assembly tonight appeared ready to pass a bill to channel $90million to the Urban Development Corporation.

title: Daily News Is Laying Off 2,500 in Delivery Strike
description: The Daily News, the largestcirculation daily news paper in the country, said yesterday that it would suspend publication today and begin laying off more than half of its 5,000 employes as drivers and deliverers continued a wildcat strike that has halted the tabloid's operations for the last three days.

title: Food Cost Dips 1.4% Here As Job Losses Cut Demand
description: Food prices dropped 1.4 per cent in New York City last week, one of the largest declines of the recent inflationary period, which began with the feed grain crisis of 1972. The drop was exceeded in magnitude only by the 2.1 per cent decline of the week of Aug. 20, 1973, produced at that time by the meat boycott.

title: WINE TALK
description: This is a wine story, but only by a vigorous stretch of the imagination. Actually, it is a story about living and dying and the occasionally unexpected nobility of the human spirit.

title: Nets Win As Erving Scores 36
description: St. Louis, March 4 (UPI)Julius Erving and Billy Paultz triggered a thirdquarter surge that sent the New York Nets to a 110106 victory over the spirits of St. Louis tonight in the American Basketball Association. Erving tallied 36 points and Paultz 24.

title: Impure Food Violations Alleged At Resale Grocery in California
description: SAN DIEGO, March 4  A grand jury here is investigating the dealings of three California supermarket chains with a grocery salvage company accused of supplying large quantities of adulterated, contaminated and rotting food to a group of suburban nursing homes.

title: 110 Livingston St. Frets
description: When James F. Regan, president of the New York City Board of Education, arrived yesterday at the central headquarters building, an elevator operator immediately filled him in on the latest rumor. A Brooklyn grand jury, the operator said, will soon take some major action involving someone at headquarters. The informant said he had got his information from a passenger who had got it from someone else.

title: Bull Pen Mets' No. 1 Problem
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. March 4Yogi Berra conceded, today that the biggest problem facing the New York Mets was pitching. And the feeling was growing in the team's spring camp that the problem would be attacked this month through another trade.

title: Music
description: Someone at Lincoln, Center had a happy thought in deciding to bring the New York Philharmonic and the Center's Chamber Music Society together for the MineFestival Around Schubert, which got under way last night at Avery Fisher Hall. Much of the music that influenced Schubert and much of the music by composers influenced by him (not to mention the music of Schubert himself) lies outside the orchestral sphere, and may best be represented by crackerjack chambermusic professionals.

title: Mayors Ask $5.7Billion in Federal Aid
description: WASHINGTON, March 4The nation's Mayors called today for $5.7billion in additional Federal aid for the cities to combat growing unemployment, lengthening welfare rolls, a feared increase in crime and a breakdown in municipal services.

title: HANSON BLATZ DEAD; A RADIATION EXPERT
description: Hanson Blatz, an expert on radiation, died Monday at Glen Cove (L. I.) Community Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived in Wantagh, L. I.

title: Energy Compromise
description: The spirit of compromise now dominates the negotiations between President Ford and leading Congressional Democrats on the energy problem. Though legislative and executive branches cling to their separate programs for reducing this country's petroleum consumption, the differences between them have now narrowed into clearly negotiable range.

title: SST TRIPS TO U. S. GET F.A.A. BACKING
description: The Federal Aviation Administration gave tentative approval yesterday for Concorde supersonic airliners to start limited passenger service to New York and Washington early next year.

title: Berlin Politician Freed
description: Peter Lorenz, kidnapped West Berlin politician, was released after the West German Government freed five imprisoned radicals. Page 12.

title: JURY STILL SOUGHT IN GURNEY TRIAL
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 4The semisecret selection of a jury to try former Senator Edward J. Gurney of Florida and four alleged conspirators in a bribery scheme will continue into its eighth day tomorrow with no word from the judge as to how many jurors have been picked nor when testimony will begin.

title: 228 Desk Officers Assigned to Combat Crime in the Streets
description: The Police Department his taken 228 officers out of headquarters and classroom posts to bolster its street crimefighting force in an attempt to offset the impact of the city's hiring freeze, Commissioner Michael J. Codd said yesterday.

title: Woman, Fined as Speeder, Sues Over Being Stripped for Search
description: A mother of three, arrested for nonpayment of a $15 traffic ticket and forced to strip for a vaginal and rectal search, filed a classaction suit yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn, seeking $1.1million in damages. The lawsuit also sought a restraining order to bar similar searches in the cases of minor offenses.

title: Embattled Nationalist
description: I told you I wanted to free my country, and this is how it's done, said the Rey. Ndabaningi Sithole as he thought of how he would explain his imprisonment in Rhodesia to an old American friend.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Since World War II Indochina has been an almost perennial sore in American politics and an almost perpetual arena of international confrontation.

title: Jack Frost Nipping At the Years
description: WASHINGTONThe plane came down into New York through a heavy snowstorm, an hour late, and was diverted from La Guardia to Kennedy. Appointments of Great Importance were being jeopardized or canceled as our taxi crept slowly into Manhattan. Snow was falling steadily, the roads were slippery and everything was a mess. New York seemed at its most difficult, and the logistics of surviving through a twocity work day seemed hopeless and impossible.

title: Vessel Eludes Canadian Police And Heads for French Islands
description: GASPE, Quebec. March 4 (UPI)A skipper trying to save his 2,500ton salvage vessel from seizure reportedly eluded a pursuing Canadian icebreaker in the Gulf of St. Lawrence during the night and headed for French islands off Newfoundland.

title: Alaska Judge Bars Aerial Wolf Hunt In Fairbanks Area
description: ANCHORAGE, March 4More than 200 gray wolves continued to run free in the Tanana Flats area today after a court ruling last night banned an aerial hunt of the animals by the State Fish and Game Department.

title: Kissinger Hopeful on Eve Of New Trip to Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Secretary of Stale Kissinger Leaves for the Middle East tomorrow, guardedly optimistic that he will persuade Israeli aid Egyptian leaders to make the compromises necessary to bring about a new Sinai agreement.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Former Prisoner at Attica Testifies He Saw Defendant Strike Two Correction Officers With a Club
description: BUFFALO, March 4A former Attica inmate testified today that he saw John Hill, one of two defendants on trial for murder here, strike correction officers with a club as inmates swarmed through critical checkpoints in the first hour of the prison insurrection that began on Sept. 9. 1971.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange closed mixed yesterday in steppedup trading after rising for the three preceding sessions. Prices in the counter market rose in accelerated trading.

title: Westway
description: After three years of study and debate, a deeply divided steering committee composed of state and local planners and neighborhood representatives has bucked an agonizing decision to Governor Carey and Mayor Beame. The question is whether to go ahead with construction of a new $1.1billion outboard interstate highway to replace the crumbling West Side Highway from the Battery to 42nd Street, or to trade in $1 billion in anticipated Federal aid for that project for about $550 million in Federal transit assistance and make do with some kind of patchup roadway along West Street.

title: Mrs. Court, Miss Evert Net Victors
description: BOSTON, March 4 (UPI)Margaret Court and Chris Evert overcame opponents in the $75,000 national women's indoor championships tonight.

title: Employes Get Memo
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)  Mr. Colby has told C.I.A. employes that they can report domestic activities they consider questionable but also can refuse to talk under official questioning.

title: A Peaked Bird, Not Yet a Dead Duck
description: MIAMI, March 4Before the first race at Hialeah today, a silver pheasant in the aviary out beneath the palms lay flat on the floor of its cage, out colder than George Foreman in Zaire. Maybe a dead duck would have been more appropriate but, lacking that, a moribund pheasant seemed a serviceable symbol for Hialeah herself, the ailing queen of Florida racing. After the second race another visit was made to the aviary, which stands a little beyond the sidewalk cafe and just this side of the aquarium on the broad lawns behind the grandstand. This time the bird was up and pacing the quarters he shares with some scarlet macaws. He wasn't the healthiestlooking fowl in this gaudy preserve, but at least he was on his feet. So much for symbolism.

title: Telephone Building Continues Brooklyn Renaissance
description: City and community leaders joined yesterday in dedicating a $20million, eightstory, glass and aluminum New York Telephone Company building as one more structure completed in an accelerating effort to make over downtown Brooklyn.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Prices effectiv?? ?? March 8 in A & P Stores in Bronx, Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester Co. Not responsible for typographical errors. Detergents not sold in Suffolk Cty. Items offered for sale are not available in case lots

title: ...Overtime Strike
description: While tens of thousands of their fellow New Yorkers are without work, 900 union drivers at The Daily News have been on an illegal strike to protest new work schedules that will cost them A little of the overtime pay premiums to which they have become accustomed. Even imposition last night of a $100,1100 fine for contempt of a state judge's backtowork order failed to end this cruel and selfish tieup.

title: New Headmaster at Trinity School
description: Dr. Robin Lester, chairman of history and social sciences at the Collegiate School, has been named the headmaster of the Trinity School, a 266yearold institution that is the city's oldest continuously operated school.

title: Dance: Two by Arpino
description: Violence came in two sizes last night at the City Center 55th Street Theater, where the Joffrey Ballet gave the first performances this season of two Gerald Amino ballets; Valentine and The Clowns. Valentine tells of a sexist boxing match, while, with escalating violence, The Clowns describes the aftermath of an atomic doomsday.

title: Utah Ski Jumpers First in N.C.A.A.
description: DURANGO, Colo., March 4 (AP)Ron Steele led the University of Utah to the team jumping title today at the National Collegiate ski championships.

title: Ethiopia's Military Orders TakeOver Of All Rural Land
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, March 4 (Reuters)Ethiopia's military rulers today nationalized all rural land in their most farreaching move so far toward turning Ethiopia into a radical socialist state.

title: Fruit Juice Peril Held Cut
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) Responding to a report by Ralph Nader's Health Research Group, the National Canners Association said today that lead contamination had been cut by half in baby fruit juices marketed within the last half year.

title: COUNCIL BILL AIDS WALKER CHILDREN
description: In a somber session yesterday, the City Council quickly and unanimously passed an amendment to the Good Samaritan law that would immediately benefit six orphans whose 28yearold father was killed last Jan. 29 while trying to help a police officer subdue a prisoner.

title: On the Edge Of Uncertainty
description: AMMAN, JordanKing Hussein of Jordan is personally more involved with the question of ArabIsraeli peace than any other Arab chief of state for the simple reason, as he puts it, that four generations of his family have been linked directly to Jerusalem.

title: Notes on People
description: Instead of kneeling before Queen Elizabeth II to be knighted yesterday, Sir Charles Chaplin sat in his wheelchair. But he stood up for God Save the Queen at the end of the long ceremony for 120 men and women who were on the traditional New Year's Honors list. With him were his wife, the former Oona O'Neill, and their two youngest children, Annie, 15, and Christopher, 12. Later he said, I would like to be known as Sir Charles, not Sir Charlie.

title: REPEAL OF TAX AID FOR OIL HITS SNAG
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The Senate Finance Committee took a major step today toward separating the controversial and emotional issue of repeal of the oil depletion allowance from, the antirecession taxcut bill.

title: Bitterness Erupts Over News Layoffs
description: There are about 500 people who gather and edit the news at The Daily News and yesterday afternoon, even before the job furlough became official, many of them were on the telephone telling their families that they were about to join the unemployed.

title: HOSPITAL INSURER RAISING RATE 189%
description: The insurance company that unsuccessfully sought to raise physicians' malpractice premiums by 196.8 per cent last December has now notified the 63 hospitals it insures throughout the state that their malpractice premiums are being raised an average of 189 per cent on March 15, according to the state's Department of Insurance.

title: JEWISH WOMEN VOW DRIVE FOR ABORTION
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 4The National Women's Division of the American Jewish Congress vowed today to work for free access to abortion for all women.

title: Notes on People
description: Chaplin Sees Queen; He's Now Sir Charles

title: State Adhering to U.S. Job Plan for Minorities Here
description: The State Labor Commissioner, Louis L. Levine, has ordered all state agencies that finance construction in New York City to abide by a Federal plan for hiring minorities in the construction trades for the next three months, while the state prepares its own permanent policy.

title: REPEAL OF TAX AID FOR OIL HITS SNAG
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The Senate Finance Committee took a major step today toward separating the controversial and emotional issue of repeal of the oil depletion allowance from the antirecession taxcut bill.

title: QAWWALI MUSIC STIRS AUDIENCE
description: Even within the confines of the devotees of ethnic arts, Qawwali music from Pakistan is not very well known here. But the performance of it by the Sabri Brothers' troupe Monday night at Carnegie Hall was a fascinating experience. And for some of the Pakistanis in the audience and one in particular, rather more than that.

title: PRESIDENT VETOES OIL IMPORT BILL; DELAYS OWN PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 President Ford announced today that he would postpone for 60 days the two final stages of his oil import tax to encourage Congress to work out a compromise energy program by May 1 and to move faster on a cut in income taxes as a spur to the lagging economy.

title: Congress Presses for 900,000 New Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Congress began action today on a plan to create 900,000 more public service jobs, as the Labor Department reported that only half the 300,000 jobs already funded had been filled.

title: Carey Is Reworking Plans To Aid High Schools More
description: ALBANY, Mar. 4Governor Carey retreated somewhat tonight from his original state budget propsl and said he was reworking schoolaid formulas to provide more, assistance to secondary schools.

title: Stock Trading Soars
description: Trading on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday reached the second highest level in history34.14 million shares. Prices closed at their highest point since Aug. 12. The highest volume  35.16 million shareswas reached Feb. 13. Page 53.

title: ORTHODOX TO REJOIN SYNAGOGUE COUNCIL
description: The Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations of America has decided to resume participation in the Synagogue Council of America along with the Reform and Conservative branches of Judaism.

title: West Berlin Elections
description: Social Democratic losses in the West Berlin elections are likely to prove less important locally than in their effect on the West German political scene, where Chancellor Helmut Schmidt has been seeking to stem a tide of Christian Democratic victories over the past year in state and municipal elections. Another test is coming Sunday in the state of RhinelandPalatinate.

title: Advertising
description: William T. Gladmon, director of development of television station WETA in Washington, recently returned to public television after a sixyear absence. The big change he's noticed is that now when he makes a pitch to a corporation he no longegr needs to explain what public television is.

title: Toros Down Blades, 64
description: TORONTO, March 4 (UPI)Vaclav Nedonansky scored his 34th and 35th goals and made a brilliant pass to set up Frank Mahovlich with his 32d in leading the Tronto Toros to a 64 victory over the Baltimore Blades tonight in a World Hockey Association game.

title: HAROLD C. STRAIT
description: Harold C. Strait, who was first vice president in the metropolitan banking department of the Bankers Trust Company at his retirement in 1967, died Monday evening in Rhode Island Hospital, Providence. He was 71 years old and lived in Little Compton, R.I., and had formerly lived in Montclair, N.J.

title: Court Holds Appeals Are Valid On PleaBargained Sentences
description: TRENTON, March 4 (UPI)The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled today that criminals who pleaded guilty in an effort to gain a light jail sentence had the right to appeal when the punishment was worse than they had expected.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: WRITERS' POLL

title: SHOP TALK
description: Hazel Mallory, a 70year old Chicagoan, has become so adept at making toy animals she can turn out a sizable pink elephant overnight. She is one of a group of 150 women, average age 75, who crochet and stuff whole menagerie of cuddly animals to be sold under the Elder Artisans of Chicago label.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Marichal Accepts A Dodger Tryout
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 4 (UPI)The Los Angeles Dodgers have invited Juan Marichal to a spring training tryout. The 37yearold pitcher, who was made a free agent by the Boston Red Sox last year, will accept the comeback challenge, although he is still bothered by a back ailment that has plagued him most of his career.

title: REBATES A HELP ON SALES OF CARS
description: DETROIT, March 4United States auto makers continued to register increases in new car sales in late February as buyers sought to beat the deadline on rebates, but deliveries were still below even the depressed levels of 1974. The rebate program ended last Friday for all companies except the Chrysler Corporation and was replaced by reductions in posted prices for some models.

title: $87Million Aid Program Urged for Public Housing
description: ALBANY, March 4Directors of five of the state's largest public housing authorities called on the Legislature today to enact a $87million program to stem the deterioration of public housing and to meet rapidly rising costs of fuel and utilities.

title: Boumediene Proposes a Broad Oil Deal With the West
description: ALGIERS, March 4  President Houari Boumediene of Aiigeria said today that oilexporting countries should offer to decrease prices if industrial countries were prepared to reorganize the world economy for the benefit of the poorer, developing nations.

title: VESCO ENDS DEFENSE IN I.O.S. FRAUD CASE
description: NEWARK, March 4 (UPI)A lawyer for Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, says his client will not proceed with a defense against charges of defrauding a company's stockholders of $5.5million.

title: Industrial Diversity Helping Midwest Fight Recession
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 4 The ripples from the nation's depressed automotive and construction industries are beginning to wash over the Middle West at a quicker pace as unemployment in the major cities of this region rises.

title: Tocks Island Study Cites Water Pollution Dangers
description: TRENTON, March 4A $1.1million review for Congress of the Tocks Island dam proposal has found that the 37milelong reservoir that the dam would create would probably be too polluted to allow such recreational activities as swimming and boating.

title: Will It Be Full Dresses or Narrow Or Back to Living in Jeans?
description: Behind the glossy pictures in the magazines and the blarney in the ads, there is confusion in the world of fashion. For the first time in years, it doesn't center around hemlines, which are securely anchored below the knees.

title: Favorites Advance In Hockey
description: ITHACA, N.Y., March 4The favorites advanced tonight in the first round of the Eastern College Athletic Conference hockey playoffs, but not easily. Boston University, the defender, was forced into overtime at home before beating Brown, 54, while Vermont overcame a 52 Providence lead with five goals late in the third period to win, 75.

title: Article 3  No Title
Vionnet, Couturier, Dies at 98; Innovator Created the Bias Cut
description: PARIS, March 4 Madeleine Vionnet, the couturier who invented the revolutionary bias cut that gave a new fluidity to women's fashions, died here Sunday in her home. She was 98 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: President Paul O'Dwyer of the City Council, charging that the city's banks were exercising the power of life and death over our municipal institutions, urged that their lending practices be investigated by a special Council committee. He also suggested that it be made possible for the public to buy city notes directly from the Controller's office and that these purchases be guaranteed by the Federal Government under an agency resembling the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

title: AID FOR CAMBODIA SUFFERS SETBACK IN A HOSE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, March 4The Administration's proposal for $222million in emergency military aid for Cambodia received a serious setback today when a House Appropriations subcommittee delayed action on the request.

title: Yaphank Beginning to Feel Growing Pains of Suburbia
description: YAPHANK, L. I., March 4 No one here wants to admit it, but the rural, leisurely past of this small hamlet is finished, gone forever, another victim of suburban growth.

title: U.S. Tanker Port Opposed by Canada
description: ST. ANDREWS, New BrunswickThis easternmost area on the long friendly border between Canada and the United States has become the focus of a diplomatic dispute that is causing concern in both Ottawa and Washington.

title: Bolshoi Opera Opens 4Week Run at Met June 25
description: The Bolshoi Opera, in its first visit to the United States, will open a fourweek season at the Metropolitan Opera House on June 25 with its production of Mussorgsky's Boris Godunov.

title: Resolution on Fed
description: The House of Representatives resolved, 367 to 55, yesterday to direct the Federal Reserve Board to increase the nation's money supply to lower longterm interest rates. Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Fed, strongly opposes Congress's involvement in monetary policy. Page 58.

title: NEW WARNING ON OIL IS LAID TO KISSINGER
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) Secretary of State Kissinger told freshmen Democrats in Congress today that the United States could be faced with surrendering to, or using force against, oil producing countries, one of the freshmen said.

title: International Harvester To Contest Antitrust Suit
description: The International Harvester Company declared yesterday that it would contest a Government civil antitrust suit stemming from the concern's acquisition of a 39 per cent interest recently in Steiger Tractor, Inc.

title: New Brunswick's Mounties Unhorsed
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, March 4 Yesterday, this was a onehorse town. Today it surrendered the distinction, along with the horse.

title: Berlin Politician Freed
description: Peter Lorenz, kidnapped West Berlin politician, was released after the West German Government freed five imprisoned radicals. Page 12.

title: Yaphank Beginning to Feel Growing Pains of Suburbia
description: YAPHANK, L. I., March 4 No one here wants to admit it, but the rural, leisurely past of this small hamlet is finished, gone forever, another victim of suburban growth.

title: Text of Ford Statement on Oil Tariffs
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP)Following is the text of a statement President Ford read to newsmen today announcing his veto of legislation suspending oil tariff increases and disclosing the postponment of the tariffs??

title: Bruins Crush Capitals, 80
description: LANDOVER ,Md., March 4 (UPI)Gilles Gilbert turned in his third shutout of the season as the Boston Bruins trounced the Washington Capitals, 80, in a National Hockey League game tonight. Gilbert stopped 27 Washington shots.

title: Price of Gold Slips
description: BRUSSELS, March 4 (UPI)The dollar recovered today from record lows in Amsterdam and Brussels to close higher on European foreign exchanges. The price of gold fell.

title: 3 SENATORS URGE U.S. TIES TO CUBA
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Three Senators called on the Ford Administration today to normalize relations with Cuba.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: About the Knicks . . .
description: The Boston Celtics have beaten the Knicks five straight games. Their victory margins have been 10, 26, 17, 18 and 15 points. This is the first time since the 196667 season that Boston has been able to win five in a row from the Knicks. . . . Two of the Knicks' 16 remaining games are against the Celtics, reducing the Knicks chances for a wildcard playoff berth even more. . . . The brightest note i the Knick defeat was the career high of 20 points by Dennis Bell. He got 18 in the second half. . . . When Jo Jo White the Celtics picked up his third foul with 4:17 remaining in the first period, the Knick fans thought it was a break and applauded. White was replaced by Paul Westphal, who contributed 11 points in the second quarter. . . . Bill Bradley was $50 poorer. He was charged with one of his rare technical fouls of his career with 5:43 remaining in the first quarter.

title: About the Yankees . . .
description: They had faced each other during exhibition games, but Jim (Catfish) Hunter pitched to Bob?? Bonds for the first time since both became Yankees. Bonds Aft two batting practice home runsone over the rightcenterfield fence and the other over the leftfield fence at the practice field behind the main field. In all, Bonds had what could be considered six hits in 25 pitches. He fouled off four pitches, took seven and hit the other eight for outs. . . . He's a superb batting practice pitcher, Bonds pronounced afterward. He doesn't try to overpower you, but he throws the ball at an adequate speed so you can work on your timing. He also moves the ball around. He also would make an expensive batting practice pitcher. . . . Walt Williams and Otto Velez agreed to terms and arrived in camp, giving the Yankees a full complement of players.

title: Food Stamps Draw Miami Beach Outcry
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 4In a striking demonstration of the puzzling nature of the current recession, the poor gathered here today in a steamy community center to bemoan the inadequacies of food stamps while record numbers of the rich frolicked in the cool azure pools at Gold Coast resorts.

title: EQUAL RIGHTS VOTE DELAYED IN ILLINOIS
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., March 4  A resolution to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment in the Illinois State Senate was postponed today when the sponsor said she did not have the votes to pass it.

title: Unemployment Outlook
description: The historian Henry Adams, famous for his view that the most underestimated force in history is stupidity, once remarked that practical policy in government ordinarily consists of ignoring the facts. But for economic policy makers, the problem is knowing what the facts really are and putting them in perspective.

title: Geological Survey Is Scored by G.A.O. On Aides' Holdings
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI) Congessional investigators charged today that some officials of the United States Geological Survey owned stock in companies holding mineral leases on Federal lands administered by the agency.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, March 4, 1975

title: U.S. HOPING TO SPUR OPIUM PRODUCTION
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)An Agriculture Department official told Congress today that the United States could expand its opium production to the point where it would not have to rely on imports to meet the nation's medical needs.

title: 2 U.S. Aides Back Suicide Note Saying C.A.B. Chief Cut Off Politics Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The acting chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board closed the investigations into illegal potical contributions by several airlines while he was chief of the board's Bureau of Enforcement, two independent government officials said today.

title: Fonda, With Pacemaker, Is Back as Darrow
description: A year ago Henry Fonda opened on Broadway in David W. Rintels's oneman play, Clarence Darrow, and received the kind of reviews that actors dream about. Audiences responded with enthusiasm and standing ovations.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Ousts A Cabinet Minister, Deepening Tension
description: NEW DELHI, March 4Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has abruptly dismissed an outspoken Cabinet official, stirring controversy in the capital and deepening the tensions in the dominant Congress party.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: The State Department of Agriculture and Markets has allowed many supermarkets here and across the state a respite of several months, and in some cases until next September, from compliance with the new unitpricing law.

title: West Berlin Political Leader Released After Bonn Meets Kidnappers' Demands
description: BERLIN, March 5  Peter Lorenz, the kidnapped head of West Berlin's Christian Democratic party, was released at midnight, six hours after the West German Government had fulfilled the demands made by his leftist abductors.

title: London Subway Toll Now 41
description: LONDON, March 4 (UPI) Four days after London's worst subway disaster, recovery teams pulled 15 more bodies from the wreckage today and reported that the death toll totaled 41.

title: IRAN WILL SPEND $15BILLION IN U.S. OVER FIVE YEARS
description: WASHINGTON, March 4The United States and Iran announced today the signing of a major economic agreement that commits Iran to spend about $15billion on American goods and services over the next five years.

title: Jersey Skier Dies in Storm On Slopes of Mount Blanc
description: CHAMONIX, France, March 4 (AP)A sudden storm on Mont Blanc caught a group of skiers on the mountain slopes yesterday afternoon and one American died after reaching safety at a cable car station during the night.

title: TALKS ON TRADE START IN GENEVA
description: GENEVA, March 4 The first intensive international effort to remove through collective bargaining major impediments to trade other than tariffs was begun today in the framework of the new round of multinational trade talks.

title: Rhodesia Jails a Black Leader; Parleys Broken Off in Response
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March 4Rhodesia arrested one of the country's top black leaders today, and the main black political group broke off talks with the white minority Government until he was freed.

title: Carey Is Reworking Plans To Aid High Schools More
description: ALBANY, Mar. 4Governor Carey retreated somewhat tonight from his original state budget proposal and said he was reworking schoolaid formulas to provide more assistance to secondary schools.

title: Market Place
description: It seems that investors are discovering that the stock market's verities aren't as eternal as they once were.

title: CORRECTION
description: Due to an editing error, an article in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly identified Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York as a Democrat. Mr. Javits is a RepublicanLiberal.

title: ExOyster Bay Official Found Not Guilty
description: MINEOLA, L. L, March (UPI)Gerard P. Trotta, former Oyster Bay Town Public Works Commissioner, was found not guilty tonight of three misdemeanor charges of official misconduct.

title: Books of The Times
description: As a 90yearold celebrity, Samuel Lumen finds that hi n fame is a death mask. He has been framed by history. He has no right, his admirers would say, to contradict his obituary, which, of course, is already on file. It would be vandalism to deface or shatter the monument his life's work has become.

title: Macmillan Appoints Regina Ryan as Editor
description: Regina Ryan, for the last eight years a top editor at Alfred A. Knopf, Inc., has been named editor in chief of all general or adult, books at the Macmillan Publishing Company. Miss Ryan, who is 36 years old, will assume her post March 31. Additionally, she was elected vice president of the company's general hook division.

title: PRICE CEILING ASKED ON DOMESTIC CRUDE
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The Senate Interior Committee approved today a bill that would put a ceiling on the price of domestic crude oil that has been exempt from price controls.

title: Colby Oral FillIn to Ford On Assassination Reported
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 William E. Colby, Director of Central Intelligence, reported orally to President Ford about several plans for assassinating foreigners in which the agency had been involved, rather than including the information in his written report to the President, informed sources said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: Due to an editing error, an article in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly identified Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York as a Democrat. Mr. Javits is a RepublicanLiberal.

title: Racing Opposes Federal Control
description: WASHINGTON, March 4Horseracing may need some kind of Federal regulation unless state governments stop treating it merely as a source of tax revenue, the industry's top spokesmen conceded today.

title: Senator Allen Blocks Effort To Change Filibuster Rule
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)Senator lames B. Allen, DeMocrat of Alabama, using the Lord's Prayer and one from St. Francis of Assisi, blocked an effort today to speed action on a change in the antifilibuster rule.

title: God and the Holocaust Is Debated Here
description: Where was God during the Nazi extermination of the Jews?

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP)The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation announced today that it had repaid $134million of the $1.72billion owed the Federal Reserve when the Franklin National Bank failed in October.

title: Corcoran American Art Biennial Is Uneven
description: WASHINGTON  In the period immediately after World War II it seemed as if the world could no more keep turning without biennial art exibitions than a Montgolfier balloon can keep, aloft without hot air.

title: Hughie and Duet to Close
description: The double bill of the short plays Hughie, by Eugene O'Neill, and Duet, by David Scott Milton, both starring Ben Gazzara, will end its run at the Golden Theater on Saturday after 31 performances. Sharing the stage with Mr. Gazzara in Hughie is Peter Maloney as the night clerk. Jay Julien produced the plays and Martin Fried directed.

title: Bombs Kill 4 in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 4 (AP)Several bombs exploded while being transported in the back of a car near the northern city of Tucumn and killed at least four persons today, police sources said.

title: TV Action Group for Children Gets $165,000 Grant to Grow
description: Action for Children's Television (ACT); one of the leading groups working towards reforms in broadcasting, yesterday announced it had received a grant of $165,000 from the Carnegie Corporation of New York. The grant is to be used for the development of local chapters and for a national fundraising campaign.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BALTIMORE, March 4 (AP)Unbeaten Foolish Pleasure heads a score of stakeswinners on the list of 206 thoroughbred 3yearolds nominated for the 100th running of the $150,000 added Preakness Stakes at Pimlico Race Course on May 17.

title: Hearst Dauaiter Held on Drug Count
description: BUFFALO, March 4Anne Randolph Hearst, the 19yearold younger sister of Patricia C. Hearst, was arrested on a drug charge by customs agents in Niagara Fails, N. Y., yesterday afternoon after she drove across the Rainbow Bridge from Canada with two friends.

title: Byrne Names Weintraub To Head a Study of S.C.I.
description: TRENTON, March 4Governor Byrne said today that he had appointed Joseph Weintraub, former Chief Justice o?? the New Jersey State Supreme Court, to head a study of the embattled State Commission of Investigation.

title: Norton Knocks Out Brooks in Warmup
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 4 (UPI)  Ken Norton, a heavyweight contender from San Diego, stepped back and landed a headsnapping left and right to the jaw of Reco Brooks of Phoenix tonight to score a knockout in 1 minute 34 seconds of the first round.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: ANCHOR HOCKING TO BUY AMEROCK
description: The Stanley Works said yesterday at New Britain, Conn., that a definitive purchase agreement had been signed Feb. 28 for the Anchor Hocking Corporation to purchase Stanley's subsidiary, the Amerock Corporation, for cash and notes totaling $32million. The sale is subject to approval by the Federal Trade Commission and the Canadian Government because of the 1974 Foreign Investment Review Act of Canada. The Stanley Works is a leading manufacturer of hardware products, while Amerock produces cabinet and decorative hardware in plants at Rockford and Winnebago, III., and Meaford, Ontario.

title: About New York
description: Before the luncheon began, the speaker said that he was sure the first question anyone would ask would be about Judge Bruce Wright, and that after that it would be something about plea bargaining. He was wrong, because the first question was about court personnel, and nobody mentioned plea bargaining at all. The audience was too sophisticated for all that.

title: GULF & WESTERN WIDENS EARNINGS
IRAN WILL SPEND $15BILLION IN U.S. OVER FIVE YEARS
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The United States and Iran announced today the signing of a major economic agreement that commits Iran to spend about $15billion on American goods and services over the next five years.

title: $20Million Telephone Building Latest in Brooklyn Renaissance
description: City and community leaders joined yesterday in dedicating a $20million, eight story, glass and aluminum New York Telephone Company building as one more structure completed in an accelerating effort to make over downtown Brooklyn.

title: McCaffrey & McCall Chosen by Kennecott
description: Having looked over 10 advertising agencies, the Kennecott Copper Corporation has selected McCaffrey & McCall to do some research and recommend how advertising might fit into the corporation's overall communications objectives.

title: Hunter's Debut: On Road or at Home?
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 4The Yankee script writers' dream could turn out to be only thata dream.

title: Article 2  No Title
In Defense Of Kissinger: An Aide Replies
description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet Skater Dominates School Figures
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, March 4 (AP)Sergei Volkov of the Soviet Union held a commanding lead after his specialty today in the opening round of the men's competition at the world figure skating championships.

title: 2 NAMED AS EVADING TAXES ON $4MILLION
description: Two former registered stockbrokers were indicted here yesterday on charges of evading taxes on $4million in personal income from 1968 through 1972.

title: PARTIES DEAD LOCK ON 3 REGENTS JOBS
description: ALBANY, March 4An attempt to fashion a bipartisan list of three nominees to the Board of Regents, the state's education policymaking board, collapsed today, and Republicans and Democrats picked opposing slates.

title: U.S. CARRIER IS PART OF EVACUATION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The helicopter carrier Okinawa, with several hundred marines aboard, has been in the vicinity of the Gulf of Thailand for several weeks in case it is necessary to evacuate American civilians from Phnom Penh, a Defense Department source said today.

title: THOMAS TODARELLI
description: Thomas J. Todarelli, a lawyer and a former assistant United States attorney here, died Monday at French Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 161 West 16th Street.

title: Colby Oral FillIn to Ford On Assassination Reported
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 William E. Colby, Director of Central Intelligence, reported orally to President Ford about several plans for assassinating foreigners in which the agency had been involved, rather than including the information in his written report to the President, informed sources said today.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Senate told the State Supreme Court yesterday the best decision it could make on the controversial schoolaid issue would be to stay out of it. In a brief filed with the court by the Senate counsel, David J. Goldberg, the Senate argued that the schoolaid issue involved decisions which are not judicial in nature.

title: In Memoriam
description: FROELICHBetty. In loving memory. Sisters, Brother and Children.

title: Outdoors, $12.40, Captures Closing Feature at Hialeah
Stocks Up as Volume Surges; Dow Is Highest Since Aug. 12
description: Trading on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday soared to the second highest level in history. Prices ended with only moderate gains but at the highest point in six and a half months.

title: Celtics Subdue Knicks, 126111
description: The Boston Celtics turned Madison Square Garden into a disaster area for the Knicks last night. While the capacity crowd of 19,694 booed and chided, Put in the second team, the Celtics battered the Knicks. 126111.

title: CONDON JAZZ CLUB OPENS IN MID TOWN
description: Eddie Condon, who epitomized jazz in New York for more than three decades until his death in 1973, returned to town in spirit last night when a new jazz club called Eddie Condon's opened at 144 West 54th Street.

title: Bronx Baker Is Seized in Death Of Prostitute, 15, on East Side
description: A 30 yearold Bronx baker who is married and the father of two children was arrested yesterday and charged with strangling Karen Baxter, a 15yearold prostitute, in an East Side hotel room less than two weeks ago, the police reported.

title: AID FOR CAMBODIA SUFFERS SETBACK IN A HOUSE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The Administration's proposal for $222million in emergency military aid for Cambodia received a serious setback today when a House Appropriations subcommittee delayed action on the request.

title: Ford Aides Fight Senate Bill With Plan To Control Foreign Investment in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 4The Ford Administration today opposed a bill that would give the President power to bar foreign investment in this country. The opposition was expressed at Senate hearings that opened at a time of growing controversy over Arab investing in this country and Arab restrictions against Jewish investment interests.

title: Public Support Is Pushing Congress Toward Gun Control Law
description: WASHINGTON, March 4As a result of growing support from the public, the police and legislators, Congress is pushing harder toward passing some type of Federal gun control this session.

title: PRESIDENT VETOES OIL IMPORT BILL; DELAYS OWN PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 President Ford announced today that he would postpone for 60 days the two final stages of his oil import tax to encourage Congress to work out a compromise energy program by May 1 and to move faster on a cut in income taxes as a spur to the lagging economy.

title: Auto Sulphate Emissions Facing Limit
description: In a move that threatens the future of the catalytic converters being installed on most new cars to curb pollution, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency will announce today his intention to put forward a standard limiting sulphate emissions.

title: Manhattan Holds Off Seton Hall
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., March 4Manhattan College stalled Seton Hall University's late rally tonight and triumphed, 7169, before a rapacity crowd of 3,300. It left the Pirates with a 169 wonlost record and Manhattan at 1311.

title: TOKYO TALKS GO ON TOWARD CHINA PACT
description: TOKYO, March 4  Japan's Deputy Foreign Minister met today with the Chinese Ambassador to continue their negotiations on a treaty of peace and friendship. Japanese officials said they expected agreement within a few weeks.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 5, 1975

title: Daily News Is Laying Off 2,500 in Delivery Strike
description: The Daily News, the largestcirculation daily newspaper in the country, said yesterday that it would suspend publication today and begin laying off more than half of its 5,000 employes as drivers and deliverers continued a wildcat strike that has halted the tabloid's operations for the last three days.

title: U.S. Cuts Interest Rates On Crop Support Loans
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)The Agriculture Department announced today it would slash interest rates on its crop support loans for farmers by 34 per cent.

title: About The Mets . . .
description: Bob Gallagher, outfielder acquired from the Houston Astros, got two fingers caught in the piping of the batting cage and suffered cuts on his left hand. . . . Jerry Koosman is having a little problem with his hack, but Yogi Berra says he always gets that in the spring. A heating pad was prescribed. . . . Cleon Jones tapes his knee now and will switch back to a brace later, but insists he feels no pain from the operation last October to repair cartilege. They had us running around the bases today instead of straight ahead, he said, and it felt fine on the turns.

title: Study of Tocks Island Proposal Cites Water Pollution Dangers
description: TRENTON, March 4A $1.1million review for Congress of the Tocks Island dam proposal has found that the 37milelong reservoir that the dam would create would probably be too polluted to allow such recreational activities as swimming and boating.

title: YOUTH FOUND GUILTY IN KILLING TEXAS BOY
description: HOUSTON, March 4. (AP)A jury convicted David Owen Brooks today of killing a 15yearold youth, one of 27 victims between 13 and 20 of homosexual  torture murders over a threeyear period.

title: AVERAGE WHITE BAND COPIES DISCO SOUNDS
description: The Average White Band's concert at Avery Fisher Hall Monday nightits first here since the death of its original drummer and the charttopping success of its latest single and albumwas an obvious hit with the audience.

title: Hoving Takes Over At Queens Museum
description: Thomas P. F. Hoeing, director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, has agreed to serve as interim director of the crisisridden Queens Museum.

title: TV: Carol Burnett Takes On Four Roles in Twigs
description: If nothing else, Twigs is unpretentious. On the other hand, it has very little to be pretentious about. On Broadway, George Furth's play starred Sada Thompson in its four loosely connected acts. For television, tomorrow evening on CBS at 9, Mr. Furth has evidently tailored his script to the broader style of Carol Burnett. The TV directors are Alan Arkin and Clark Jones. The producer is Joe Hamilton, husband of Miss Burnett.

title: 1,077th Orbit for Saylut
description: MOSCOW, March 4 (Reuters) The Soviet Union's Salyut4 space station, home for 30 days this year to two Russian astronauts, has made 1,077 orbits of the earth, the official press egency Tass said today.

title: REINSTATEMENT OF PUPIL ORDERED
description: A New Jersey Superior Court judge yesterday ordered Hillside High School in Union, County to readmit a girl who had been suspended from classes since Jan. 13 for allegedly fighting with another student. The order also directed the school to provide special inschool academic instruction to help the girl make up missed work.

title: Berkeley Plan Could End Hiring Bias in 30 Years
description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 4A four  inch  thick document made public here recently gives the details of the way the University of California, Berkeley, plank to eliminate discriminatory hiring practices during the next 30 years by filling at least 178 faculty positions with women and members of minorities.

title: G.E.SNECMA Deal: U.S.French Dispute Is Obscured
description: VILLAROCHE, France, Feb. 23The crates from the United States are stored behind a huge metal door that can be opened only with a magnetized passcard.

title: Byrne Breaks Ground for Hartz Mountain Complex
description: SECAUCUS, March 4 Governor Byrne, some of his Cabinet members, labor leaders and officials of Hartz Mountain Industries, Inc., broke ground this afternoon for a major new residential community scheduled to rise from the east bank of the Hackensack River here.

title: BOSTON SCHOOL VOTE CHALLENGED IN SUIT
description: BOSTON, March 4 (AP)Charging that it is almost impossible for a black to become a member of the Boston School Committee, two lawyers' groups filed suit today to change the process by which committee members are elected.

title: Simon Assails Tax Bill
description: Treasury Secretary Simon criticized the Housepassed tax cut bill, arguing that it should give more relief to persons earning over $10,000 a year. Page 27.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Total February Car Sales Up by 218 From 1974 Month
