description: DETROIT, March 5Final Ford Motor Company newcar sales figures for February released today were enough to push the sales total of domestic and imported cars for the month past the same period a year ago.

title: Cordero Back in Form With 3 Winners
description: The commonplace happened at Aqueduct again yesterday  Angel Cordero rode three winners. The happy Puerto Rican rider raced in six of the nine races on the card, but he started slowly. He finished off the board in the first race and third in the second, then returned to competition to win the sixth on Real Supreme at $6.20, the seventh on Joanne's Fling at $4.80 and the ninth on Turn to Bo at $6.60.

title: MigrantCrew Chief Accused at Trial
description: WOODBURY, March 5Assemblyman Byron M. Baer, a Bergen County Democrat, testired here today that a migrantcrew foreman hit him with a club and broke an arm last summer when the legislator attemped to meet with migrant workers on the farm.

title: Music
description: Someone at Lincoln Center had a happy thought in deciding to bring the New York Philharmonic and the center's Chamber Music Society together for the MiniFestival Around Schubert, which got under way on Tuesday at Avery Fisher Hall. Much of the music that influenced Schubert and much of the music by composers influenced by him (not to mention the music of Schubert himself) lies outside the orchestral sphere, and may best be represented by crackerjack chamberprofessionals.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CASTING CALL When it comes to weighty subjects, there is little to compare to cast iron. But to devotees of cast iron architecture, ?? dominated American ??mercial architecture throughout the latter half of the last century, talk of ?? work apparently falls ?? upon the ear. That, at least, is the conclusion of Friends of Cast Iron Architecture, the fiveyearold organization that, as its name suggests, is the magnet hereabouts for those susceptible to collective appreciation of this particular art form. Although the organization's activities incline toward the peripateticwalking tours among the city's 190 ironfront buildings are a regular featurethe conclusion is based on the standing  room  only turnouts in past years for the Friends' Annual Cast Iron Lecture.

title: Rise and Fall of a Wall Street Comet
description: Berel Weinstein was a spellbinding boy wonder from Brooklyn, an ungainly, sometimes sickly youth who composed music, wrote poetry and collected mechanical toys. He was also one of the comets that occasionally orbit Wall Street, scintillating promotional flair, and then disappear.

title: General Foods Expanding
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 5 (UPI)The General Foods Corporation said today it would build a $20million plant in Modesto, Calif., to increase output of Post breakfast cereals. The plant will employ 150 when completed in the fall of 1976.

title: Music: Haydn Seasons
description: Although the two big oratorios Haydn composed in the last years of his life are staples of the choral repertory, performances of them are not annual occurrences in our concert halls, and performances of both within a few days of each other are rare.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Tomorrow, March 7

title: ExRep. Joseph P. O'Hara Of Minnesota Is Dead at 80
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) Joseph P. O'Hara, who represented Minnesota's Second District for 18 years before his retirement in 1959, died yesterday. He was 80 years old.

title: Bullets Win, Raise Home Streak to 22
description: LANDOVER, Md., March 5 (AP)Elvin Hayes tossed in 30 points and Phil Chenier added 28 tonight as the Washington Bullets rolled to their 22d straight National Basketball Association victory, at home, downing the Atlanta Hawks. 118112.

title: Privacy vs. the Press: The Issue Remains
description: The right to privacy  perhaps the most cherished right of allis guaranteed, but more and more lately it is coming into conflict in the courts with the press's First Amendment right to freely report news. This week the Supreme Court ruled, in a rape case, that newspapers a n d radio stations could not be subjected to either criminal prosecution or civil damage suits for reporting accurate information available from law enforcement records. But only time and more cases will tell how broadly the Court intended to apply that ruling.

title: G.O.P. Panel Splits on Party Reform
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Republican National Committee adjourned in turmoil tonight after failing to resolve a bitterly divisive question of party reform.

title: Simon Assails Tax Bill
description: Treasury Secretary Simon criticized the Housepassed tax cut bill, arguing that it should give more relief to persons earning over $10,000 a year. Page 27.

title: Needham, Harper Set To Be Amtrak Agency
description: Needham, Harper & Steers, the former agency for the United States Postal Service. was named yesterday the agency for Amtrak, the Governmentfinanced operator of most passenger railroads.

title: C.I.A. Opened Bella Abzug's Mail, Kept 20Year File
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The Central Intelligence Agency acknowledged today that it maintained a dossier for more than 20 years on Bella S. Abzug that included the contents of letters she had written on behalf of clients while she was a practicing lawyer.

title: Steel Union Grows
description: PITTSBURGH, March 5 (UPI) I. W. Abel, president of the United Steelworkers of America, said today that his union enrolled 26,218 members in 1974, pushing membership to well over 1.4 million members in 5,200 locals in the United States, Canada and Puerto Rico.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, MARCH 6, 1975

title: News Parley by Ford On Live TV Tonight
description: President Ford's news conference tonight at 7:30 in Washington will be broadcast live by the three television networks  CBS, NBC and ABC.

title: GAS PRICE RISE OUTPOLLS RATION
description: If Americans were forced to choose between paying 10 cents more for a gallon of gasoline or being limited to 10 gallons of gasoline a week, more would accept the higher price, according to a Gallup poll made public yesterday.

title: Canadiens Extend Road Streak to 21
description: ATLANTA, March 5 (AP) Steve Shutt scored two goals tonight in leading Montreal to a 43 victory over the Atlanta Flames. The victory extended the Canadiens' National Hockey League record string of unbeaten road games to 21.

title: CocaCola Net Falls 21.5% in Quarter
Mideast Nation, Thought to Be Kuwait, Buying Stock in Japan's Nippon Steel
description: TOKYO, March 5  In the first Middle East investment in Japanese stock that has become publicly known, an oilproducing countryevidently Kuwait has bought 5 million shares in the Nippon Steel Corporation, informed securities sources disclosed today. These shares of Nippon, Japan's largest industrial concern and the world's largest steel maker, are worth $2.5million.

title: TV: Katharine Hepburn and Olivier in a Comedy
description: Starring Katharine Hepburn and Laurence Olivier in their first production together, directed by George Cukor and written by James Costigan, Love Among the Ruins is a project almost begging to be irresistible. Unfortunately, as can be seen on ABCTV at 9 this evening, it's not. Occasionally, the twohour romantic comedy, set in 1911, slips from its ambitions of charming stylishness into mere silliness. Very occasionally, it becomes a bit of a bore.

title: U.S.Soviet Film a Musical Dtente
description: LENINGRAD  Elizabeth Taylor was down with the flu. Jane Fonda was telling the Soviet press about the war in Indochina. Cicely Tyson was reported running low on health food, and Maya Plisetskaya was wondering why she was there at all.

title: OneYear Bills Sold By the U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Treasury today auctioned oneyear bills at an average yield of 5,637 per cent.

title: FIVE CHANGES MADE IN SPANISH CABINET
description: MADRID, March 5Premier Carlos Arias Navarro shuffled his Government yesterday is an effort to lessen dissension, but the result appeared to be a Cabinet about as conservative as before.

title: U.S. Role In Racing Hinted
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The commission assigned to reshape Federal gambling legislation wound up two days of hearings on horse racing today with grave doubts about that industry's ability to take care of itself.

title: Dinner Set for Waldorf Splits Democrats
description: NEWARK, March 5The New Jersey State Democratic Committee will take its fundraising dinner honoring Representative Peter W. Rodino to New York next week, hoping the party faithful will be able to watch the results on television.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 6, 1975

title: PRICES ON AMEX STAGE A RETREAT
description: For the first time in five sessions, prices on the American Stock Exchange dropped yesterday in decreased trading as investors appeared to be taking their profits resulting from the recent climb. Similar conditions prevailed in the overthecounter market.

title: Screen: Text of Light
description: Stan Brakhage's The Text of Light, which opened at the. Whitney Museum of American Art yesterday, is 70 minutes of meditation upon color, an abstract expressionist work made by photographing light of varying intensities, refracted through heavy glass. To report that the heavy glass is, in reality, an ashtray may be a disservice since the effect of the film is lyrical, disconnected to identifiable objects or even time and space.

title: Rise and Fall of a Wall Street Comet
description: Berel Weinstein was a spellbinding boy wonder from Brooklyn, an ungainly, sometimes sickly youth who composed music, wrote poetry and collected mechanical toys. He was also one of the comets that occasionally orbit Wall Street, scintillating promotional flair, and then disappear.

title: Getting to Site Is Uphill Job for World Skiers
Morgan Trust Prime Is Reduced to 7%
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, a bank that lends chiefly to bluechip corporations, yesterday reduced its prime rate on loans by onehalf percentage point to 73 per cent, lowest since July, 1973, in a step that reflected the weakened economy.

title: Nets Beaten By Spurs, 122 to 109
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., March 5 (UPI)George Gervin scored 34 points tonight in pacing the San Antonio Spurs, to a 122109 triumph over the New York Nets in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Council Panel Halts Beanie In Bid to End Health Unit
description: In a display of independence, the City Council's Charter and Governmental Operations Committee yesterday rejected as inadequate a Beame administration bill to dismantle the Health Services Administration.

title: Morgan Bank Cuts Rate
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, which lends primarily to bluechip corporations, yesterday reduced its prime rate on loans onehalf percentage point to 7 per cent, the lowest level since July, 1973. Page 55.

title: Queens Museum Dismisses Its Financial Administrator
description: The Queens Museum yesterday dismissed Betty Miller as administrator in charge of business and financial affairs.

title: Prince May Visit U.S.
description: Prince Sihanouk said yesterday in a cablegram to Cyrus S. Eaton, the Cleveland industrialist, that he hoped to be coming to the United States this year.

title: Heat in The Kitchen
description: BOSTON, March 5  Secretary of State Kissinger's executive assistant, Lawrence S. Eagleburger, has taken strong exception to criticism of Mr. Kissinger in this column. In a letter published on this page yesterday he attacked two January columns as, among other things, unfair, offensive, distasteful and painful.

title: Legislators Give Reprieve to U.D.C.
description: ALBANY, March 5A bill to channel $90million to the urban Development Corporation  enough to allow the agency to pay its bills and stay alive for two monthswas passed by both houses of the Legislature today and signed into law by Governor Carey.

title: Phone Company Predicts Miracle on 2d Ave. Next Week
description: In the begrimed but partly restored telephone switching building at Second Avenue and 13th Street yesterday, there was a good deal of confidence that service to 173,000 telephones could be restored by the middle of next week, only two weeks after an allday fire produced the most complex disaster in the history of the Bell System.

title: KISSINGER CAUTION ON OIL CONFIRMED
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)Secretary of State Kissinger has told members of Congress that the United States could be forced into surrender or using military force against oil states unless it developed independent energy supplies, the White House said today.

title: $30MILLION RESERVE REPORTED BY TEXACO
description: A $30million reserve for possible nonrecovery of its investment in Colombia was established last year by Texaco, Inc., the company disclosed in its 1974 annual report, which was released yesterday.

title: Tenafly Sisters Win 2 Matches
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., March 5Shirley Babington and Marti Cavanaugh, sisters from Tenafly, continued their drive to a second straight national women's platform tennis championship by scoring two victories today at the Short Hills Club.

title: Snags in the Senate
description: With Senator Long of Louisiana calling the shots, the Senate Finance Committee has moved to strip repeal of the oil depletion allowance from the $21.3billion taxreduction bill that was overwhelmingly passed last week by the House.

title: A Small Spanish Club Shows Quality Terriers
description: Terriers never have been strong in Spain. But Juan Miguel Llorca is endeavoring to do something about it. Last year he and Princess Dolores organized the Spanish Terrier Club, with the princess as president and Llorca as secretary. We have only 18 members but they are bringing topquality dogs into the country, he said. The princess has a halfdozen excellent Englishbred smooth fox terriers, and I introduced Lakelands to the Iberian peninsulaAntonio Madueno has the top miniature schnauzers, Bedlingtons and Welsh in Spain.

title: Vanderbilt and Tweed
description: New York City's announcement that it will appeal the recent State Supreme Court ruling on Grand Central Terminal in which the building's landmark designation was overturned is welcome news. Even better news is Mayor Beame's statement of belief in the significance of the case for the future of preservation in New York and in the United States.

title: Kunstler Criticizes Libertarian Position in Tactic at Attica Trial
description: BUFFALO, March 5William M. Kunstler, the lawyer long associated with libertarian positions, surprised a court here. today by arguing that juries had the right to draw whatever inferences they liked from a witness's assertion of his lawyerclient privilege and, indeed, of Fifth Amendment protection against self incrimination.

title: Central Africans Cheer As Giscard Begins Visit
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic, March 5 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Central African Republic's capital today gave a rousing welcome to President Valry Giscard d'Estaing, who is here to take part in the second FrenchAfrican summit meeting.

title: A Wounded Knee Sentence
description: LINCOLN, Neb., March 5 (AP)  A Federal judge has sentenced a defendant in the Wounded Knee case to one year of probation for unlawful possession of an unregistered firearm. The defendant, Robert Charles Onco, 24 years old, was pictured on the cover of a news magazine during the 1973 occupation or Wounded Knee, S. D., holding an automatic rifle.

title: OTIS GUERNSEY, LED ABERCROMBIE, FITCH
description: Otis L. Guernsey, honorary chairman and former president of Abercrombie & Fitch, the Madison Avenue retail store for sportsmen, died Tuesday evening, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Edgartown, Mass. He was 81 years old and formerly lived here at the Carlton House.

title: FILIBUSTER FOES WIN THE KEY TEST AND LIMIT DEBATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 5By an overpowering margin, the Senate guaranteed today that lit would ultimately relax its filibuster rule.

title: Carey Backing of More School Aid Is Welcomed
description: ALBANY, March 5  The chairmen of the Legislature's Education Committees today welcomed Governor Carey's decision to seek more aid for secondary schools this year, saying they were making their own computer runs on the best new conbination of aid formulas to help the schools.

title: In a 5Year Slump, Seattle Learns to Cope
description: SEATTLE  Every Tuesday and Friday, despite the cold; two lines of several hundred persons form outside a storefront in a poor section of this city. One line is made up of men, the other of women.

title: CHARLES SPAAK, SCREENWRITER
description: PARIS, March 5Charles Spaak, coauthor of the script Id the film Grand Illusion and more than 100 others, many of Ahem classics of the French cinema before World War II, died yesterday after an arterial operation at St. Roch Hospital in Nice.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 5 (UPI)A Taiwanese table tennis team that returned home in disgrace after being accused of cheating in the United States, said today the charges made by the United States National Table Tennis League were ridiculous and groundless. The team captain, Chaing Pai Ching, said charges that his players applied toothpaste to the ball in order to make it spin during a match in Portland, Ore., were ridiculous and groundless. The league president, Windsor Olson, ordered the Taiwan team to forfeit the championship, but his decision was not announced until the Chinese had left for home. Taiwan won the match 51, and has lost only one of 18 matches against the same United States team in the last three years. It is evident that we can easily defeat the United States without employing tricks, Chiang said. Besides, it is unheard of to use toothpaste on a ball. Furthermore, if white toothpaste was used, it would immediately be noticed on the red or blue paddles.

title: Rhodesian Regression
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March 5It became increasingly clear today that the white Rhodesian Government's decision to imprison the Rev. Ndabaningi Sithole, the militant black nationalist, had shattered News the chances of a peaceful settlement between this country's black and white communities. In detaining Mr. Sithole yesterday the Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith charged that he had plotted to kill his rivals for leadership of the country's 5.5 million blacks.

title: NEW RULES ARE SET FOR AIRPORT XRAYS
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI) The Federal Aviation Administration announced today new safety standards for airport Xray machines designed to safeguard employes who work around the units.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The City Council of Jersey City voted 6 to 3 to allow the ColgatePalmolive Company to fence in its plant in the downtown neighborhood of Paulus Hook. Colgate, the city's largest employer and taxpayer, sought the fence to curtail a $400,000 annual loss in thefts and to increase plant efficiency. Some opponents of the fence contended that it would bar them from access to five streets that intersect the plant.

title: BILL WOULD RAISE CROPPRICE LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The chairman of the House Agriculture Committee introduced today a bill designed to increase cropprice supports and assure farmers they will not face severe losses if they plant as much corn, cotton and wheat as they have planned.

title: U.S. Says Aid Plan Will Be Reviewed if Planes Cannot Be Protected
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger said today that the United States would have to reassess its emergency airlift of military supplies into Cambodia if the Government there was unable to provide adequate protection for the Phnom Penh airport.

title: P.S.A.L. Finalists On Spot
description: There is no money involved and the interest is mostly local, yet when the Public Schools Athletic League basketball playoffs near resolution, the pressure on the players is High as intense as in School a bigstakes professional game. Sports Taft and Lafayette will have one strong bond on Saturday when they play for the title at 1 F.M. at St. John's University in Queens. Each scraped through with a 1point victory in the semifinals last Sunday.

title: PRICES OF STOCKS MOVE DOWNWARD
description: The stock market ended slightly lower yesterday in active trading despite further cuts in the prime interest rate by several banks.

title: In Memoriam
description: BRITTJacqueline Sue (Jackie). March 6, 1974. Beloved daughter and loving sister. We shared you for such a little while, God grant we meet again. We love you and miss you more each day.

title: Portugal's Moderates Trying to Block Bid by Military for Indefinite Control
description: LISBON, March 4 Portugal are trying to resist an attempt by the armed forces to hold on to political power indefinitely.

title: O.A.S. Postpones Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (Reuters)  The Permanent Council of the Organization of American States today unanimously approved a United States request to postpone the next session of the O.A.S. general assembly by three weeks until May 8.

title: S.E.C. Modifies Short Sale Rules
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it had modified its proposed regulations on short sales of stocks and was willing to consider eventual elimination of all regulations governing short sales.

title: INVENTORIES ROSE DURING JANUARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Manufacturers' inventories rose in January by the smallest amount since August, 1973, but some buildup persisted, the Commerce Department reported, today.

title: Plane Crash Victim Dies
description: NORWOOD, Miss., March 5 (AP)  Gilbato RuizMendez, Mexican businessman, who was injured along with three other men in the crash of a small plane Sunday, died yesterday at Norwood Hospital.

title: Market Place
description: Unsatisfactory as the stock performance of the major New York City banks was in the 1974 bear market, their commingled equity accounts did as well, by and large, as those of the major banks elsewhere in the nation.

title: KUWAIT WILL BUY 100% OF COMPANY
description: ALGIERS, March 5Kuwait announced today a decision to acquire full ownership over her major oil company, in which the British Petroleum Company and the Gulf Oil Corporation now own a combined interest of 40 per cent.

title: New York Phone Net Up 23%; 1974 Revenues Also a Record
description: The New York Telephone Company increased 1974 net income by 23.8 per cent to $360.2million, or $1.89 a share, from $291million, $1.57 a share, the year before, its annual report disclosed yesterday.

title: Ida Kaminsky Off For Israeli Stage
description: Ida Kaminska, one of the great names in Yiddish theater, is emigrating to Israel today, more than six years after she found refuge in New York from antiJewish feeling in Poland.

title: Tel Aviv Hotel Retaken; Six Guerrillas Are Killed
description: TEL AVIV, Thursday, March 6A bold terrorist strike into the center of Tel Aviv ended this morning in a hall of bullets and several explosions that blew away the top two floors of a hotel in which a band of Arab guerrillas held an unknown number of Israelis as hostages.

title: RECOVERY STAGED BY GOLD FUTURES
description: After a weak opening, gold futures staged a recovery yesterday to regain part of the preceding day's loss. The April delivery on the Commodity Exchange here closed at $178.70, up from $177. On Monday the close was $183.

title: FILIBUSTER FOES WIN THE KEY TEST AND LIMIT DEBATE
description: WASHINGTON, March 5By an overpowering margin, the Senate guaranteed today that it would ultimately relax its filibuster rule.

title: Daily News Strike Ends With Accord
description: The Daily News reached an agreement with leaders of the striking deliverers last night and made plans to resume publication immediately.

title: Chess:
description: It is generally true that White, with the slight initiative of the first move to rely on, is better able than Black to put up with an isolated pawn. Where the pieces are mobilized for attack, the isolated pawn may not only cramp the opposing position but also serve as an anchor for a knight outposts.

title: MOSCOW SCULPTOR SEEKS TO EMIGRATE
description: MOSCOW, March 5Ernst Neizvestny, a nonconformist sculptor, said today that he intended to apply for emigration,

title: CORRECTIONS
description: According to the HollandRantos Company, Inc., the manufacturer of Koromex vaginal jelly and cream, the product has been reformulated and no longer is made with a mercury compound, as was stated Tuesday in an article on birth control devices in The New York Times. However, some pharmacies are still selling the versions containing mercury.

title: Sihanouk Predicts Victory
description: LONDON, March 5United States support for the Cambodian Government will prolong the war for several months but can not prevent victory of the insurgents, Prince Sihanouk declared in a message received here by T. D. Allman, a writer on Southeast Asia.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Initial Claims by Jobless Lowest in Three Months
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)The Government reported today that 564,000 people filed firsttime unemployment insurance claims under state programs during the week ended Feb. 22, the lowest number of initial claims in three months.

title: Daily News Strike Ends With Accord
description: The Daily News reached a tentative agreement with leaders of the striking deliverers last night and resumed publication a few hours later.

title: Waitress Dismissed For Unshaved Legs Files SexBias Suit
description: SOMERS, Conn., March 5A waitress who was dismissed because she refused to shave her legs has filed a sexdiscrimination complaint, charging that she has as much right to have hair on her legs as men do.

title: Feminists Marshal Forces to Combat Job Layoffs of Women
description: The sinking economy is well on its way to becoming the severest test faced yet by the women's movement After more than a decade of demolishing barriers against the employment of women, the hard won rights of women to equal opportunity and treatment on the assembly line and in the corporate suite, appears to be in jeopardy.

title: Volkov of Soviet Keeps Lead in Figure Skating
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, March 5 (AP)Sergei Volkov of the Soviet Union finished sixth in the short program today, but held his overall lead in the men's competition of the world figure skating championships.

title: MANY DEFEATS MET BY SCHOOL BUDGETS
description: TRENTON, March 5 (UPI)Twothirds of the 61 regional, school budgets up for voter approval in New Jersey were defeated this week, according to figures released today by the State School Board Association.

title: Layoff at Briggs & Stratton
description: The Briggs & Stratton Corporation, Milwaukee, said yesterday it would cut its factory employes by 1,500 workers, effective March 14. Factory employes now employed total 8,600 workers. The reduction is needed, the company said, to bring employment levels in line with orders for small engines.

title: E.P.A. Delays 2 AutoPollutant Limits
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Russell E. Train, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, announced today that he would grant the auto industry's request for a oneyear extension of the final emission standards for two exhaust pollutants due to go into effect on 1977model cars.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Ida Kaminska Off For Israeli Stage
description: Ida Kaminska, one of the great names in Yiddish theater, is emigrating to Israel today, more than six years after she found refuge in New York from antiJewish feeling in Poland.

title: Rebels' U.S.Made Guns Shell Landing Strip Flights Go On
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Thursday, March 6Cambodian insurgents heavily shelled this capital's airport yesterday and for the first time used artillery as well as the less accurate rockets they had long been firing.

title: JERSEY P.U.C. HEAD GAINED $140,000
description: TRENTON, March 5A state investigation ordered by Governor Byrne disclosed today that Anthony J. Grossi, the president of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners, made a profit of approximately $140,000 on a $20,000 investment in a garbage disposal company that has been charged with defrauding Jersey City of nearly $10million.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The liquefiednaturalgas terminal in Rossville, S.I., where 40 workers were killed two years ago in a storage tank explosion, is to be deactivated for at least 18 months. Financial problems faced by the Distrigas Corporation of New York, as well as difficulty in obtaining gas from suppliers in Algeria were among the reasons given for not using the two huge tanks.

title: 2 Americans, Called Spies, Ousted as Hippies by Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 5 (UPI)Two American travelers accused of espionage by the Communistled Pathet Lao were expelled from Laos today under a Government order banning hippies, a police spokesman announced.

title: EVERS CRITICIZES NEW VOTING LAW
description: JACKSON, Miss., March 5Mayor Charles Evers of Fayette. Mississippi's bestknown black political leader, has charged the state government with trying to establish a nineteenseventies version of a literacy test to discourage black voter registration.

title: Kissinger Arrives in London on Way to Mideast
description: LONDON, Thursday, March 6 Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here late last night on his way to the Middle East, where he hopes to arrange a new Sinai agreement between Egypt and Israel.

title: Notes on People
description: The Senate confirmed yesterday the nomination of Carla Anderson Hills to be Secretary of Housing and Urban Development by a vote of 85 to 5. The 41yearold Mrs. Hills, a Republican, will become the third woman Cabinet member in the nation's history. She is now an assistant attorney general in charge of the civil division at the Justice Department. Her confirmation came after some objection to her inexperience in housing and urban affairs. Defenders pointed to her intelligence, her legal skills and her ability to bring a fresh, unbiased approach to the problems of the country's depressed housing industry.

title: Byrne Questions the Worth Of State Public TV System
description: TRENTON, March 5Governor Byrne said today that the effectiveness and cost of the New Jersey Public Broadcasting Authority, the telecasts of which are limited to the ultrahighfrequency range within the state, are worth looking into.

title: 3 States Urge High Court To Close a Taconite Plant
description: ST. PAUL, March 5 (AP)Minnesota, Wisconsin and Michigan asked the Supreme Court today to reinstate an order closing the. Reserve Mining Company's taconite plant on the shores of Lake Superior.

title: Advertising
description: In hopes of increasing its share of the passenger market and beating the recession, Trans World Airlines is launching an enormous marketing effort that will call on some of the usual airline ploysfood, drink and entertainmentas well as a few new ones.

title: Heritage Unit, With 95 Voices, Sings Spirituals
description: The first performance, at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday evening, of the Heritage Society Chorus had its musical charms. But its real significance was as a benefit for the Harlem School of the Arts and as an indication of the broad base of support that Dorothy Maynor, the school's founder and the chorus's conductor, has managed to muster.

title: Beame Bids U.S. Lend City Money Without Interest
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Mayor Beanie proposed today that the Federal Government lend New York City interestfree funds, even if they have to go out and borrow it, to relieve the city of having to issue shortterm notes, which will cost $250million in interest this year.

title: Fun for ChildrenIncluding Museum Shops
DOLLAR IS STEADY IN TRADE ABROAD
description: BRUSSELS, March 5 (UPI)dollar held its ground in major European money centers today, encouraged by a Swiss National Bank request that commercial concerns disclose large dollar deals.

title: L. I. Man Killed by Train
description: FREEPORT, L. I., March 5 (UPI)A Long Island man was killed today after he either Jumped or fell under a Long Island Rail Road train in Freeport, L. I. Nassau County police identified the victim as Erwin Ross, 69 years old, of 170 Delaware Avenue, Freeport. The circumstances of the death were under investigation.

title: H.E.W. Moves to Spur States To Seek Out Deserting Fathers
description: The Department of Health, Education and Welfare is beginning a major effort this week to encourage states to seek out and compel fathers who have deserted their children to support them and thus ease the welfare burden on the Federal Government.

title: Rangers Booed, Too, In 63 Loss to Sabres
description: The ice looked too fast for the Rangers last night. For the second game in a row at Madison Square Garden, New York came out on the short end of a shooting match, losing, 63, to the Buffalo Sabres.

title: Albany Votes $67Million To Ease City Transit Crisis
description: ALBANY, March 5An emergency appropriation to stave off a rise in New York City sub way, bus and commuter railroad fares was voted by the Legislature today after hours of intricate private maneuverings that culminated in a political setback for Governor Carey.

title: Political Police Report in Brazil Links Jews to Communist Party
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 5 The political police in So Paulo have charged that the leader of the opposition majority in the State Assembly, AIberto Goldmann, was elected with the support of what was described as a Jewish sector of the Brazilian Communist party.

title: Kekich Is Hoping His Comeback Trail Ends in Texas
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., March 5  Mike Kekich, whose travels the last two years make Marco Polo's journeys look like a stroll around Times Square, leaves for another trip and another country tomorrow, but this time he could be nearing the end of his odyssey.

title: Odd Name Brings Arrest in '50 Killing
description: A dogged investigation by a 30yearold Chicago homicide detective who was struck by a fugitive's rare surname led to the arrest yesterday of a Long Island cab driver who has been wanted for a murder committed on the South Side of Chicago on Nov. 16, 1950, when the detective was 5 years old.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: According to the HollandRantos Company, Inc., the manufacturer of Koromex vaginal jelly and cream, the product has been reformulated and no longer is made with a mercury compound, as was stated Tuesday in an article on birth control devices in The New York Times. However, some pharmacies are still selling the versions containing mercury.

title: Canadian Mounties Again Get Their Man And His Vessel, Too
description: GASPE, Quebec, March 5 (UPI)Aided by the ice floes of the Gulf of St. Lawrence, the Royal Canadian Mounted ??lice got their man today and his ship, too.

title: Citibank Sets Cairo Branch
description: The First National City Bank, which has maintained a representative office in Egypt since early 1974, announced yesterday that it planned to open a foreign currency branch in Cairo late this summer. The branch will be able to deal in foreign currencies but not in Egyptian pounds.

title: Radio Station Says 3 Women Fugitives Broadcast Poems
description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 5 (AP)Bernardine Dohrn, a fugitive leader of a terrorist group called the Weather Underground, and two other women fugitives purportedly read poems on a taperecording that was broadcast today by a radio station here.

title: W.F.L. Delays ShakeUp
description: MEMPHIS, March 5 (AP)The World Football League's selfimposed March 15 deadline for a reorganization has been pushed back to March 22, John Bassett Jr., owner of the Memphis Southmen, said today. The league hasn't closed arrangements with some of the cities, he explained.

title: Director of Arab Boycott Denies Curbs Reflect AntiJewish Bias
description: CAIRO, March 5 (UPI)The Arab League's Bureau for Boycotting Israel denied today that its sanctions were antiJewish and said that its sole criterion for boycott decisions was to stop foreign companies from contributing to the economic and military development of Israel.

title: Political Pressure Mounts
description: BERLIN, March 5  In the wake of the kidnapping and release of Peter Lorenz, the Christian Democratic leader of West Berlin, a wave of political reaction is gathering force here and in West Germany.

title: CAREY URGES RISE IN AID TO JOBLESS
description: ALBANY March 5Governor Carey said today that he Would propose legislation this week to increase the maximum Unemployment benefit from the present $95 a week to $125, but with an additional 10 per cent for each dependent, up to a maximum of three, making the new top $162.50.

title: Executive Is Charged by U.S. With JobTraining Plan Fraud
description: Murray J. King, president of the Vidata International Corporation, was charged in Federal District Court here yesterday with defrauding the Government of $533,517 in the operation of federally financed job. training programs.

title: CAREY URGES RISE IN AID TO JOBLESS
description: ALBANY, March 5Governor Carey said. today that he would propose legislation this week to increase the maximum unemployment benefit from the present $95 a week to $125, but with an additional 10 per cent for each dependent, up to a maximum of three, making the new top $162.50.

title: STUDENT SEX STUDY SCORED BY PROXMIRE
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)Over $342,000 of taxpayer money is being spent by Michigan State University to inquire in detail about the sex lives of students, Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today.

title: College, School Results
The Bitterness in Bobby Murcer
description: CASA GRANDE, Ariz., March 5At this highrise oasis that the San Francisco Giants have created in the scruffy brown desert halfway between Phoenix and Tucson, the bitterness flowed out of Bobby Murcer along with his perspiration. For six seasons he had developed an identity with the New York Yankees that appeared secure. But suddenly he was traded for Bobby Bonds and today, as a stranger who is starting another career with another team in another league, he feels betrayed by George Steinbrenner, the Yankees' principal owner now under a twoyear suspension from Commissioner Bowie Kuhn for his conviction for illegal corporation contributions to political campaigns. And he feels discarded by both Gabe Paul, the Yankees' president, and Bill Virdon, the Yankees' manager. In time, Bobby Murcer presumably will develop an identity with the Giants, but not necessarily.

title: PRESIDENT SEEKS $2BILLION MORE FOR PUBLIC JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 President Ford, taking another step to alleviate high unemployment, called today for the expenditure of more than $2billion above his budget for public service jobs.

title: EDWARD H. ESSIG
description: Edward H. Essig, former postmaster of Jamaica, Queens, died Friday aboard the liner Rotterdam off Singapore. He was 78 years old and lived in White Plains. Mr. Essig and his wife, the former Elsie Pigney Stauff, were passengers on the Rotterdam, which is on a roundtheworld cruise.

title: A BROOKLYN SQUAD STUDIES 3 KILLINGS
description: A special detective task force has been assigned to investigate the murders of three elderly men in their apartments in Brooklyn during the last three months, the police said yesterday.

title: Article 2  No Title
GROSSI'S PROFITS PUT AT $140,000
description: TRENTON, March 5A state investigation ordered by Governor Byrne disclosed today that Anthony J. Grossi, the president of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners, made a profit of approximately $140,000 on a $20,000 investment in a garbage disposal company that has been charged with defrauding Jersey City of nearly $10million.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Consolidated Tape Association reported here yesterday a second delay in developing a consolidated price quotation network to help investors and stockbrokers.

title: About the Rangers . . .
description: Madison Square Garden is growing edgy over criticism of the ice. For the second time in a game this year, a sign making fun of ice was ordered removed by Garden officials. Last night, a sigh read: Skate at Your Own Risk. The fans reaction has been spurred by recent injuries to players on the ice. . . . Bobby Rousseau; who has been out since Nov. 6 because of a spinal fusion operation, is scouting N.H.L. teams the Rangers Might face in the playoffs. . . . Jerry Holland, the leading scorer on the Providence team with 44 goals, will be out of the lineup for about a month because of a fractured cheek bone. . . . Greg Polis's threegoal game last Wednesday set a club mark for the most threegoal games in a season, eight.

title: Persistent Violation Found in Study Here Of Private Hospitals
description: Since the state Department or Health took over the job of regulating private, profitmaking hospitals from New York City in 1973, it has found thousands of sanitary and safety violationsmany of them serious enough to pose imminent danger to the patients at some of these institutions.

title: Federal Funds, at 5%, A Clue of Easing Credit
description: Government securities showed the best price gains yesterday in fixedincome markets, thanks partly to a tantalizing hint that the Federal Reserve might be ready to ease credit conditions another notch. The nation's money manager permitted Federal funds, or excess reserves that banks lend each other overnight, to trade for a considerable period yesterday morning at 5% per cent before stepping in to drain reserves temporarily from the banking system.

title: U. S. Industries Reports a Loss In Quarter and Drop in '74 Net
description: U. S, Industries, Inc., suffered a sharp setback in operations resulting in a loss of $14.4million after a $20million tax credit in the final quarter last year. Earnings for all of 1974 plunged 72.3 per cent, according to the annual statement released yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: I guess I find it troubling that I want to discuss and praise Tom Wicker's A Time to Die in terms of its form. After all, something keeps insisting, it's a book about the 1971 Attica Prison rebellion, whose wounds are still too gaping to be talked about as if they were art. After all, what rivets our attention as we read A Time to Die are issues that still overleap esthetic considerations: whether the observers' committee of which Mr. Wicker was a member did the most effective job it could have done under the circumstances; whether 43 inmates and hostages really had to die; whether a compromise between the inmates and the prison authorities couldn't have been negotiated if more time had been allowed (There's always time to die. I don't know what the rush was, said Mr. Wicker's fellow observer Herman Badillo shortly after Attica had been reentered.): whether thenNew York State Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller shouldn't have gone to Attica and talked with the inmates; and whether the amnesty that the rebels were demanding was really nonnegotiable in a society of law, as Governor Rockefeller insisted.

title: Ford Limits Support for Spying Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, March 5President Ford gave the leaders of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence only a qualified pledge of support in their investigation of the United States intelligence apparatus, Senator Frank Church, the committee, chairman, said today.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock y ester Exchange announced yesterday the latest changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies. The report includes the following:

title: E.C.A.C. Playoffs Open At Two Arenas Tonight
description: As two of the four Eastern College Athletic Conference Division I basketball playoffs open at Madison Square Garden and the Springfield (Mass.) Civic Center tonight, many coaches and players are asking, Why aren't we in them.

title: Wider Price Exemptions Asked for Some Oil Wells
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The Federal Energy Administration proposed today to broaden the present exemption from crudeoil price controls for stripper wells, those that produce 10 barrels a day or less. The agency said its purpose was to encourage additional production from these lowyield wells by removing what may be a disincentive.

title: Stage: Deftly Diverting Bone Room
description: The Bone Room, the fourth and last in the series of shows that Tom Jones and Harvey Schmidt have paraded through their Portfolio Studio, is a musical about the male menopause, or man, the middleaged, a subject that might be greeted with dismay by producers and audiences.

title: The Grandeur of Man
description: Michelangelo's art is a celebration of the magnificence of man; every time he touched marble he evoked a being of the most forceful beauty and wonder. In an age of humanism, his work drew its strength and its measure from the human ideal. It was his genius to raise that ideal to a level that has sustained the civilized spirit ever since.

title: Ali to Aid African Drought Victims
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 5  Muhammad Ali skipped breakfast and lunch today, which he said put him in the right mood to talk about helping the hungry African people living in the drought stricken Sahel.

title: ONCERARE CRIMES SPREAD IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, March 5Violent crime has been increasing in Israel since the sixday war of 1967.

title: Four Children Are Killed As Fire Destroys 4 Homes
description: JERSEY CITY, March 5Four Children died today when a fire swept through their home and three adjoining houses in the Greenville section of the city shortly before dawn.

title: Civil Rights Chief Says More Needs to Be Done
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)  The Justice Department's civil rights chief said today that more blacks than ever were participating in the nation's political lift but added that more needs to be done.

title: U.S. Companies Oppose Restrictions on Investments by Foreigners
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Witnesses representing American companies with large foreign operations today opposed a bill to empower the President to restrict foreign investment in this country.

title: Bridge:
description: A 15yearold high school student was one of four players who made a strong bid for international honors in the world bidding contest of the International Bridge Academy here Tuesday night.

title: Rebels' U.S.Made Guns Shell Landing Strip Near Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 5Cambodian insurgents heavily shelled this capital's airport today and for the first time used artillery as well as the less accurate rockets they had long been firing.

title: C.I.A. Opened Bella Abzug's Mail, Kept 20Year File
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The Central Intelligence Agency acknowledged today that it maintained a dossier for more than 20 years on Bella S. Abzug that included the contents of letters she had written on behalf of clients while she was a practicing lawyer.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Morgan Bank Cuts Rate
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, which lends primarily to bluechip corporations, yesterday reduced its prime rate on loans onehalf percentage point to 7 per cent, the lowest level since July, 1973. Page 55.

title: Quality in Government
description: Through six inflationary years, Federal judges and topgraded civil service employes have gone without pay raises because their salary scales were hitched to those for members of Congress, hesitant to vote themselves higher pay for fear of adverse public reaction at the polls.

title: Habib Charges Congress Thwarted Cambodian '73 Peace Effort
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Ford Administration revived today a charge made by President Richard M. Nixon that Congress had thwarted promising efforts toward peace in Cambodia by requiring an end of the American bombing in 1973.

title: About the Mets ...
description: Yogi Berra intends to find out as soon as possible what kind of pitching he might expect from his secondline hurlers. When the Mets open the exhibition schedule against the St. Louis Cardinals Saturday, Berra will use Tom Seaver as a starter and follow with two of his most promising prospects. Craig Swan and Rick Baldwin, righthanders, have been named to follow Seaver. Swan is tentatively listed as the No. 4 or No. 5 starter on the Mets' staff, while Baldwin is considered an outstanding prospect for the bull pen. Swan, a 24yearold from Scottsdale, Ariz., who pitched at Arizona State, earned a berth on the Mets' staff last spring but wound up on the disabled, list after developing a fracture of his right elbow. Baldwin has been in the Mets' chain since 1971 and once was a batterymate of Yogi Berra's son, Larry, when both played for the Marion farm club. . . . Cleon Jones was unable to complete the full exercises yesterday when his left knee began to bother him. Jones is coming off a knee operation and has occasionally had trouble with the knee puffing up.

title: About the Yankees . . .
description: Three young lefthandersScott McGregor, Tippy Martinez and Gene McElwainwill pitch in the Yankees' first exhibition game against Texas at Pompano Beach tomorrow. Jim (Catfish) Hunter will make his Yankee debut against Baltimore Saturday, followed by Rudy May and Skip Lockwood. Sunday's pitchers against the Orioles will be Pat Dobson, George Medich and Mike Wallace. . . . Manager Bill Virdon said he probably would not decide until tomorrow what the rest of his openinggame lineup will be. He did say, though, that at least four regulars would not play Bobby Bonds, Lou Pineilla, Elliott Maddox and Thurman Munson. Virdon said Maddox needed a longer rest because of a hernia operation after last season, and he said Munson's arm was not ready for competition.

title: OUSTED AIDE SEES INDIA IN JEOPARDY
description: NEW DELHI, March 5An ousted Cabinet official told Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today that her Government was floundering and that chaos and anarchy loomed in India unless the Congress party spurred rapid social and economic changes.

title: SHAH SAYS PRICES ARE INTERLOCKED
description: ALGIERS, March 5The Shah of Iran said today that it was ridiculous to speak of reductions in oil prices without simultaneous reductions in the prices of industrial goods.

title: OKLAHOMA JURORS HEAR OF WARNING
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 5 A former campaign aide testified in Federal District Count today that he sent word last Nov. 8 to Gov. David Hall that Oklahoma Secretary of State John Rogers Jr., might be trying to set him up.

title: WAGNER DEFENDS RECORD ON HOMES
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner declared yesterday that the 1960 Kaplan report, charging widespread fraud in the nursinghome industry, must have been sent to the office of the late Frank S. Hogan, who was then the Manhattan District Attorney.

title: KEITH HANSEN
description: Portland, Ore., March 5Keith Hansen, director of community services for the Port of Portland and a former assistant city editor of The Portland Oregonian, died of lung cancer yesterday at his home here. He was 54 years old.

title: Senate RollCall Vote On Filibuster Debate
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate voted today to cut off debate on bringing up a resolution to change the antifilibuster rule:

title: ABDUCTED GERMAN TELLS OF CAPTURE
description: BERLIN, March 5Peter Lorenz, free after spending five and a half days in the hands of kidnappers, said today he had been handcuffed and drugged and held in a cell in the basement of a West Berlin house.

title: Troops in Tel Aviv End Guerrilla Siege at Hotel
description: TEL AVIV, Thursday, March 6Israeli soldiers stormed a waterfront hotel last night where a group of Arab commandos, who had come ashore in two small boats, held least 40 guests and employes hostage.

title: Simon Criticizes House Plan to Cut Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon expressed strong disapproval today of the taxi cut bill passed Thursday by the House of Representatives, attacking in particular the bill's emphasis on tax relief for those With incomes of $10,000 or less.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Philip Morris, Inc., filed yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a registration statement covering a proposed public offering of 2 million shares of common stock. The offering, which will be made at the same time the company plans to market $125million of notes, due 1985, will be made by underwriters headed by Lehman Brothers. The company said it would apply net proceeds of the offerings to repayment of shortterm debt.

title: Haldeman Said to Get $25,000 For CBS Interview by Wallace
description: H. R. Haldeman, former White House chief of staff during the Nixon Administration whose conviction in the Watergate episode is under appeal, yesterday granted an extensive interview to Mike Wallace of CBS News for a fee reported to be in the neighborhood of $25.000.

title: Article 1  No Title
Antibusing Vote in House
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., House majority leader, has told a Bos ton antibusing group that he will see to it that a proposed constitutional amendment to prohibit courtordered busing for school desegregation is brought to a full House vote. The Massachusetts Democrat told the Massachusetts Citizens Against Forced Busing that he would no let the amendment remain locked in the Judiciary Committee.

title: 7 INDICTED BY U.S. IN STOCK FRAUDS
description: NEWARK, March 5 (UPI)Seven members of what was one of the largest overthecounter brokerage firms on the East Coast were indicted today on 125 counts of maintaining false business records and filing false information with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: People in Sports
description: Gaylord Perry and the Cleveland manager, Frank Robinson, had a minor squabble at the Indians' training camp in Tucson, Ariz., but the argument was quickly smoothed over by Phil Seghi, the general manager. Perry had gone to Seghi and said, Maybe it would be better for all concerned, for me, for Frank and for the club, if you traded me. After the three men conferred, Perry said, I feel better now. That was the best meeting I've ever had with a manager and a general manager.

title: BONN NOW FAVORING FLOOR ON OIL PRICES
description: BONN, March 5West Germany accepts the principle of a floor price to protect development of alternative sources of energy from a sudden drop in oil prices, a Government spokesman said today.

title: From Russia, With Love
description: As I read the opinions of Igor Shafarevich, whom I admire greatly, I understood that even people who are kindly disposed toward me, like Mr. Shafarevich, do not know or do not understand the real reasons that forced me to take a very decisive stepto embark on a lengthy separation from my homeland.

title: Bombed Shelton Company Plans to Reopen in Weeks
description: SHELTON, Conn., March 5Officials of the Grand Sheet Metal Products Company indicated today that they expected to resume operations here within weeks and hoped to rehire as many as 600 of the 900 workers made jobless by a series of bomb blasts last Saturday night.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Byrne Lays S.C.I. Rebuke to Hearsay
description: TRENTONGovernor Byrne said today that his criticism of the State Commission of Investigation's inquiry into alleged Medicaid abuses in New Jersey was based on hearsay from various people.

title: House Democrats Schedule Vote on Oil Import Veto
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Bowing to Republican pressure, the House Democratic leadership today scheduled action next Tuesday on a vote to override President Ford's veto of the curb on oil import fees, after initially saying the vote would be postponed for 60 days.

title: 5 U.S. Soldiers Die in Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 5 (AP)  Five United States Army soldiers were killed and one was injured today when a helicopter crashed on a training mission near Chunchon, 37 miles northeast of Seoul, American military officials announced.

title: 13 Past and Present Detectives Accused in Mt. Vernon Bribes
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 5Onefifth of Mount Vernon's detective force and most of its gambling squad have been indicted by a Westchester County grand jury for allegedly accepting bribes to permit gambling in the city.

title: Albany Votes $67Million To Ease City Transit Crisis
description: ALBANY, March 5An emergency appropriation to stave off a rise in New York City subway, bus and commuter railroad fares was voted by the Legislature today after hours of intricate private maneuverings that culminated in a political setback for Governor Carey.

title: RollCall Vote On U.D. C. Aid
description: ALBANY, March 5folowing are the rollcall votes by which the Legislature today approved a bill appropriating $90million for the State Project Finance Agency to pay the Urban Development Corporation's bills for the next two months:

title: Opera: The Ring Continues With Siegfried at Met
description: Opera's magnificent marathon continued last night at the Metropolitan with Siegfried, the third work in Wagner's Ring, and long before the evening ran out a weariness of voice and spirit had taken its toll. For this proved to be a Siegfried without a Siefried, unless you will settle for Jess Thomas, who certainly looks every inch the blond Nordic hero but whose once impressive tenor voice has taken on a strenuous wobble that he attempts to counteract by barking.

title: A City Plaque Extols the Gossamer Beauty of the Brooklyn Bridge
description: Brooklyn Bridge has always inspired words. Men like Thomas Wolfe and Hart Crane wrote about it, as did Wallace Bruce, the lecturer and writer, who envisioned the following as part of a poem that won a prize when the great span was opened in 1883.

title: Proposed Cut in Child Food Aid Arouses apposition in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The members of Congress who were successful in preventing the Ford Administration from cutting food stamp benefits (have begun a new fight to prevent a $600million reduction from childhood nutrition programs in the new budget.

title: House Leaders to Visit China
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) The House Democratic and Republican leaders, Carl Albert and John J. Rhodes, and their wives will visit China at the end of this month.

title: City Is Urged as Home For Kennedy Library
description: A campaign to bring the John F. Kennedy Library to New York has been quietly started by City Council President Paul O'Dwyer.

title: Loan Spurs Outlook for L.I.Track
description: That quarterhorse track in Suffolk County, at times no more a reality than the Second Avenue subway, apparently came to life again yesterday.

title: Political Speculation
description: Vice President Rockefeller told reporters traveling with him last week that he is no longer a figure to be contended with in Presidential politics. President Ford, he explained, is sure to be the Republican nominee next year. In 1980, Mr. Rockefeller will be 72 and that means, in his own words, that he is not in a competitive situation with the rising stars on a Jongterm basis.

title: Open Interest
description: Wednesday, March 5, 1975

title: MAX C. SONS
description: Max C. Sons, production man ager of the producing department of the Exxon Corporation, died Tuesday, apparently of a heart atack, on his way home from his office. He was 61 years old and lived at 47 Birch Lane.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Cambodian insurgents brought captured Americanmade howitzers to bear on the airport that is Phnom Penh's last remaining link with the outside world, supplementing the scattershot rockets with more accurate fire. Although the airport was not shut, the new weaponry raised serious concern at the United States Embassy and the Cambodian command. [Page 1, Column 2.]

title: Equal Rights Proposal Is Hurt By Illinois Senate Ratifying Curb
description: SPRINGFILED, Ill., March 5The Equal Rights Amendment to the United States Constitution almost certainly will not be ratified in Illinois for at least the next two years as a result of a procedural resolution passed today by the state Senate. The action is expected to hurt the measure's chances of becoming the 27th Amendment to the Constitution.

title: Miss Heldman Toppled By Sue Stapin Net Upset
description: BOSTON, March 5 (UPI)Julie Heldman was upset by Sue Stap, 75, 62, in the second round of the $75,000 national women's indoor tennis championships today.

title: Chinese Military in Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 5A Chinese military delegation has made a public appearance in Hanoi, according to Western analysts.the Lon Nol Government, has not armed the insurgents. This has been the source of considerable bitterness, publicly voiced by Prince Sihanouk.

title: JURY SUBPOENAS MASSACHUSETTS U.
description: WORCESTER, Mass., March 5 (AP)A Federal grand jury has subpoenaed the records of the treasurer of the Amherst campus of the University of Massachusetts, its president, Robert Wood, announced today.

title: WAGNER DEFENDS RECORD ON HOMES
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner declared yesterday that the 1960 Kaplan report, charging widespread fraud in the nursinghome industry, must have been sent to the office of the late Frank S. Hogan, who was then the Manhattan Dis. trict Attorney.

title: LEGISLATORS GIVE REPRIEVE TO U.D.C.
description: ALBANY, March 5A bill to channel $90million to the Urban Development Corporation  enough to allow the agency to pay its bills and stay alive for two monthswas passed by both houses of the Legislature today and signed into law by Governor Carey.

title: Putting People to Work
description: A healthy competition seems to be developing between the Ford Administration and Congress in expanding the Federal emergency programs to aid both the unemployed and the nation through public service jobs.

title: Demolition of Piers Begun At ConventionCenter Site
description: Although the necessary Fed eral approvals have not been granted and major financing questions remain, the city is beginning the first onsite work this week in preparation for the building of a convention and exhibition center on the West Side.

title: MercerNewark Service Begun by Ransome Airline
description: TRENTON, March 5 (AP)Ransome Airlines announced today it had begun service between Mercer County Airport and Newark International Airport. Ransome operates the Allegheny Commuter, an air connection service to major airports.

title: THE INDIAN PARSIS: WANING, TROUBLED
description: BOMBAY, IndiaThe closely knit Parsi community of Bombay is melancholy. Its numbers are declining, younger members are leaving India and ritual is the object of controversy.

title: Payments Deficits Cut, O.E.C.D. Says
description: PARIS, March 5The major industrialized countries are making greater  than  expected progress in reducing deficits in their payments balances caused by the quadrupling of oil prices since 1973, according to figures presented to a committee of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: PRESIDENT SEEKS $2BILLION MORE FOR PUBLIC JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 President Ford, taking another step to alleviate high unemployment, called today for the expenditure of more than $2billion above his budget for public service jobs.

title: Big Canadian Debate Under Way On Future of Vast Northlands
description: YELLOWKNIFE, Northwest Territories, March 5  In a crowded hotel meeting room here, 300 miles below the Arctic Circle, a farreaching national debate has opened on the future of Canada's vast northlands.

title: Yves Godard, 65, a Leader Of the Algerian Rebellion
description: MONS, Belgium, March 5 (Reuters)Yves Godard, one of the last surviving leaders of the French secret army organization that fought against Gen. Charles de Gaulle in the closing years of the Algerian war for independence, died last evening, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Lessines. He was 65 years old.

title: Jerry Wurf and the Municipal Employes Are Political Activists
description: WASHINGTON, March 5As George Meany gets out of Democratic politics, Jerry Wurf, president of the fifth largest and fastestgrowing union in Mr. Meany's A.F.L.C.I.O., is getting in deeper than ever.

title: The Inward Generation
description: Americans may be the only people who fail to see the importance of poetry in politics.

title: Release of 10 Demanded
description: BEIRUT, Bebanon, Thursday, March 6 (AP)  The Al Fatah guerrilla orgarization announced here last night that it was demanding the release of 10 prisoners from Israeli jails, includingthe Greek Catholic Archbishop of Jerusalem, the Most Rev. Hilarion Capuccci.

title: HOLOCAUSTPARLEY HAS FEW ANSWERS
description: How does one respond to unique events? It was a question posed yesterday by Prof. Emil L. Fackenheim of the University of Toronto on the third day of a conference here on the Holocaust.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Katie Tozer, 6 years old purple sash. Her mother put Saks Fifth Avenue so she child's costume at a benefit of New York. Later, Katie sash. The grownup models had almost as much fun decked out in their turnofthecentury finery from the museum's costume collection, even though they couldn't keep any of it.

title: Inquiry Urged on the Assigning Of Platforms at Bus Terminal
description: A Federal administrative law judge has found that the Port Authority Bus. Terminal's method of allocating platform space is being decided in some secret chamber and has called for an investigation by the Interstate Commerce Commission.

title: PURCHASE IN MADRID BY MORGAN BACKED
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company said yesterday that it had received from the Federal Reserve Board approval to purchase a half interest in Cofiber, S. A., a Spanish merchant bank in Madrid.

title: People and Business
description: The Consolidated Edison Company's assorted woes are not necessarily a thing of the past, according to its chairman, Charles F. Luce. However, he predicts that 1975 will be the year of the turnaround in customer service.

title: Personal Finance
description: Women frequently have special difficulties in obtaining credit, despite the relatively recent changes in the policies of some lenders and legislation on both the national and state levels.

title: Phone Company Predicts Miracle on 2d Ave. Next Week
description: In the begrimed but partly restored telephone switching building at Second Avenue and 13th Street yesterday, there was a good deal of confidence that service to 173,000 telephones could be restored by the middle of next week, only two weeks after an allday fire produced the most complex disaster in the history of the Bell System.

title: Roll Call Vote On U.D.C. Aid
description: ALBANY, March 5folowing are the rollcall votes by which the Legislature today approved a bill appropriating $90million for the State Project Finance Agency to pay the Urban Development Corporation's bills for the next two months:

title: Memorial Services
description: TORREYElizabeth Patterson. In the Memorial Division of the Wilmington Medical Center on March 3, 1975, age 57. Wife of John Van P. Torrey of 915 Overbrook Rd., Wilmington, Del. Relatives and friends are invited to attend memorial services at the chapel of Christ Child, Christ Church, Christiana Hundred, in Thursday afternoon March 6 at 2:00. Interment private. Omit flowers. Contributions favorite charity.

title: REPORT BY PENNSY CITES HUGE DEFICIT
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company, which has been in reorganization since it went into bankruptcy in June, 1970, reported yesterday continuing huge deficits. For the month of January, it lost $48million on a fully accrued basis. In January, 1974, the net loss was $34.2million. Revenues, however, improved by 2.2 per cent to $170million from $166million. Railway operating expenses increased 12.5 per cent to $168million from $149.7million in January, last year. Fuel costs alone were about onethird more, the trustees' report said.

title: Swim Summaries
description: AT HANOVER, N. H. EASTERN SEABOARD TITLE

title: GRAIN PRICES UP ON CHICAGO BOARD
description: Strong export buying of grains and soybeans for export pushed prices ahead on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. A large acceptance of deliveries of March contracts by some leading exporters was also considered a buoyant factor along with a report that the House agriculture committee had voted by a large margin to set oneyear loan prices for wheat, corn and soybeans.

title: Iraq and Iran Sign Accord To Settle Border Conflicts
description: ALGIERS, March 6Leaders of Iran and Iraq, the major military antagonists of the Persian Gulf area, announced here today that they had agreed to settle their border dispute and end subversive infiltrations from either side.

title: Priming the Pump
description: The surprise action by the Morgan Guaranty Trust Co. in slashing its prime rate from 8 per cent to 7 per cent this week looks like a quick response to urgings of Federal Reserve officials that the banks loosen up their lending policies.

title: Board of Estimate Votes TunnelWork Compromise
description: Resumption of work on the city's Third Water Tunnel within a week to 10 days was assured yesterday when the Board of Estimate voted unanimously to sanction a fourmonth truce in the money dispute that has kept 1,700 sand hogs and other construction men idle for three months.

title: 100,000 March Through New Delhi in AntiGovernment Protest
description: NEW DELHI, March 6At least 100,000 people surged through the heart of New Delhi today in a demonstration against the Government, the biggest such march here in years.

title: EUROPE ASSURED BY U.S. ON DOLLAR
description: PARIS, March 6Jack F. Bennett, Under Secretary of the Treasury for International Monetary Affairs, said today that the United States had no target exchange rate for the dollar but that it intended to continue intervening in the currency markets in cooperation with European partners to maintain orderly conditions.

title: CBS And Haldeman
description: WASHINGTON, March 6In recent years prominent figures in the news have begun peddling their appearances on television for fat fees, and even the Soviet Government will now sell you a TV act by a tame poet if you'll pay its price.

title: Plot Seen by Oklahoma ExGovernor
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 6 Former Gov. David Hall of Oklahoma accused United States Attorney William R. Burkett of Oklahoma, the Justice Department, and several state officials today of conspiring to frame him on criminal charges for political reasons.

title: A Piece Of Peace For Land
description: JERUSALEMOn his new trip to the Middle East, Secretary of State Kissinger will be trying to reconcile Egypt's interest in the return of some territory and Israel's interest in some progress toward peace. Israel's Premier, Yitzhak Rabin, has used the pungent formula: A piece of territory for a piece of peace. This formula leads to a problem: How do you measure a piece of peace? I would like to suggest an operational test.

title: Cambodia Airlift Slowed In 2d Day of Big Shelling
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 6This capital's airport was shelled heavily today for the second day, as Government troops struggled to reach the area to the northwest from which the rockets and artillery rounds were being fired.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New Jersey Attorney General's office was asked yesterday to investigate a 1973 settlement for $368,787 of an overpayment of $483,316 in Medicaid funds to a Wayne Township nursing home. Richard C. Leone, the State Treasurer, who heads a cabinetlevel review committee on Medicaid costs, said there had been highly questionable circumstances surrounding the settlement between the Alps Manor Nursing Home and State Medicaid officials, after an auditor said the nursing home had overcharged the state by $488,316 from July 1, 1968, to June 30, 1971. The auditor recommended recovery of that amount.

title: Aide Says Nursing Homes Got Word of Connecticut Inspections
description: HARTFORD, March 6A 21yearold nurse's aide told state (legislators investigating the Connecticut nursinghome industry that for five years she knew in advance of every surprise inspection by the State Health Department.

title: Women Plan a Boycott of Forest Hills
description: Top women tennis professionals are prepared to boycott the United States Open championships at Forest Hills, Queens, this year unless a faster playing surface is used for the tournament at the West Side Tennis Club.

title: Hollow Victory
description: The Senate liberals have marched up the hill and down the hill and arrived, if not exactly where they started, not very far away. The vote to impose closure on the long filibuster conducted by Senator James Allen, Alabama Democrat, and his allies clears the way for a final vote on the socalled compromise proposal to reform the Senate's rules.

title: City Is Negotiating For Loan to Meet March 14 Payroll
description: The city unsuccessfully negotiated for 10 hours yesterday with a banking syndicate for the sale of $537million in bondanticipation notes to meet a payroll and two loans due March 14. The talks are to resume today at 8:30 A.M.

title: Excerpts From OPEC Communiqu Proposing Talks on Oil Price Stabilization
description: ALGIERS, March 6 (Reuters) Following are excerpts from the official English version of a communiqu issued today at the close of a meeting of leader's of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries:

title: CORPORATE BONDS SHOW ADVANCES
Index of Wholesale Prices Declines 3d Month in Row
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 The Government's wholesale price index declined for the third consecutive month in February, providing further evidence of the abating of inflation at a time of deepening recession, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Truck Tonnage Is Off
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 23.6 per cent below the corresponding week last year.

title: Yunich May Be Subpoenaed
description: MINEOLA, LI., March 6Mr. Yunich will be subpoenaed to appear before two Assembly committees conducting hearings on the state's five transportation authorities if he refuses to do so voluntarily, Assemblyman Arthur J. Kremer, said today.

title: Spiro Named Agency For Friendship Fair
description: Spiro & Associates, Philadelphia, has been selected as the agency for the China Friendship Fair, which is scheduled for a 20city tour here beginning next fall.

title: E.P.A. IS ASSAILED ON AUTO POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (UPI)Environmental and public health groups accused the Environmental Protection Agency today of condemning city dwellers to lives of pollutionaggravated disease by recommending that clean air rules for automobiles he suspended until 1980.

title: Article 6  No Title
Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Stock Average Rises 8.99 As Trading Volume Drops
description: The stock market, spurred by a late upswing, finished with moderate gains yesterday in slower trading.

title: BIAS AGAINST JEWS DENIED BY RUSSIAN
description: A Russian Orthodox church leader defended his country yesterday against charges that the Soviet Union discriminated against Jews.

title: About the Mets ...
description: About the Mets ...

title: Seaver to Test Hip In Stint Tomorrow
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 6Yogi Berra announced his first lineup of 1975 today and conceded that it was filled with experiments that would determine the success of the New York Mets this summer.

title: $5,000 Fire in Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON., March 6 (UPI)A Pentagon clock showing the time in Tokyo burst into flames last night and the spreading fire caused about $5,000 damage, a spokeman said today. There were no injuries.

title: A FUNDRAISING CURB PUT ON NIXON GROUP
description: MIAMI, March 6 (UPI)Officials of the Florida Secretary of State's office have ordered the Nixon Historical Association to halt fund solicitation to buy former President Richard M. Nixon's two Key Biscayne homes until the project is properly registered and approved by the state.

title: PEYSER WILL RUN FOR BUCKLEY SEAT
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Representative Peter A. Peyser, a moderate Westchester County Republican, said today that in consultation with the aides of Vice President Rockefeller and after meeting with the Republican state chairman, Richard M. Rosenbaum, he had decided to become a Republican candidate for the New York Senate seat held by James L. Buckley, RepublicanConservative.

title: Maryland Swimmers Take Lead
description: PITTSBURGH, March 6 (AP)Bob Hassett and Tom Sheldon finished 1, 2 in the 200yard medley to help Maryland to the team lead. after tonight's six final events in the Eastern Intercollegiate invitation swimming meet.

title: Concord Quartet Plays Beethoven, Berg and Dvorak
description: The Concord String Quartet has been heard here often since its formation three years ago but usually in new works. Wednesday night in the Hunter College Playhouse, it had a relatively conventional program to itself, made up of Beethoven's Quartet in G (Op. 18, No. 2), Berg's Lyric Suite and Dvorak's American Quartet.

title: Rep. Ullman Predicts House Will Pass Major Energy Bill by the End of April
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Representative Al Ullman, chairman of the Ways and Means Committee, said today that he expected the House to pass by April 30 a major energy bill that includes an increased gasoline tax, gradual decontrol of crude oil prices, a windfall profits tax on oil producers and a very flexible quota on imports geared to the economy.

title: Kallinger Boy to Undergo Evaluation
description: HARRISBURG, Pa. March 6 (AP)Michael Kallinger, a 13yearold accused of participating with his father in a $20,000 robbery, was committed to a youth development center today for personality diagnosis and psychiatric evaluation.

title: U.S. Philips Trust Seeks Signetics
description: The Signetics Corporation of Sunnyvale, Calif., a manufacturer of integrated circuits and semiconductors used in a wide range of electronic products, announced yesterday that a preliminary agreement had been reached with United States Philips Trust for the acquisition of Signetics by the Trust.

title: OIL STATES OFFER TO DISCUSS PRICES
description: ALGIERS, March 6The oilexporting countries offered today to negotiate with industrial nations on the stabilization of oil prices. But they stressed that the agenda of a conference could not be limited to discussion of prices.

title: TV: Sunshine Is Bright Spot Among New Series
description: With new series coming and going like perishable guests of the talkshow circuit, last night was NBC's turn to offer a couple of contenders for syndication immortality.
