description: After two days of talks with Italian officials and an audience with Pope Paul VI yesterday morning, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada left Rome yesterday. He went with his wife, Margaret, for a weekend of skiing in the North Italian resort town of Cortina d'Ampezzo before continuing to London.

title: New Phone Blaze Termed 2d Arson
description: A fourth fire within nine days struck a New York Telephone Company facility here yesterday, and the Fire Department said it was the second time in two days that the company had been a victim of arson.

title: EXHIBITION BASEBALL
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Bridge:
description: The quarterfinal round of the district Grand National team championship is scheduled today at the New York Hilton Hotel at 1:30 P.M. The pairings, by team captain, are as follows:

title: U.S. CREWMEN FACE TRIAL IN ECUADOR
description: QUITO, Ecuador, March 7 (AP)  A number of United States crewmen on a captured tunafishing vessel have been detained at the Salinas navy base and will be tried under Ecuador's maritime law, the Foreign Ministry announced tonight.

title: Libraries to Pay Authors
description: CANBERRA, Australia (UPI) Australia authors will be paid 50 Australian cents (75 cents U.S.) for copies of their books in public libraries.

title: The Slaughter of Some Innocents
description: I have worked nine years in a storefront school in Harlem and I have watched the slaughter of innocent children take its bloody course, but of all the scenes of slaughter the one that destroys my spirit is the slaughter of the little children, the babes, the ones just reaching into the light, the lambs in that primitive freedom before the charnel house closes its doors upon them.

title: Deaths
description: Aronson, Jacob

title: Article 3  No Title
Speaker's Secretary Pleads Not Guilty in Influence Case
description: DALLAS, March 7 (AP) Pauline Girvin, secretary to House Speaker Carl Albert, pleaded not guilty today to a charge that she falsely asserted she had influence with Mr. Albert and could fix criminal cases.

title: CAMBODIANS LOSE LAST BEACHHEAD ON LONER MEKONG
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 7Government troops have lost their last beachhead on the lower Mekong River, Cambodian and Western military sources reported today.

title: Chinese Seek Wider U.S. Textile Ties
description: For the last two weeks, a Chinese trade mission has been visiting New York's textile and fashion showrooms in the hope of gaining American knowhow and building up twoway trade.

title: U.S. MESS RATE STEADY AT 82% DURING FEBRUARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 The nation's unemployment rats remained unchanged in February at 8.2 per cent but, in a sign of continuing deterioration in the economy, the total number of employed persons dropped by, more than half a million.

title: Exhibition on the City's NotSoGood Old Days
description: A portrait of the days when the sidewalks of New York were the playing fields of footpads and thugs, when crime kept decent folk off the streets and when poverty and filth enshrouded the city emerges from How Grim Was My City, an unusual exhibition that opens tomorrow at the Museum of the City of New York.

title: C. W. Post Is Victor
description: ERIE, Pa., March 7Bert Platt scored 22 points, including 10 straight free throws, to spark C.W. Post College to a 7268 victory over Philadelphia Textile in the opening round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division H Eastern regional tournament. Platt, a 62 senior guard, connected on 6 of Post's last 8 points from the foul line within the 90 seconds.

title: Vanishing Jobs . . .
description: The unemployment picture worsened markedly last month. While the seasonally adjusted jobless rate stayed at 8.2 per centthe same as the January figuretotal employment declined by 540,000. And the worsening of the true situation was statistically cloaked by several factorsmost importantly by the withdrawal from the labor force of 580,000 workers. The bulk of these dropouts were almost certainly discouraged, unemployed workers, many of them women and teenagers, who gave up hope of finding a job.

title: CAMBODIANS LOSE LAST BEACHHEAD ON LOWER MEKONG
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 7Government troops have lost their last beachhead on the lower Mekong River, Cambodian and Western military sources reported today.

title: The Cast
description: JEU DE CARTES, choreography, John Cranko; music, ?? Stravinsky; set and costumes, Dorothee Zippel; lighting, Jennifer Tipton;, production staged by Georgette Tsinguirides; restaged by Hiller Huhn; conductor, Seymour Lipkin. Presented by the City Center Joffrey Ballet at the City Center 55th Street Theater.

title: HYLAND CRITICIZES S.C.I. LAME DUCKS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, March 7 (UPI)State Attorney Generdoubts about the agency's that the lameduck appointments to the State Commission of Investigation had created doubts about the agency's polipolitical independence.

title: Autopsy Shows Darvon Killed Inventor
description: PARAMUS, N.J., March 7Results of an autopsy performed on the body of Berel Weinstein, a 28yearoldinventor and industrialist who died Feb. 21 in his Fort Lee apartment, attributed the cause of death to a fatal dose of Darvon, a prescription painkiller, Bergen County officials said today.

title: Concert
description: Betty Allen stepped into the gap left by an ailing baritone, Siegmund Nimsgern, at Thursday night's concert in the New York Philharmonic's MiniFestival Around Schubert series. The formidable mezzosoprano even took over some of the baritone's scheduled pieces, including Mahler's Songs of a Wayfarer, a song cycle that fortunately can be performed legitimately by a low voice of either sex.

title: INDIAN LEADER FACES CHARGE OF MURDER
description: RAPID CITY, S.D. March 7 (AP)Russell Means, a leader of the American Indian Movement will be charged with murder in connection with the death today of a South Dakota man, according to Jack Klauck, the Pennington County States Attorney.

title: Papp Will Go Traditional; Cites Audience Hostility
description: The theater policy at Lincoln Center will be altered radically next season by Joseph Fapp to emphasize classical dramas with international stars and traditionally styled contemporary plays with established American performers and directors.

title: Nets Top Spirits 10th Time
description: UNIONDALE, L. I. March 7Despite sore knees, Julius Erving put in a game high of 43 minutes and cored a game high of 35 points tonight to help the New York Nets defeat the Spirits of St. Louis, 120101.

title: CITY NEGOTIATES ITS CRUCIAL LOAN
description: The city finally sold $537million in bond  anticipation notes yesterday at the highest interest rates ever for this type of issue, ending marathon negotiations with bankers for a loan to meet the next payroll and two notes due Friday.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: it debate and bring any measure except a proposed rules change to an upordown vote.

title: N.F.L. Union Gets Mediator's Adivce
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (UPI)The chief Federal labor mediator, William J. Usery, briefed team representatives of the players' association today on their chances of settling the union's long dispute with the National Football League owners.

title: Trevino, Irwin Share Lead by Stroke at 135
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 7The second day of the $200,000 Florida Citrus Open saw a pair of United States Open champions take charge and the firstday leaders scatter in retreat. can star who has acquired exempt status on the American tourthat is, he does not have to qualify on the Monday preceding a tournamentshot a 68 for 138. He was tied with Bruce Crampton and Mark Hayes.

title: 80 Savings Banks Offer U.D.C. 275Million Aid
description: Eighty New York State savings bangs said yesterday that they were interested in providing $275million to the financially troubled Urban Development Corporation to help complete projects under construction.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Superior Court Judge Irwin I. Kimmelman approved a referendum in Newark next Nov. 4 on whether Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson and other top city officials should receive pay increases. The Mayor and the ninemember City Council had approved raises for themselves and 15 high City Hall aides last October, but then canceled them when faced with widespread community opposition and a court challenge.

title: Smith Wins; U.S. Trails Aussies, 21
description: HARTFORD, March 7 With Australia's old brigade of tennis gaining a 20 lead in the Aetna World Cup tennis tournament tonight, Stan Smith of the United States stepped in with a convincing 62, 76 victory over Ken Rosewall, reducing the Aussies' lead to 21. At 40 years of age, Rosewall is the oldest player on his team.

title: Austin Peay Triumphs
description: MURFREESBORO, Tenn., March 7 (AP)Charlie Fishback scored 20 points tonight as Austin Peay held off Tennessee Tech, 7869, in the Ohio Valley Conference basketball tournament.

title: Herman Pepper of Playbill, No. 1 Theatergoer, Is Dead
description: Herman Pepper, perhaps the world's greatest theatergoer, died Thursday at his desk at Playbill magazine, 151 East 50th Street. He was 77 years old and lived in Sunnyside, Quens.

title: The Positive Side of the News
description: As a treat for all those people who have been complaining that they never read anything positive in the news columns any more, this column today gives you something completely different.

title: Discount Rate Cut To 6% From 6 To Spur Economy
description: The Federal Reserve Bank signaled a further easing in credit conditions yesterday by reducing the discount rate it charges on loans to commercial banks.

title: 71 Employes Face Dismissals At State Centers for Alcoholism
description: ALBANY, March 7Dismissal notices will be sent out Monday to 71 employes at 11 state alcoholism treatment centers that are being phased out, just as they are getting started, under Governor Carey's austerity budget.

title: INDUSTRY PLANS CUT IN SPENDING
description: WASHINGTON, March 7A sharp decline this year in business investment in plant and equipment in real terms was projected today by the latest Commerce Department survey of business investment plans.

title: MURRAY HARTMAN
description: Murray Hartman, professor of English at the Brooklyn Center of Long Island University, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, at the age of 55. His home was in Teaneck, N. J.

title: Police Troubleshooter
description: The 29 year career of James Francis Hannonwho was appointed yesterday as chief of operations of the Police Department, the high uniformed rank in the departmentreads somewhat like a resume of the highlights of the activities of the Police Department itself during those years.

title: State Farm Group Drops Offer To Purchase Maine Sugar Mill
description: AUGUSTA, Me., March 7The MidAtlantic Sugar Corporation today withdrew its offer to purchase the idle sugar refinery in Easton, Me., for $2.3million.

title: Filibuster Rule Reformed By Senate in 5627 Vote
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The Senate finally voted tonight to reform its filibuster rule.

title: Builders' Competition Cuts Cost of the Available Jobs
description: After decades of steadily rising construction costs, when budget overruns became the norm, the cost of public and private construction has started to dip below cost estimates as builders compete for the few available jobs.

title: Gross Product Down By 1.8% for Japan
description: TOKYO, March 7 (AP)Japan's adjusted gross national product fell 1.8 per cent in 1974, the Economic Planning Agency said today.

title: AFRICANS STRESS ECONOMIC REFORM
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic, March 7A conference of 13 Frenchspeaking African countries and France opened here today, emphasizing the need for a new world economic order.

title: Ford Rejects Plan to Pay Medicare Out of Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, March 7A divided Social Security Advisory Council recommended today that the impending financial problems of the Social Security System be solved by paying most of the cost of Medicare out of general tax revenues. President Ford promptly rejected the idea.

title: HALL DEFENSE RESTS IN OKLAHOMA CASE
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 7 (UPI)The defense rested its case today after former Gov. David told a jury that United States Attorney William Burkett and the Federal Bureau of Investigation were willing dupes in a state and Federal plot to frame him.

title: Volkov Captures Skating
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, March 7 (UPI)Sergei Volkov skated conservatively but consistently last night, ignored a painful knee injury suffered in practice and became the first Soviet skater to ever win the world figure skating men's championship.

title: Sun Life Seeking Colonial; Four Named in Trust Suit
description: The Sun Life Insurance Company of America, a subsidiary of Kaufman & Broad. Inc., of Lus Angeles, is negotiating to buy all of the stock of the Colonial Life Insurance Company of America for cash, it was anpounced yesterday. Colonial is owned by the Chubb Corporation, an insurance underwriter and holding company based in New York. Discussions are in a preliminary stage, it was said, and principals declined to disclose the price expected to be paid.

title: Columbus Circle Culture Center Is Offered for Sale at $6Million
description: The New York Cultural Center, the white marble building on Columbus Circle that once represented Huntington Hartford's dream gallery, is for sale at $6million. An advertisement in tomorrow's Real Estate section of The New York Times offers the structure, built at a cost of $7.4million in 1964, as a unique property, ideal for use as a gallery, museum or headquarters for other cultural or governmental entities.

title: Several Companies Said to Have PhoneMonitoring Equipment
description: NEWARK, March 7 (UPI)The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company has provided conversationmonitoring equipment to such concerns as Allstate Insurance Company, Eastern Airlines and Bamberger's department store, a phone company executive testified today.

title: Court, Evert Ousted
description: BOSTON, March 7 (AP)Topseeded Margaret Court and secondseeded Chris Evert were knocked out of the United States women's indoor tennis championships tonight.

title: N.C. State Turns Back Maryland on Carr Shot
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., March 7 (UPI)Kenny Carr, a freshman, made a 3point play with one second remaining tonight and gave North Carolina State an 8785 victory over Maryland in the semifinal round of the Atlantic Coast Conference basketball tournament.

title: Medical Examiner Defied In Transplant of Kidneys
description: Physicians at Jacobi Hospital in the Bronx removed the kidneys of a slain man for transplant purposes early yesterday in defiance of the city's Acting Chief Medical Examiner.

title: Japan Air Lines, Facing Loss, Expands
description: TOKYO, March 7 Japan Air Lines, until recently the world's fastest growing airline, is faced with a deficit of $126million in its current fiscal year, the largest of any carrier.

title: Knowing And Knowing
description: WASHINGTONWith an estimated six billion files, the Federal Government is the largest single creator and collector of information in the world.

title: Hearing Here Told Of HorseDrugging
description: The hearing by the State Racing and Wagering Board involving John L. Cotter, a trainer and owner who has been charged with nine counts of fraud and other violations, was adjourned yesterday until March 26.

title: Ford Urges G.O.P. Enroll All Who Care About U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 7President Ford appealed tonight for a broadened Republican party embracing all who care about this great country, implicitly rejecting conservative demands for greater ideological purity.

title: GeneratorLike Currents Are Hinted Within Jupiter
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., March 7 (AP)Deep within the huge planet Jupiter may be several spinning electrical currents, like generators, that produce a massive, pulsating magnetic field, scientists report.

title: Safety Panel Refuses to Lower Its Standards for Auto Bumpers
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The Government refused today to allow automobile manufacturers to install weaker bumpers, rejecting Detroit's argument that the current standard costs consumers more than it saves them.

title: MAURICE L. LEVY
description: DALLAS, March 7 (UPI)Maurice L. Levy, a former National Broadcasting Company reporter, and cameraman, died Monday of cancer. He was 52 years old.

title: Stolen Jobless Checks Appear Alter Decade
description: TRENTON, March 7 (AP) The state reported today, that unemployment compensation checks stolen 10 years ago are starting to turn up in the New Brunswick area.

title: Prosecutor Urges Sirica to Dismiss Strachan Charges
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The special Watergate prosecution asked Judge John J. Sirica today to dismiss the charges against the one remaining defendant in the Watergate coverup case, Gordon C. Strachan.

title: CITY NEGOTIATES ITS CRUCIAL LOAN
description: The city finally sold $537million in bond  anticipation notes yesterday at the highest interest rates ever for this type of issue, ending marathon negotiations with bankers for a loan to meet the next payroll and two notes due Friday.

title: Anand Amritraj Upset
description: SHREVEPORT, La., March 7 (UPI)Robert Machan of Hungary upset Anand Amritraj of India tonight, 63,62, to gain the semifinals of the Shreveport International tennis tournament.

title: In One Part of Chicago, Many Feel Decay Has Ended
description: CHICAGOa few years ago, the Woodlawn section was deteriorating rapidly. The scene was a familiar one in urban America: physical blight, inadequate schools, high unemployment, a high crime rate, fires of mysterious origin, teenage gang warfare, an atmosphere of fear.

title: Congress Democrats Urge Tax Cut Up to $35Billion
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Democratic members of the Joint Economic Committee of Congress said today that a tax cut of $32billion to $35billion would be required, plus some further increases in Government spending, if the unemployment rate was to be reduced below 7 per cent by the ??nd of 1976.

title: BURGER ENDORSES PURGE OF JUDGES
description: WASHINGTON, March 7A system for purging the Federal bench of judges who are physically or mentally disabled or guilty of serious msiconduct won a significant endorsement today from Chief Justice Warren E. Burger and the Judicial Conference of the United States.

title: Market Summary
description: Friday, March 7, 1975

title: Cordero Rides Five Winners For Third Time at Meeting
description: Angel Cordero returned to his sizzling form with five victories at Aqueduct yesterday. He competed in eight of the nine races. Thursday, he had only one winner, the second time at the meeting that he had such a low score. He has ridden five winners three times at the 11day meeting.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, March 7 (UPI)The United States dollar today finished the week marginally higher on all European money markets as a result of West German and Dutch central banks lowering their interest rates to 6 per cent from 7 per cent.

title: Exhibition on the City's NotSoGood Old Days
description: A portrait of the days when the sidewalks of New York were the playing fields of footpads and thugs, when crime kept decent folk off the streets and when poverty and filth enshrouded the city emerges from How Grim Was My City, an unusual exhibition that opens tomorrow at the Museum of the City of New York.

title: MasseyFerguson Lifts Profits 40.6%
description: MasseyFerguson, Ltd., Canadianbased farm equipment manufacturer, deriving more than 90 per cent of total sales from countries outside Canada, reported yesterday a 40.6 per cent rise in profits for the first fiscal quarter ended Jan. 31 on a sales gain of 28.8 per cent.

title: Fiscal Storm Signal
description: The staggering 8.69 per cent interest rate that the city has just been compelled to pay in order to market $537million worth of bond anticipation notes serves as a grim warning of New York's deteriorating credit standing.

title: Prosecutor Urges Sirica to Dismiss Strachan Charges
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The special Watergate prosecution asked Judge John J. Sirica today to dismiss the charges against the one remaining defendant in the Watergate coverup case, Gordon C. Strachan.

title: Soviet Hails Its Women and Cites Plight Elsewhere
description: MOSCOW, March 7Leonid I. Brezimev kissed a Young Pioneer girl. Some 4.5 million carnations, roses and hyacinths have been transported to Moscow. Men were reported helping to set the dinner table.

title: Shah Says Ancient Differences With Iraq Are Over
description: TEHERAN Iran, March 7 (AP)The Shah of Iran said today that ancient differences between Iran and Iraq are finally over.

title: Spring Mills to Cut Down
description: FORT MILL S.C., March 7 (AP) Springs Mills announced that nine of its plants would be shut down for the week of March 24 because of continuing poor conditions in the textile market. It will be the second closing of the plants in 30 days.

title: HENRY J. ROBINSON
description: Henry J. Robinson, a partner in the New York law firm of Donovan, Donovan, Maloof & Walsh, died Wednesday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 92 Hales Avenue, Staten Island.

title: $111Million Eximbank Loan Is Set for British Airways
description: The United States ExportImport Bank told Congress yesterday that it was prepared to extend a direct loan of $111.9million to British Airways for the purchase of 15 United States commercial jetliners costing about $373million.

title: Freedom for Channel 13
description: In rejecting attempts by a Puerto Rican communications group to take over part of the programing of Channel 13 and to slant its offerings toward Hispanic audiences, the Federal Communications Commission has defended the city's public television station against improper interference bordering on censorship.

title: Leftists Storm Rally in Portugal; Police Fire Wounds at Least 16
description: SETUBAL, Portugal, Saturday, March 8 (Reuters)at least 16 people were wounded when policemen twice opened fire on leftists who had wrecked a meeting of the Popular Democratic party, a centerleft group, here last night.

title: West's Energy Agency Agrees On Plan Advancing Oil Talks
description: PARIS, March 7An 18nation agency of oilconsumer countries agreed today on a plan to safeguard investments in alternative energy sources, opening the way for exploratory talks between oil producers and consumers in Paris April 7 to make arrangements for a world energy conference.

title: Zenith Obtains Credit
description: CHICAGO, March 7 (Reuters) The Zenith Radio Corporation said today it had signed an agreement with five banks, headed by the First National Bank of Chicago, to establish a $100million revolving credit. This assures Zenith of financing its operations over the next several years, the company said.

title: Klammer Fastest In Cup Ski Trials
description: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo., March 7Franz Klammer of Austria turned in the day's fastest men's time of 1 minute 58.62 seconds today as the practice runs of the delayed, snowplagued World Cup downhill event began. Ermgard Lukasser, also of Austria, paced the women in 1:52.61.

title: . . . Need for Action
description: Mr. Ford has indicated that he would go along with the size of Congress's $21billion tax cut$5 billion more than he requestedbut does not like its giving so much of its benefits to lowincome groups in the population. He apparently thinks they do not know how to spend money, irresponsible savers that they are. Mr. Ford refuses to say whether he would veto the House bill as a result of what he considers its undue generosity to the poor. The end result is that, with all the talk about taxcutting, nothing has yet happened to provide fiscal stimulus to the economy.

title: RoseColored Glasses for Horace
description: CASA GRANDE, Ariz., March 5As he sat in the little gray wooden dugout watching his San Francisco Giants at play, Horace Stoneham appeared prosperous. He was wearing a planter's straw hat, a nubby pale blue shirt under a white alpaca sweater and he was looking through rosecolored glasses that nearly matched his complexion. The usual dazzle of the desert sun had been obscured by huge pillows of clouds, but Horace Stoneham kept his rosecolored glasses on. Perhaps they were a necessary prop to tint the gloom of financial reality that concerns the 72yearold Giants' owner. Once he had a gold mine in San Francisco, but then Charles O. Finley and the Oakland A's stole half his claim. Of all the 24 major league teams, the Giants were the only one not to bid for Catfish Hunter in baseball's recent multimilliondollar auction. Obviously the Giants couldn't afford the price. But in explaining his decision, Horace Stoneham delivered the anticipated clich.

title: Rep. Abzug Reveals Some Data That the C.I.A. Gathered on Her
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Representative Bella S. Abzug made public today copies of documents that were collected by the Central Intelligence Agency over a 20year period and maintained in agency files bearing her name.

title: U.S. JOBLESS RATE STEADY AT 82% DURING FEBRUARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 The nation's unemployment rate remained unchanged in February at 8.2 per cent but, in a sign of continuing deterioration in the economy, the total number of employed persons dropped by more than half a million.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: HENRY W. CONNELLY
description: Henry W. Connelly, a partner in the New York law firm of Shearman & Sterling, died Thursday of leukemia in the Roswell Park Memorial Institute in Buffalo. He was 42 years old and lived in Short Hills. N. J.

title: Irish Party Closes Branch in Belfast In Feud With I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, March 7The Irish Republican Socialist party decided tonight to disband its organization in Belfast, Northern Ireland, raising hopes of an end to the bloody feud between the party and the Official Irish Republican Army.

title: Donor Seeks to Bar Name to Touro School
description: A Long Island philanthropist who had pledged $1.5million to Touro College here for a new law school to bear his name charged in State Supreme Court yesterday that the college had been irremedially tainted by inquiries into nursing  home conditions.

title: Stanford Coach Resigns
description: STANFORD, Calif., March 7 (AP)  Howie Dallmar resigned tonight as head basketball coach at Stanford University, a post he held for 21 years, old. He had a 264263 wonlost record.

title: Canadiens Top Capitals
description: MONTREAL, March 7 (UPI) Guy Lafleur, returning after a 10game absence, scored twice and added two assists and Mario Tremblay, a rookie, also scored two goals tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to an 84 victory over the Washington Capitals.

title: Trading Nations Put Stress on 11 Areas Impeding Commerce
description: GENEVA, March 7Industrial and developing nations agreed today on a list of 11 barriers to the free flow of international commerce that will have first priority in negotiations as the world trade talks here move into the negotiating phase.

title: Low Level Stated For Job Layoffs In Auto Industry
description: DETROIT, March 7Auto layoffs next week will be at their lowest level since December as the United States auto industry recalls thousands of workers to step up production.

title: Antiques: Persian Pots
description: Ten months ago it became dear here that the oilrich Iranians were using some of their barrel profits for the purchase of pots  Persian pots dating from antiquity through the 19th century. Last May a piece of Persian pottery that had fetched $450 at a 1954 ParkeBernet auction was resold in the same galleries for $54,000, a new record six times the previous high of $7.920.

title: Market Place
description: It is one of the more puzzling phenomena in the current stock market: though there seems to be adversity ahead for the nation's longtroubled airlines, the stocks of these companies have soared recently.

title: Georgetown Scores Upset
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., March 7 (AP)Derrick Jackson scored 18 points tonight as Georgetown notched a 6659 upset of George Washington in the E.C.A.C. southern division playoffs.

title: HOMER G. MOWE
description: Homer G. Mowe, a teacher of singing here for many years, died Thursday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at 171 West 71st Street.

title: Seton Hall, Villanova Track Picks
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 7It will be Seton Hall with strength, in the sprints against Villanova, a power in the middledistance events, in the favorite roles of the I.C.4A indoor track and field title meet tomorrow and Sunday at Princeton's Jadwin Gym.

title: Filibuster Rule Reformed By Senate in 5627 Vote
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The Senate finally voted tonight to reform its filibuster rule.

title: Bruins Down Flames, 42
description: ATLANTA, March 7 (UPI) The Boston Bruins whipped the Atlanta Flames, 42, tonight, with the line of Andre Savard, Don Marcotte and Terry O'Reilly accounting for the visitors' first three goals.

title: New Wheel Chair Climbs Stairs
description: WASHINGTON, March 7A man who has been confined to wheel chairs for 40 years has produced one that will climb stairs. He and his associates plan to place it on the market next fall. Howard M. Jensen of Huntington, L. I., was granted Patent 3,869,011 for the vehicle this week. He assigned the rights to Ramby, Inc., which has set up offices on Cummings Point Road, Stamford, Conn. The Ramby, as it is called, has been built in manually and electrically operated prototypes. The commercial form is to be batterypowered.

title: U.S. Nuclear Deal With Iran Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Differences over what to do with uranium fuel after it has been burned are delaying a $7billion deal for the United States to provide Iran with nuclear power plants, according to Administration officials.

title: Senate RollCall Vote For Reform of Rules
A HISTORIC CHURCH NEAR BOSTON BURNS
description: ARLINGTON, Mass., March 7 (UPI)A historic New England church was destroyed today by a fire believed to have started in the steeple, which was being repainted for America's bicentennial.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In the obituary of Dr. Leon Goldman, a San Francisco surgeon and medical educator, in The New York Times yesterday, incorrect information was added to a news agency report of his death. Dr. Goldman was confused with the chairman of the dermatology department and director of the laser laboratory at the University of Cincinnati Medical Center, whose name is the same. Dr. Leon Goldman of Cincinnati is scheduled to serve as chairman of the third conference on lasers of the New York Academy of Sciences from April 22 to 25 here.

title: Grover C. Cobb, Officer of Broadcast Association
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP) Grover C. Cobb, senior executive vice president of the National Association of Broadcasters, died today in a hospital shortly after he was striken in his office. Death was attributed to a heart attack. He was 53 years old.

title: N.C. State Holds Lead In Swim
description: HANOVER, N.H., March 7 Mal Howard of Princeton won his second event in the Eastern Seaboard swimmers' meet tonight and North Carolina State retained a narrow lead in the team scoring after 11 events. The Wolfpack has 210 points to Princeton's 197 in the threeday competition at Dartmouth's Karl Michael Pool.

title: Suspect in 1950 Murder Freed On L.I. at Bid of Chicago Police
description: MINEOLA, LI., March 7A Long Island cab driver who was arrested Tuesday night in a 1950 Chicago murder was freed today at the direction of the State's Attorney's office in Chicago for lack of evidence.

title: Colonels Romp
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 7 (AP)  Artis Gilmore and Louie Dampier combined for 54 points tonight as the Kentucky Colonels routed the Virginia Squires. 10795.

title: Expected New Thai Coalition To Call for U.S. Pullout in Year
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 7Two militarybacked rightwing parties that led the move yesterday to topple the eightdayold civilian Government of Premier Seni Pramoj are now expected to form a new coalition.

title: Shipping in Crisis as Tanker Use Plunges
description: LONDON, March 7Steadily falling oil consumption and an unusually mild winter in Europe have created the worst crisis in international shipping and shipbuilding since World War II.

title: A POLICE INFORMER GETS 6YEAR TERM
description: Daniel Carranza, a 22yearold police informer charged with armed robbery and burglary, was sentenced yesterday to a maximum of six years in prison, after telling Justice Jack Rosenberg in State Supreme Court that he was guilty in both cases and would accept whatever sentence he deserved.

title: FRANNIE GIVES SHOW AT THE BOTTOM LINE
description: Frannie, a singer who began an engagement at the Bottom Line on Thursday, sounds as if she were singing songs from rock's vintage era. However, she does nother songs are new but seem to capture perfectly those more innocent, less relevant days of prehistoric rock. After all, a song such as Don't Let Me Die in the Big Top, Baby is hardly serious agony.

title: What Hairdressers Think of Shampoo Treatment
description: The hairdresser as a sex symbol? Many American men are convinced that a man who chooses a career of fussing with women's hair must be a homosexual, and, therefore, no threat to them.

title: BUS STRIKE ENDS IN NEW ORLEANS
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 7Streetcars and buses will emerge from their barns Sunday after a winterlong hibernation, signaling the end to a strike of operators and drivers that deprived the city of its public transportation system for almost three months.

title: President Sets Up Commission To Examine Olympic Problems
description: A Presidential Commission on Olympic Sports has been set up to analyze the multitude of problems facing amateur athletics in the United States and to offer longterm solutions.

title: Stocks Given a Lift By Favorable News
description: The stock market, responding to favorable economic news yesterday, finished with a moderate advance in heavier trading.

title: Rangers Subdue Scouts
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. March 7  Coach Emile Rrancis wouldn't say that his New York Rangers' goaltending was in trouble. But he did say it was improved by tonight's performance by Dunc Wilson, who helped. Make the 52 victory the Rangers scored over the Kansas City Scouts a little easier than it looked.

title: Boston U., Harvard Gain E.C.A.C. Hockey Final
description: BOSTON, March 7It will be the game everyone expected tomorrow night as the top two collegiate hockey teams in the nation, Harvard and Boston University, meet for the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Conference championship at Boston Garden.

title: HARRY GREEN
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 7 (AP)Harry Green of Great Neck, L. I., counsel to the majority leader of the New York State Assembly from 1969 until last year, died here yesterday after an extended illness. He was 68 years old.

title: New Phone Blaze Termed 2d Arson
description: A fourth fire within nine days struck a New York Telephone Company facility here yesterday, and the Fire Department said it was the second time in two days that the company had been a victim of arson.

title: NICKY BARNES FREED ON BOND OF $100,000
description: Leroy (Nicky) Barnes, whom law enforcement authorities have described as one of the nation's major drug traffickers, was released from the Bronx House of Detention yesterday after his attorney posted a $110,000 bond.

title: 2 Are Guilty of Violating Civil Rights of a Black
description: NEWARK, March 7 (AP)Two men suspected of links to organized crime pleaded guilty today to violatin the civil rights of a black man by beating him up in a diner.

title: Miss Kwak Cancels Recital
description: Shinja Kwak, mezzosoprano, has canceled her recital in Carnegie Recital Hall tomorrow afternoon because of illness.

title: Jesuits End Rome Parley Short of Majority's Goals
description: ROME, March 7The highest governing body of the Society of Jesus ended a threemonth session here today, completing a reform program that fell short of what a majority of participants wanted.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Twenty extra security guards patrolled the halls of the allgirls Walton High School in the Bronx, and classes were dismissed before lunch to avoid a recurrence of the disturbances that took place earlier in the week. We now have things under control, said Daniel M. Feins, the principal of the school, at Reservoir Avenue and 196th Street.

title: Court to Review Decision On Discipline for Segretti
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 7 (AP)The California Supreme Court has agreed to review a state bar recommendation that Donald H. Segretti be disciplined for his Watergate activities.

title: GERMAN ANARCHISTS ARE OUSTED BY ADEN
description: EAST BERLIN, March 7 (Reuters) Southern Yemen has ordered five anarchists who were flown out of West Germany to save the life of a kidnapped West Berlin politician, Peter Lorenz, to leave the country, the Arab country's embassy here said today.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: Los Angeles  Benny Rodriguez, 119 pounds, Chihuahua, Mexico, knocked out Benny Logan, 118, Los Angeles, 5 rounds.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In the obituary of Dr. Leon Goldman, a San Francisco surgeon and medical educator, in The New York Times yesterday, incorrect information was added to a news agency report of his death. Dr. Goldman was confused with the chairman of the dermatology department and director of the laser laboratory at the University of Cincinnati Medical Center, whose name is the same. Dr. Leon Goldman of Cincinnati is scheduled to serve as chairman of the third conference on lasers of the New York Academy of Sciences from April 22 to 25 here.

title: 80 Savings Banks Offer U.D.C. $275Million Aid
description: Eighty New York State savings banks said yesterday that they were interested in providing $275million to the financially troubled Urban Development Corporation to help complete projects under construction.

title: In China's Theoretic Discourse, A Nuance May Be the Message
description: HONG KONG, March 7A practical people, the Chinese do not indulge themselves in convoluted ideological discourse to satisfy a passion for abstract speculation. If they are being called on  as they were the other day in a broadcast from Kwangsito whip up an upsurge to study the theory of the dictatorship of the proletariat, it can be taken for granted that elements in the leadership have very specific and concrete goals in view.

title: Kissinger Flies to Egypt to Seek Accord on Sinai
description: ASWAN, Egypt, Saturday, March 8  Secretary of State Kissinger arrived, in this Egyptian resort town early today to confer with President Anwar elSadat on translating Egypt's general desire for a new Sinai agreement into specific terms acceptable to Israel.

title: Interstate Highway Backed for West Side
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beame announced agreement yesterday on building a sixlane Interstate System highway from the Battery to 72d Street to replace the old West Side Highway.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Lee Trevino, winner of the Opens of 1968 and 1971, shot a 66 and Hale Irwin, the current Open champion, had a 67. They ended the halfway stage tied at 135, nine under par for the Rio Pinar Country Club course.

title: Women's Year
description: At long last, with its third month beginning, International Women's Year seems to be gathering momentum. Part of the United Nations' problem in getting the effort moving has been that the program has to be given shape and meaning by the individual decisions of its 138 maledominated member governments. The notion of feminists attempting to communicate effectively past frontiers does not necessarily mesh neatly with the priorities of foreign ministries.

title: Front Porch Restaurants: Their Fall and Rise
description: The Front Porch lives. Again. In January, the doors were reopened on two of the Front Porch restaurants, which had been closed for three months. And they are still serving the same imaginative soups, openfaced sandwiches and rich dessertsat the same priceSas they were before. Even the simple decor and the small jungles of plants are the same (they were watered faithfully while the restaurants were closed).

title: GERMAN JOBLESS VIEWED AT PEAK
description: BONN, March 7West German officials say they believe unemployment has peaked here, with a slight increase last month to 5.2 per centor 1,183,500 joblessthe highest since February, 1959.

title: Infant Formula Cited
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 7 (UPI)  Four companies were charged today in an antitrust suit with monopolizing the nation's production and sale of infant formulas in violation of the Sherman and Clayton acts.

title: France From the Saddle: A BackCountry Tour
description: GALLOPING through lavender fields .. . . echoes of hoofbeats on the pavement of medieval towns . . crossing a Roman aqueduct at a canter . . . pt goat cheese and red wine at a riverside picnic. . . . These are recollections of a 12day, 350mile riding trip through southern France that my husband and I took last spring. The route: from Eygalires, near Avignon, through Provence and across the Rhone River into the Languedoc region, the Cvennes National Park, and back to Provence. We were in a group or 11 riders led by Henri RoqueL'Homme  Cheval (The Man on Horseback), as he calls himselfwho runs a yearround program of riding excursions from his stables at Eygaliers. Roque's tours vary from a few days to several weeks and explore many areas in Provence and beyond, including a 600mile pilgrimage to Santiago de Compostela in Spain and a trip to the Italian Alps. The groups spend each night in country inns, where the quality of the food and wine help serve as palliatives for the inevitable fatigue and soreness that, for the first two or three days at least, afflict all but the experienced cavalier. There are, of course, many other riding centers in France; Roque's is but one that regularly operates tours through the countryside (see box)

title: State Weighs Plans On Drunken Drivers
description: ALBANYThree successful experimental programs in Nassau and Suffolk Counties to rehabilitate drunken drivers were reported last week by the State Department of Motor Vehicles.

title: The Nation
description: DETROITDetroit. says city councilwoman Maryann Mahaffey, is the bellwether for the nation. The nation is in serious economic trouble. This town is in crisis.

title: Moshe Ephros to Wed Mona Shelley Yaguda
description: Mr. and Mrs. Jerome D. Yaguda of Cranford, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mona Shelley Yaguda, to Moshe Adam Ephros, son of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Z. Ephros of Brooklyn.

title: Ben Blue, SadFaced Comedian, A Performer Five Decades, Dies
description: HOLLYWOOD, March 8 (UPI) Ben Blue, the sadfaced comedian who performed for more than five decades in music halls, on the vaudeville stage, in films, nightclubs and on radio and television, died last evening at the age of 73.

title: Nassau Supervisors Plan Hearing March 21 on CivilService Labor Dispute
description: MINEOLA  The Nassau County Board of Supervisors has set March 21 as the date for a legislative hearing on a oneyear contract for the county's 12,500 civilservice employes. After the hearing the county will be legally free to set the terms of the new contract.

title: Bulrushes Being Used in Artificial Marshes to Filter Water
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 6The Biblical bulrushes that hid the baby Moses in the Nile marshes and thus saved his life are being employed today in a quite different fashion to protect the health and lives of thousands of People in many parts of the world.

title: Lawyer to Wed Lauren Totty
description: Mrs. Edward Allan Totty of Acton, Mass., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Lauren Flint Totty, to John Taylor Higginbotham of New York, who is in the legal department of the National Bank of North America. He is the son of Richard C. Higginbotham of St. Louis and Tucson, Ariz., and the late Mrs. Higginbotham.

title: Byrne Dropping SalesTax Cut
description: TRENTONGovernor Byrne has apparently abandoned his recommendations to cut the state sales tax from 5 to 3 per cent and to institute a $5,000 homestead exemption on local property taxes.

title: Monroe Paper Fights to Keep Legal Ads
description: MONROE TOWNSHIP The official weekly newspaper in this Gloucester County municipality is The Plain Dealer, which publishes its news and frontpage editorials under the following slogan: Cussed by a Few, Discussed by Many but Read by Everybody.

title: Painful Choice for Labor: Pay or Jobs
description: For the first time since the Great Depression four decades ago, unions are finding it necessary to accept pay cuts, forced worksharing arrangements and other unpalatable accommodations to hard times. For example:

title: Fire Destroys Main Building Of Monticello's Schenks Hotel
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., March 8Fire early today destroyed the main building of a hotel near here that had recently been sold to an Orthodox Jewish group from Brooklyn.

title: Why Does Paint Peel?
description: There is probably no home maintenance problem that crops up more frequentlyor causes more frustration than that of paint peeling, cracking or blistering around the inside or outside of the house.

title: The New World
description: These essaymeditations on the architecture and algebra of space and time of the Incan and Mayan religious temples at Machu Picchu, Tilcal, Copan, Palenque, are by one of our finestthough largely uncelebratedpoets. Lucid, precise, abstract, capable of infinitely slow movement and graceful, careful observation, the prose here is of a high order of excellence, a celebration of mystery and wonder, but human in its scale and its syntactical arrangements. It permits an excursion into the mysteries of Time and Space and Numbers themselves, as when Bronk engages himself with the Mayan practice of counting time:

description: BUENOS AIRES, March 8 (AP)Helicopters today began transferring civilian scientists and part of the crew from the crippled United States icebreaker Glacier, wedged in frozen seas near Antarctica, a United States Embassy spokesman reported.

title: Time of Trouble . . .
description: Dreams are the first casualty of a depression. The daydream may be of some idle extravagance such a dolor television set instead of blackandwhite or a trip to Acapulco instead of the Catskills. Or it may be of something much more substantial, much harder to lay aside, such as a college education or a home of one's own. Or it may be a noble public vision of abolishing slums forever or ending poverty within a decade.

title: Islanders' Attack Stops Canucks, 75
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, March 8 (AP)Billy Harris ended a 22game scorless stretch with two goals and Bob Bourne and Ed Westfall scored 12 seconds apart in the second period, leading the New York Islanders to a 75 victory over the Vancouver Canucks tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: The Numbers Sometimes Tell a Misleading Story
description: WASHINGTONSenator Walter F. Mondale made the point on the first day of the Senate's debate over a change in its filibuster rule. If the rule requiring the votes of twothirds of the Senators present and voting to end a debate were not relaxed, the Minnesota Democrat said, every one of the crucial issues we face, including tax reform, energy priorities and broad economic policies will be delayed.

title: P.B.A. Accepts Payless Duty to Save Jobs
description: The city's police officers have voted overwhelmingly to work five extra tours of duty without pay to save the jobs of more than 600 rookies and recruits who had received layoff notices in the city's budgetcutting program.

title: Karen Elliott, Reporter, Fiancee of A. H. House
description: Karen J. Elliott, a Washington correspondent for The Wall Street Journal, and Arthur H. House, an economist on the policy planning staff of the World Bank, plan to be married in Washington.

title: Bruce Lynn, a Financial Analyst, To Wed Anne Elizabeth Kantor

title: You Know
description: I quote from Marvin Kitman's review of Strictly Speaking by Edwin Newman (Oct. 27). Strictly Speaking contains the most scholarly discussion ever on the phrase you know, or as it is often used, the contraction Y'know.: It began among poor blacks, he states, who, because of the various disabilities imposed on them, often did not speak well and for whom Y'know was a request for assurance that they had been understood. From that sad beginning it spread, among people who wanted to show themselves sympathetic to blacks, and among those who saw it as the latest thing and either could not resist or did not want to be left out.

title: Third Child Is Born In Philippine Tribe
description: MANILA, March 8 (UPI)Another child has been born to the Tasaday tribe, the third birth since the small group was discovered on Mindanao in 1971.

title: P.B.A. to Check Complainants

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Unless you care to be put in the position of arguing against a Latin maxim, you will agree that art is long but life is breathtakingly short. Time may not be an important consideration in regard to an artist's art, butto the artist, nothing is so important. Not even fellowships and foundation grants. That is why it is possible to grow a little concerned over the fact that in recent years New York has been waiting a scandalously long time to hear some highly acclaimed new musicor it might be more circumspect to say music by highly acclaimed composers.

title: Portugal's Moderates

In a behindthescenes struggle since late February, the moderates have been trying to pare down proposals by the armed forces to retain crucial political powers indefinitely after election of a civilian government.

The court ruled in the case of John H. Rogers of Columbus, who was arrested on April 21, 1973, and charged with appearing in public dressed like a woman.

title: Rich Repertory in Berlin Opera
description: BERLIN  The Deutsche Oper in West Berlin has many things going for it. With about 320 performances in a season that runs from Aug. 20 to July 1, it might well be the busiest opera house in the world. Certainly its repertory for 197475 is the biggest, most varied and most interesting of any opera house currently active. Seventyfive operas are listedan incredible numberand the composers range from Cavalli and Cimarosa through Berg, Blather, Egk, Nabokov, Schoenberg and Van Einem.

description: WASHINGTONMost of the crucial issues of the time hinge on science and technology. In large measure the energy shortage, pollution, the regional imbalances between food and population, the possibility of nuclear war all exist because of the way mankind has used and misused science.

Lawrence, a former narcotics agent whose recent perjury convictions are likely to result in a review of hundreds of drug cases here and millions of dollars in civil suits against Vermont law enforcement officials.

Brunswick of Philadelphia and the late Dr. Brunswick, who was an assistant professor of surgery at Jefferson Medical College. A June wedding is planned.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary of State Kissinger began his latest round of shuttle diplomacy yesterday by holding an extensive and detailed discussion with President Anwar elSadat of Egypt that produced precise ideas on how to bring about a new Sinai agreement between Egypt and Israel. Nevertheless, the gap between the two countries seemed still to be wide. Mr. Sadat said at a news conference that he believed Mr. Kissinger's effort would be very hard, tougher than the previous IsraeliEgyptian negotiations. Mr. Kissinger said at the same news conference that he remained convinced progress is possible. [Page 1, Column 8.]

description: The New York state law that requires most employers to pay their employes in cash has been in effect since Oct. 1, 1974, but aside from an upsurge in the permit business it has caused few changes, according to Benedict Tuccinardi, chief labor standards investigator.

title: Princeton Surge Takes Eastern Seaboard Swim
description: HANOVER, N.H., March 8 Princeton overtook North Carolina State with an awesome display of power during the final seven of 18 events to win the Eastern Seaboard swimming meet for the third straight year tonight in the Dartmouth College pool.

title: 5 Social Security Reforms Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI)Five possible Social Security reforms that would allow recipients to earn more without losing benefits have been listed by the Special Senate Committee on Aging.

title: Holdup
description: In retrospect it is astonishing that Italy was able to retain its world team title in Bermuda last month, since its players were subjected to intolerable strains in the aftermath of cheating accusations against one partnership. Sergio Zucchelli and Gianfranco Facchini were accused of communicating by foot signals on the first day of play, frustrating the purpose of the screens across the tables, which were intended to bar any improper, communication between partners during the bidding period.

title: Sunday Observer
description: I don't know why old people ought to be an exploitable business commodity, but the lesson of the nursinghome scandals is that they are. I think there ought to be an age at which everybody draws the linemaybe 70 or 75and says, All right, your reward for making it this far is that nobody else can make a profit on you.

title: Veliko Vlahovic Is Dead at 60; A Party Leader in Yugoslavia
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 8 (AP)Veljko Vlahovic, a Yugoslav Communist party leader and one of the closest aides of President Tito, died yesterday in Geneva, the Yugoslav press agency said. He was 60 years old.

title: Cultural Council Urged in Suffolk

description: Brandishing his checklist on a clipboard and bundling his coat against a biting February chill, Alexander R. Susman  followed by a quiet and slightly nervous young buyerstrode p the driveway of a 48yearold house on a treelined street in northern New Jersey.

description: BEIRUT, LebanonThe balance of superpower strength has shifted in the east MediterraneanArabian area during the past twelve months but it is still hard to say whether it is going Washington's or Moscow's way. That will have to be judged by coming events.

Development Corporation.

description: Neva Tatman Hope of White Plains has announced the engagement of her daughter, Beverly Ann Hope, to Charles H. Rowe of Scarsdale, N. Y., son of Perce C, Rowe of San Antonio, Tex.. retired president of the Flintkote Company and vice president of the U.S. Rubber Company, and the late Elizabeth H. Rowe.

title: A TOP SEOUL PAPER DROPS 18 NEWSMEN
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 8Gloom pervaded South Korea's press community today as more newsmen fighting for press freedom were dismissed from their jobs.
