description: TUY HOA, South Vietnam, March 20  Hundreds of refugees, bloody and terrified, arrived in this coastal city today and told of North Vietnamese rocket and artillery attacks on the civilian and military flight from the Central Highlands.

title: Maryland, Louisville Gain
description: LAS CRUCES, N.M. March 20 (AP)Maryland's disciplined threeguard offense finally wore down Notre Dame in an 8371 victory tonight after Louisville beat Cincinnati, 7863, in the N.C.A.A. Midwest Regional semifinals.

title: Gen. Bradley Improved; Condition Still Serious
description: LOS ANGELES, March 20 (UPI)Gen. Omar N. Bradley, the nation's only living fivestar general, was in serious condition today from a cerebral stroke but a hospital spokesman said that he had shown a deeded and encouraging improvement.

title: Doctor, 70, Gets Life Term
description: SEARCY, Ark., March 20 (UPI)Dr. Porter E. Rodgers, 70 years old, rural physician who, with his 21yearold receptionistlover, arranged the murder of his wife, was sentenced today to life in prison.

title: NIXON ALLY FOUND GUILTY ON COAST
description: SAN DIEGO, March 20C. Arnholt Smith, for 30 years a close friend and patron of former President Richard M. Nixon, was convicted today on two of four counts of using business subordinates to conceal the source of illegal corporate contributions to Republican campaign committees.

title: All God's Chillun at Circle in Square
description: It was a time for cringing, squirming and understanding at the uptown Circle in the Square Theater last night, where Eugene O'Neill's All God's Chillun Got Wings was daringly revived. Daring? To revive a 51yearold play?

title: Cessna Laying Off 1,500 at Main Plant
description: WICHITA, Kan., March 20 (AP)  The Cessna Aircraft Company has announced the layoff of about 1,500 workers here.

title: MANNES COLLEGE MAY CLOSE DOORS
description: The Mannes College of Music, a major conservatory for more than half a century, will discontinue operations on June 30 unless funding can be found to cover anticipated annual deficits of $200,000 for the 1975 and 1976 school years.

title: Donovan to Quit Braves April 1
description: BUFFALO, March 20 (AP) A spokesman for the Buffalo Braves announced tonight that General Manager Eddie Donovan would resign.

title: GEORGE A. GOZAN
description: George A. Gozan, secretarytreasurer of Plaza Mills, Inc., died Wednesday on a business trip to Miami. He was 61 years old and lived here and in Westport, Conn.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: The cleft palate is a common and serious birth defect, but you don't hear much about it. There's no widely publicized campaign to raise funds and disseminate information, as there is, for instance, for cerebral palsy.

title: Profile of the Bettor
description: What kind of people bet at OTB offices? To find out, the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation took random samples at assorted branches and came up with the following information.

title: Sylvania Plant to Close
description: GTE Sylvania Canada, Ltd., a subsidiary of the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation, said yesterday that it planned to close its color television picture tube plant in Cornwall, Ontario, by August. The closing will throw all of the plant's 75 employes out of work.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS VOW A JOBS DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, March 20House Democratic leaders pledged today to stimulate the depressed construction industry by authorizing $5billion in grants to states and communities for emergency public works projects.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 21, 1975

title: 2 Cambodian Embassies Vie in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, March 20As the war in Cambodia continues, a confusing struggle persists between two rival delegations of Cambodian diplomats in this capital.

title: Business Briefs
description: Sales of mutual fund shares last month rose to $888.6million from $215.1million in February, 1974, and were exceeded only by the record $1.067billion in January, this year, the Investment Company Institute reported yesterday. Redemptions in February totaled $469.7million against $428million in January and $303.1million in February, 1974.

title: HAROLD HERRINGTON
description: Harold W. Herrington, a retired Bell Telephone Laboratories engineer who designed a military field telephone carrier system, died Tuesday at the Community Hospital, Montclair, N. J. He was 75 years old and lived at 74 Oakwood Avenue, Upper Montclair.

title: ExConvict Pleads Guilty In 74 Dismembering Case
description: Julio Vasquez, a 31yearold former convict, pleaded guilty yesterday to killing an offduty policeman whose dismembered body was found in a plastic garbage bag outside a Chinese laundry on West 79th Street last September.

title: EXPIRATION NEAR ON CAMPAIGN ACT
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Because Congress last year quietly reduced from five years to three the time in which the Government can bring prosecutions against violators of the new reform Federal campaign finance law, an unknown number of potential criminal cases involving illegal contributions to President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign are about to go down the drain, a citizens' group said today.

title: Notes on People
description: Associate Justice William O. Douglas of the Supreme Court, who suffered a stroke on New Year's Eve, has returned to work at the Court. A spokesman said Justice Douglas spent three hours in his chambers Wednesday evening and returned again early yesterday, following his formal discharge from Walter Reed Army Medical Center.

title: Haldeman Radio Excerpts
description: Excerpts from the first part of the CBSTV interview with H. R. Haldeman, former President Nixon's chief of staff, will be broadcast on radio over WCBSAM this Sunday from 6.35 to 7 P.M. The interview will be televised on CBSTV in two hourly segments this Sunday and the following Sunday from 6 to 7 P.M.

title: Article 2  No Title
WITNESS PERSISTS IN FORT LEE TRIAL
description: NEWARK, March 20Arthur J. Sutton, a key prosecution witness in the Fort Lee bribery trial here, underwent more than four hours of crossexamination today but stuck by his story that he and three executives of Investors Funding Corporation agreed last year to pay $1.6million in bribes to Fort Lee officials. The money, he said, was in exchange for their cooperation in putting through a plan for a $250million commercial center in that community.

title: People and Business
description: In a series of toplevel executive appointments, Coy G. Eklund, 59, has been named chief executive officer of The Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States, the nation's thirdlargest life insurance company. Mr. Eklund, who joined Equitable in 1938, was named to the mutual company's board of directors in 1965 and has served as its president since 1973.

title: Advertising
description: DORADO. Puerto Rico, March 20Survivors of the advertising wars, the struggles with uncertain clients and retreating budgets on the mainland, arrived here yesterday for rest, relaxation and, perhaps, a bit of work.

title: Grossi Asserts Cut In Funds Would Aid Only the Big Utilities
description: TRENTON, March 20 (AP)The president of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners said today that cuts in his budget would save money for giant utilities but not for the state.

title: PetroskyMcLean Win in Court Tennis
description: The New York pair of Charles Petrosky and John W. McLean advanced to the semifinal round of the United States Proamateur hadicap court tennis championship yesterday by defeating Tom Welsh of Philadelphia and Col. James W. Gerard of New York, 87, 83, at the New York Racquet and Tennis Club.

title: Javits Asks Action on Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, called today for emergency action by Congress to pass legislation to extend unemployment compensation benefits.

title: Kings Capitalize
description: KANSAS CITY, March 20 (UPI)Nate Archibald and Scott Wedman combined for 52 points as the Kansas CityOmaha Kings, helped by three technical foul calls in the game's waning minutes, rallied tonight to beat the New Orleans Jazz, 10195.

title: Winter in Alaska: Coping With the Cold Is a Way of Life
description: UNALAKLEET, AlaskaIn Alaska, winter is not a season. It is a way of life.

title: Canada Names Envoy to U.S..
description: OTTAWA, March 20 (AP)The Canadian Government today announced the appointment of J E. Warren as Ambassador to Washington replacing Marcel Cadieux, who was named Ambassador to the European Common Market.

title: Dollar Shows a Rise On Europe Markets; Gold Price Declines
description: BRUSSELS, March 20 (UPI)The dollar moved upward today on European money exchanges, apparently in reaction to a West German Government prediction that the United States currency's worth would amprove soon.

title: Ford Likely to Name Aidein Spy Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON, March 20President Ford is expected to appoint a special assistant in the White House to deal with the proliferating investigations of the United States intelligence community, reliable White House sources have disclosed.

title: Money
U.S. Curling Team Gets Share of Lead
description: PERTH, Scotland, March 20 (AP)The United States, the defender, moved into a tie for the lead in the world curling championship by defeating Switzerland today 85.

title: Boy Says He Filled Teachers' Orders For Stolen Racquets
description: The police are investigating an assertion by a 15yearold Brooklyn junior high school student that he sold stolen tennis racquets to three teachers at his school and took orders for future delivery of specified models and sizes from two other teachers.

title: Plan for Development in Bronx Is Greeted Coolly
description: City Council members, skeptical that a developer from Milan, Italy, could deliver a proposal to construct a $50million industrial facility in the South Bronx, vowed yesterday that they would not approve expenditures for the project without further proof of its feasibility.

title: HARRY LACHMAN, A FILM DIRECTOR
description: LOS ANGELES, March 20Harry Lachman, a painter and film director, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home in Beverly Hills. He was 88 years old.

title: Oil Consumers Endorse U.S. Plan on Price Floor
description: PARIS, March 20The major oilconsuming countries agreed here today on an American inspired concept of keeping oil prices high enough to encourage the development of alternative sources of energy.

title: The Submarine Story
description: PITTSBURGH  More remarkable than the raising of the sunken Russian submarine is the reaction of the American press to the efforts of the Central Intelligence Agency to suppress the story. Coming on the heels of what is widely supposed to be the press's triumph in the Watergate matter, the submarine case suggests how inadequate it is to curse or bless the newspapers and television in easy generalities.

title: World Bank Sells Bonds
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (Reuters) The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development said today it had placed $240million of twoyear bonds outside the United States. The bonds were purchased by central banks and other Government institutions from 57 countries and by one international organization. The new World Bank bonds, which were sold at par, are due March 15, 1977 and carry a 6.40 per cent coupon.

title: Forest Hills OTB Players Running in the Money
description: They bend over bits of paper with the concentration of chess addicts. The passion of demagogues is in their speech. They discuss letters of the alphabet with the profundity of oracles examining bird entrails. If and coulda float through the air, thick as the cigarette and cigar smoke.

title: EDWIN H. B. PRATT
description: Edwin H. B. Pratt, former headmaster of the Browne & Nichols School, a preparatory institution in Cambridge, Mass., died Monday in Peter Bent Brigham Hospital, Boston. He was 61 years old and lived in Marion, Mass.

title: When Father Who Deserts Has to Pay
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 20Henry D. owed $400 a month in child support to his former wife and their six children. Instead of paying, he quit his job and left Sacramento without telling her where he was going.

title: Lieutenant Is Suspended; Favorite and Jazz to Fold
description: Performances of The Lieutenant at the Lyceum Theater have been suspended until the producers can raise $100,000 to promote it. Producing Managers Company, the producers, said $60,000 had been raised for the musical based on the My Lai massacre.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Patricia E. Swinton, who was arrested on March 12 after five years as a fugitive on bombing conspiracy charges, was released in Federal District Court here yesterday on bail of $200,000. Mrs. Swinton's bail was secured by the private home of her familyher father is an insurance brokerand savings and by the property owned by the commune where she had been living in Vermont. After gaining her freedom, she said, I certainly didn't enjoy jail.

title: 2 Contraceptive Makers Are Sued for $4.5Million
description: NEWARK, March 20Two manufacturers of oral contraceptives went on trial in Federal District Court today in a $4.5million suit filed by a 38  year  old woman who charged that she had suffered brain damage after taking the pills.

title: Tigers Victors, 8667, Over S. Carolina
description: Defense, the commodity that fans cry for at Madison Square Garden, was dispensed in a double portion last night as the quarterfinal round of the National Invitation Tournament came to an end.

title: Indochina Developments
description: As the military situation worsened yesterday for the Saigon Government in South Vietnam and the Lon Nol Government in Cambodia, further territory was lost, and a source of munitions for Phnom Penh appeared to be threatened. Following is a brief account of developments:

title: Oil Consumers Endorse U.S. Plan on Price Floor
description: PARIS, March 20The major oilconsuming countries agreed here today on an American inspired concept of keeping oil prices high enough to encourage the development of alternative sources of energy.

title: TRANSIT PACT FAILS TO END 6DAY STRIKE
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 20 (UPI)  A tentative agreement was reached today on a new labor contract, but the sixday transit strike continued because no money was available to meet the increased cost of the new pact.

title: Mets Win One, 30, For Mrs. Payson
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Mar. 20After losing eight of their first 11 exhibitions, the New York Mets treated their principal owner, Mrs. Joan Whitney Payson, to a 30 victory over the Atlanta Braves tonight.

title: Britain Closes Embassy in Phnom Penh Leaving U.S. as the Only Western Mission
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia. Friday, March 21the British Embassy, the last important Western mission left in Cambodia aside from the American, has decided to shut and evacuate its staff.

title: Notes on People
description: Associate Justice William O. Douglas of the Supreme Court, who suffered a stroke on New Year's Eve, has returned to work at the Court. A spokesman said Justice Douglas spent three hours in his chambers Wednesday evening and returned again early yesterday, following his formal discharge from Walter Reed Army Medical Center.

title: Gerulaitis Victor, 64, 76
description: Vitas Gerulairis didn't let the home folks down last night.

title: HOUSE FARM 8111 PASSED, 259162
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The House of Representatives passed a farm bill today whose estimated Federal cost is $470million. The bill is designed to protect farmers against the effects of rising production costs and falling farm prices.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MARCH 21, 1975

title: REV. DR. PERCY EPLER
description: The Rev. Dr. Percy H. ??pier, who at 102 was the oldest living graduate of the Yale Divinity School, died March 13 at a nursing home in Nanuet, N.Y.

title: Corporate Market Is Described as a Disaster
description: Uncertainty over the pricing and the impact of the Treasury's auction of its new 15year bond produced chaos in the corporate bond market yesterday, resulting in sharp losses for certain issues. One Wall Street Credit observer described Markets the corporate sector for longterm bonds, or those maturing in 25 or 30 years, as a disaster.

title: Forest Hills OTB Players Running in the Money
description: They bend over bits of paper with the concentration of chess addicts. The passion of demagogues is in their speech. They discuss letters of the alphabet with the profundity of oracles examining bird entrails. If and coulda float through the air, thick as the cigarette and cigar smoke.

title: Kissinger in Aswan Again, Relays New Israeli Views
description: ASWAN, Egypt, March 20Secretary of State Kissinger brought modified Israeli proposals for a new Sinai agreement to President Anwar elSadat tonight, and the negotiations were apparently at a decisive stage.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Rockville Centre Advances, 76 to 67
description: The Smith brothers, Jeff and Chuck, were the difference last night as South Side of Rockville Centre, L.I., defeated its Village rival, St. Agnes, 7667, in the opening round of the Top Eight high school basketball tournament at Hofstra University in Hempstead, L.I. Jeff scored 24 points and grabbed 18 rebounds and Chuck had 18 points and 16 rebounds.

title: POTATO FUTURES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Potato futures dropped to a new lifeofcontract low yesterday for the April delivery, which closed at the low of 2.54 cents a pound on the New York Mercantile Exchange.

title: Finland Beats U.S. Six
description: HELSINKI, Finland, March 20 (AP)Juhani Tamminen scored three goals as Finland came from behind to beat the American national hockey team, 43, today in a warmup game for the world championships next month. Buzz Schweider, Mike Pilich and Steve Alley scored for the United States, which last night had beaten Norway, 52.

title: A.I.A.W. TOURNAMENT
A Warm and Wet Spring Is Predicted for the State
description: TRENTON, March 19 (UPI) Spring in the Garden State will be warmer and wetter this year, the National Weather Service's chief Trenton meteorologist predicted today.

title: $250,000 IS WON ON SHARED TICKET
description: VINELAND, March 20 (AP)Two funeral directors, who formed a partnership 17 months ago to buy lottery tickets, won the $250,000 grand prize today in the Jers?? Jackpot.

title: THAIS MAY BID U.S END ARMS AIRLIFT
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 20 (UPI}Leaders of the new Thai coalition Government suggested today that they might seek to end the United States airlift of munitions from Thailand to Cambodia.

title: VIETCONG REPORT BIG GAINS IN SOUTH
description: HONG KONG, March 20 (Reuters)The Vietcong high command said today that its forces had caused nearly 40,000 Government casualties and taken thousands of prisoners during its recent offensive.

title: DEMOCRATS ELECT WESTCHESTER CHIEF
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 20Westchester Democrats tonight elected Samuel Fredman, a 51yearold White Plains lawyer, as their new county chairman. He replaces Max Berking, who resigned Feb. 14.

title: Military Aid for Vietnam and Cambodia? No
description: WASHINGTONAs one member of a Congressional delegation of eight, I went to Vietnam and Cambodia on a factfinding mission. It was a sobering, highly educational, experience.

title: Berberian Recital Put Off
description: Cathy Berberian, who was scheduled to sing at Hunter College Playhouse tonight in the Divas and Diversions series, has influenza and will be unable to appear. Her recitalhas been rescheduled for June 3. when tickets issued for tonight will be honored.

title: World Popullation Likely To Pass 4 Billion April 1
description: WICHITA, Kan., March 20 (AP)By Dr. L. C. Nehrt's calculations, the world's population will break the fourbillion mark about April 1.

title: The Pop Life
description: Since the Who's original Tommy double album and the orchestral sequel have sold some 10 million copies, Ken Russell's film will probably attract a large rock audience.

title: SENATE MOVE ON TO END SAIGON AID
description: WASHINGTON, March 20In the face of Administration claims that Congressional reductions in military aid led to South Vietnam's military setbacks a bipartisan move deyeloped in the Senate today to cut off all military aid to Saigon this year.

title: Dominion Textile Is Seeking DHJ Industries
description: The Dominion Textile Company, Ltd., of Montreal, a major Canadian textile manufacturer announced yesterday that it was making a tender offer of $5 a share for all of the 1.6 million shares outstanding of DHJ Industries, Inc., a producer of a varied line of textile fabrics. DHJ was suspended from trading on the American Stock Exchange at its own request on Jan. 27 pending negotiations with institutional lenders and major suppliers for an extension agreement on its obligations. The company makes specialtyfabrics including interlinings. double knit fabrics and indigo dyed denim.

title: BEAR TRIMS PLAN FOR NEW SUBWAY
description: The Beame administration trimmed its sixyear subway extension program by three miles yesterday, limiting new construction to the Queens trunk line now under way from Central Park and 63d Street in Manhattan to Jamaica, Queens.

title: Witness Unable to Identify 2 at Attica
description: BUFFALO, March 20A former Attica inmate, who was released on parole 15 days ago, testified today he had seen a black inmate strike a prison guard he believed to have been Correction Officer William E. Quinn as convicts overran the Attica State Correctional Facility on Sept. 9, 1971.

title: Rheingold Workers Drink to a Year of New Life
description: In the year since Chock Full O'Nuts bought the Rheingold brewery and saved it from oblivion, the parent company's total earnings have dropped. But yesterday, at a celebration of one year of the takeover, company and union officials insisted that all the ingredients were present for the brewery to become profitable.

title: Terrorist Plot Broken, Argentina Says
description: BUENOS AIRES, March, 20The Argentine Government announced today it had broken up a vast subversive terrorist operation designed to paralyze production in the industrial zones north of Buenos Aires and to assassinate labor leaders.

title: U.C.L. A. Wins, 67.64
description: PORTLAND, Ore., (AP) The University of California, Los Angeles, held off hustling Montana tonight and struggled into the West regional final with a 6764 victory.

title: Miss Proell To End Cup Ski Career
description: ORTISEI, Italy, March 20 (AP) Annemarie Proell of Austria, who has won a fifth World Cup ski crown, announced her retirement after she was beaten today by LiseMarie Morerod in a special slalom ski race in this Dolomite resort.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 14.5 billion tonmiles, 15.1 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same week totaled 433,401 cars, 17.1 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 24.8 per cent below last year.

title: Janice C. Fortenbaugh Is Married
description: Janice C. Fortenbaugh, an art lecturer with Gallery Passport Ltd., a concern here that arranges art tours, and Roger B. Oresman, a partner in the law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy here, were married yesterday morning in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Terence J. Finlay.

title: CORPORATE PROFIT FELL IN QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Corporate profits before taxes fell by about $23billion to an annual rate of $134billion in the fourth quarter of last year, but almost the entire decline represented a drop in inventory profits, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Butterflies to Be First Insects on U.S Endangered List
description: For the first time, insects are joining some of their larger animal cousins on the United States Government list of creatures that may be facing extinction.

title: Dynamos Select Coach
description: DENVER, March 20 (AP)John Young, who coached the Miami Toros to second place in the North American Soccer League last year, was named today coach of the Denver Dynamos of the N.A.S.L. Joe Echelle, general manager of the Dallas Tornado for four years, was appointed Dynamos' general manager.

title: Principles Cited by S.E.C. In Delisting of OTC Stock
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission said today it would use the same basic principles in delisting a security from the overthecounter market as it uses with the rational, stock exchanges.

title: More LowerQuality Beef Is Appearing in the Nation's Markets
description: The amount of beef from rangefet cattle that have not been fed grain has increased in retail markets in recent months from the traditional 25 per cent to 40 per cent, Gordon Van Vleck, president of the American National Cattlemen's Association, said yesterday.

title: CONSUMER PRICES CLIMBED BY 0.6% DURING FEBRUARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 Consumer price inflation continued in February at the somewhat reduced rate that prevailed in January even though there was nearstability in food prices, the Labor Department reported today.

title: CONSUMER PRICES CLIMBED BY 0.6% DURING FEBRUARY
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 Consumer price inflation continued in February at the somewhat reduced rate that prevailed in January even though there was nearstability in food prices, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Opera: Selva Traviata
description: With all due respect to the New York Grand Opera's performance of Verdi's La Traviata on Wednesday night, it was where the opera was given that was of primary interest. The company, directed by Vincent La Selva, has appeared in all kinds of places a hotel ballroom, Central Park, the theater of Congregation B'nai Jeshurun. Its latest stop was the Harkness Theater.

title: William Hamling, 62, Dies; Labor Party Aide to Wilson
description: LONDON, March 20 (Reuters) William Hamling, Prime Minister Harold Wilson's Parliamentary secretary, died last evening, reducing the Government's majority in the House of Commons to a single vote.

title: Blacks Are on the Inside Now, Looking Out
description: ATLANTABlack comedians usually get a laugh when they turn around that old racial joke whites used to tell about blacks.

title: Senate Rewrites Tax Bill, Adding Pensioners' Grant
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The Senate scrapped today all the work it had done on the tax bill in the last two days and voted to start over again with a somewhat larger antirecession package, including a $100 cash payment to every recipient of Social Security, railroad retirement or Federal welfare benefits.

title: Forego Is Sidelined With Ankle Injury
description: HALLANDALE. Fla., March 20 (AP)Forego, 1974 horse of the year and oddson favorite to win Saturday's $124,200 Gulfstream Handicap Stakes, was withdrawn from the race today because of an ankle injury.

title: Seals Tie Penguins, 33
description: OAKLAND (UPI)Charlie Simmer's disputed goal late in the second period last night gave the California Golden Seals a 33 N.H.L. tie with the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: Profile of the Bettor
description: What kind of people bet at OTB offices? To find out, the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation took random samples at assorted branches and came up with the following information.

title: Ford Likely to Name Aide in Spy Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON, March 20President Ford is expected to appoint a special assistant in the White House to deal with the proliferating investigations of the United States intelligence community, reliable White House sources have disclosed.

title: Capitals Set Loss Record
description: LANDOVER, Md., March 20 (UPS)  The Washington Capitals surpassed the record for most losses in an N.H.L. season tonight as the Minnesota North Stars scored foot times in the third period enroute to a 51 victory.

title: F.E.A. to Order 710,000 Refund To the Georgia Power Company
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The Federal Energy Administration said tonight that it would order a multistate marketer of petroleum products to refund $710,000 to the Georgia Power Company of Atlanta.

title: Bridge:
description: HONOLULU, March 20 The Vanderbilt knockout team championship continued here this afternoon at the American Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals, with 16 teams, five of them led by New York stars, in contention.

title: Vilas Is Ready
description: Guillermo Vitas, the Grand Prix champion who has been sidelined since January with stomach disorder, is ready to play in his first tournament, his manager said at the Felt Forum.

title: Montclair Operetta Club in 50th Year
description: The Montclair Operetta club has been calling its alumni home this week to celebrate its 50th anniversary. The club is, according to its historians, the oldest continuously operating little theater musical group in the country  a distinction it holds by the narrow margin of two days. The Omaha Playhouse, which presents both musicals and straight plays, made its debut two days after the Montclair Club raised its first curtain on Gilbert and Sullivan's Pirates of Penzance on Nov. 21, 1925.

title: Article 1  No Title
Guard Who Lied About Attica May Be Disciplined by the State
description: The State Correctional Services Department yesterday began considering possible disciplinary action against a prison guard who has testified that he falsely accused an inmate of striking a guard at the start of the Attica revolt in September, 1971.

title: Oregon State, Central Mich. Eliminated
description: DAYTON, Ohio, March 20 That big IndianaKentucky rematch will take place, as expected. Saturday in the third round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament because the Hoosiers and Wildcats triumphed tonight in the Midwest regional semifinal round games.

title: Rangers Win in 10th
description: The Rangers won the game. 32, on Joe Lovitto's runscoring squeeze bunt in the 10th inning. The Yankees challenged in the last half of the inning, but Martin obviously wanting to win the game, brought in a relief pitcher. Jim Umbarger, who stifled the threat.

title: CAMBODIA REBELS SAID TO PULL BACK
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Friday, March 21  Insurgent troops that penetrated to the eastern banks of the Mekong River opposite Phnom Penh's naval base Wednesday were driven inland yesterday by Cambodian Government counterattacks, Cambodian and Western military officials reported.

title: British Unemployment Rising
description: LONDON, March 20 (Reuters) Unemployment in Britain has reached its highest level in two years, with 3.5 per cent of the work force803,000out of jobs, the Government reported today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Feast In Bahamas Is Wahoo, Snapper
description: CHUB CAY, The Bahamas If A. J. McClane isn't catching fish, he is thinking of ways to prepare them.

title: BIG WHEAT SHIPMENT TO INDIA SET BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)The United States has agreed to ship 800,000 tons of wheat worth $128million to India under the easy terms of the Food for Peace Program, officials announced today.

title: China Trip Approved By U.S. Track Stars
Puerto Rican Migrants Win Record Pay Raises
description: Farmers in New Jersey and other Eastern states will pay record  high wages to field hands from Puerto Rico this year.

title: Vietnam's Crisis
description: North Vietnam's wideranging military advancesthe first resumption of largescale warfare since 1972and Saigon's dramatic withdrawals have created a new situation in Indochina. It cannot fail to affect the politics of South Vietnam and the American debate over aid to Saigon.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MARCH 21, 1975

title: Scott's Father Denies Hearst Case Role
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 20 John J. Scott Sr., whose son is sought or questioning in connection with the Patricia Hearst kidnapping case, denied to newsmen today that he had seen or harbored Mis Hearst or other members of the selfstyled Smybionese Liberation Army. But the elder Scott refused on constitutional grounds to answer questions before a Federal grand jury here.

title: Peking Names Nationalists Released Under Amnesty
description: PEKING, March 20 (Reuters) The newspaper Jenmen Jih Pao today published a partial list of 293 Nationalists released under an amnesty yesterday.

title: J. P. Stevens Cuts Dividend
description: J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., announced yesterday that it was cutting its regular quarterly dividend on common stock to 20 cents a share from 30 cents a share. The textile company's dividend is payable April 30 to shareholders of record April 4.

title: Lisbon Reds Seek to Oust Centrists From Coalition
description: LISBON, March 20The Portuguese Communist party, more aggressive and influential than ever since last week's abortive rightwing military uprising, moved today to eliminate a major centrist group from a role in government and called for greater control over the foreign press.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Weekly Retail Sates Up 3%
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The Department of Commerce reported today that total retail store sales last week were an estimated $10.61billion, up 3 per cent from the yearearlier $10.30billion. Department store sales were about $922million, virtually unchanged from last year's $921million.

title: TREASURY FAULTS A SECURITIES BILL
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The Treasury Department informed Congress today that it could not support passage of a bill creating a nations market board to regulate the projected central market system for securities transactions.

title: Oba Koso Is a Joyful Musical
description: After a 12year run in Africa and a successful American tour, including a recent stand at the Arena Stage in Washington, Oba Koso, a Yoruba folk musical, is at the La Mama Annex (through tomorrow evening). Such an internationally acclaimed presentation would normally be found at Lincoln Center or at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, but it is probably even more at home in these informal surroundings.

title: Beame Trims Plans for New Subway
description: The Beame administration trimmed its sixyear subway extension program by three miles yesterday, limiting new construction to the Queens trunk line now under way from Central Park and 63d Street in Manhattan to Jamaica, Queens.

title: Assembly Democrats Plan $629Million in Taxes
description: ALBANY, March 20  The Democratic majority in the Assembly plans to propose about $620million in new taxes, with half that amount to finance Governor Carey's proposed budget and half tied to increases in aid for local schools and governments beyond the level the Governor recommended.

title: DEMOCRATIC TEST WON BY STRAUSS
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Robert S. Strauss, the Democratic National Chairman, pushed through his choice as president of the party's State Chairmen's Association today over the objections of an angry group of liberals.

title: McKissick Concedes Political Tie in Soul City Birth
description: HENDERSON, N.C., March 20 Floyd B. McKissick, the former civil rights leader, acknowledged today that the development of Soul City was not lacking in political implications, b?? denied impropriety in his dealings with the Government in the building of the new town a few miles north of here.

title: H. M. Kinzer, 52, Editor Of 8 Ziff Davis Annuals
description: H. M. Kinzer, editor of Photography Annual and seven other annual publications of the Ziff Davis Publishing Company, and author of a number of books on photography, died Wednesday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 477 Second Avenue.

title: Kosygin Urges Windup of the European Parley
description: MOSCOW, March 20Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin called today for a summitlevel windup of the European security talks at the earliest possible date:

title: 3 U.S. Oil Concerns In Pact With Syria
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, March 20 The Syrian Government has signed an agreement with group of independent American oil companies for offshore exploration on Syria's Mediterranean coast under a production sharing contract.

title: Suspect in Hughes Burglary Hunted in St. Louis
description: LOS ANGELES, March 20Donald R. Woolbright, indicted here in connection with the 1974 burglary of Howard R. Hughes's Romaine Street headquarters, was the subject of a police manhunt today in St. Louis, according to Missouri slaw enforcement sources.

title: Aeros Triumph, 53
description: HOUSTON, Tex., March 20 (AP)Murray Hall scored a pair of goals tonight to lead the Houston Aeros to a 53 W.H.A. victory over the Quebec Nordiques.

title: Critic's Notebook: Opera in Europe Has Woes Too
description: A fiveweek swing through the major opera houses of Europe demonstrated that New York and the big European cities have at least one thing in common. Tickets are sometimes very hard to get, and if it is a lastminute proposition, not even the concierge of a major hotel can help. These impressive, omniscient, omnipotent gentlemen can normally get anything for a guest. But ask for a pair for La Scala, and the concierge will shrug his shoulders. Impossible.

title: In Mexico, Size of Oil Reserves Kept Secret
description: MEXICO CITY, March 20The Mexican Government has announced highly promising new oil finds in the state of Veracruz but continues to withhold information about the size of its extensive deposits in the southeastern states of Chiapas and Tabasco.

title: MICHAEL KALLESSER
description: Michael Kallesser, a playwright, died Wednesday in Holmdel, N.J. He was 89 years old and lived in Belleville, N.J.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Supreme Court in Trenton refused to reinstate a $25,000 negligence award to Charlene Dobbins, a student who seriously injured her knee in a gym class foot race held in the school parking lot. In a onesentence ruling, the court upheld by a 4to3 margin a ruling by the Appellate Division of Superior Court that overturned the jury judgment against the Henry Hudson Regional School system of Highlands. The Appellate Division had ruled last year that the local school board was exempt from a negligence suit even though the accident involved the use of school property, because there was no apparent negligence in the upkeep of the parking lot.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WAY UP HIGH The curious surprise at the Rainbow Room (PL 79090), atop Rockefeller Center, is a feeling of intimacy, for all the expected splendor, partly because of the encircling sweep of Manhattan lights through the tall windows 65 stories above the street. The room is under new management and has reverted to a policy of dining and dancing to a name band, the way the place began back in 1934.

title: A Coloradan Reports Sighting Miss Hearst
description: CANON CITY, Colo., March 20 (AP)  The sheriff of a rural county south of Denver said tonight that he believed Patricia Hearst had been in the area last week, based on statements from a rancher who said he had bought Miss Heart's lunch last Wednesday or Thursday.

title: Butler Describes View From the Pantry
description: Henry Burke doesn't think he missed an installment of Upstairs, Downstairs, and scarcely a week went by that he didn't enjoy a shock of recognition and recollection.

title: Selecting Judges, After All the Debate, Is Still an Inexact Thing
description: After decades of debate among politicians, lawyers and goodgovernment groups, the selection of judges is still a haphazard: imperfect business.

title: Kissinger Efforts Focus On a Territorial Question
description: JERUSALEM, Saturday, March 22The negotiations for a new EgyptianIsraeli agreement on Sinai seemed to have narrowed today to a crucial question of how much occupied territory Israel would agree to give up in return for Egyptian political assurances that fall short of Israel's original demand.

title: General Bradley Improving
description: LOS ANGELES, March 21 AP)  General of the Army Omar N. Bradley continued to improve today but had not been taken off the critical list at UCLA Medical Center, an Army spokesman said. The 82yearold fivestar general, the nation's highest ranking military officer, suffered a stroke on Monday at his home in nearby Beverly Hills.

title: Aladdin's Genie Greets Iranian New Year Here
description: The genie who sent oil prices booming and made the Shahinshah a king of kings has now worked his magic for Morris Mehdyzadeh, an Iranian merchant of merchants.

title: Saigon and Hue: An Aura of Grace, Beauty and Loss
description: The following dispatch was written by Malcolm W. Browne, a New York Times correspondent who began reporting from Vietnam in 1961.

title: Palestinians Agree to Joint Commands With Syrians
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, March 21 The Palestine Liberation Organization agreed today to create political and military commands with Syria.

title: Hoyle Disputes Nobel Physics Award
description: LONDON, March 21Sir Fred Hoyle, the British astronomer, said in Montreal today that Prof. Anthony Hewish won the Nobel Prize for Physics last year by claiming credit for studies carried out by an assistant. Jocelyn Bell. The allegation brought an angry denial from Dr. Hewish, professor of radioastronomy at Cambridge University.

title: Notes on People
description: Armed with a threepage manual on how to behave, sent to him by Buckingham Palace, Ambassador Elliot L. Richardson and his wife, Anne, went by horse and carriage yesterday to present his credentials to Queen Elizabeth II. He was to carry them in his left hand, the outline said, so his right would be free for the royal handshake. The Queen will then converse informally with the ambassador, said the instructions, after which the Richardsons were to withdraw, turning their backs to the Queen, but face her again at the door and make a final bow and curtsy together. According to the Embassy, there were no gaffes.

title: Congress Looks Beyond the Easter Recess
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Congressional leaders, caught between Easter recess plans, parliamentary rules and considerable opposition to Administration requests, today virtually wrote aft any chalice that Congress would act on emergency military aid for South Vietnam and Cambodia before midApril.

title: Ducky Medwick, Slugger For Gas House Gang, Dies
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 21Joe (Ducky) Medwick, a member of baseball's Hall of Fame, died today of a heart attack. He was 63 years old and had been a batting instructor at the St. Louis Cardinals' training camp.

title: Screen: Boring Arnold
description: ARNOLD directed by Georg Fenady; screenplay, Jameson Brewer and John Fenton, Murray; director of photography, William Jurgenson; film editor, Melvin Shapiro; music, George Duping; produced by Andrew J. Fenady; released bu American international Pictures. At neighborhood theaters. Running time: 95 minutes. This film is classfield PG.

title: Erving's 16Point Burst Propels Nets to Victory
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., March 21  The Kentucky Colonels shut off Julius Erving for 27 minutes tonight. But once the Doctor got turned on, he turned the Colonels off.

title: 39 HURT IN BELFAST BY BOMB IN A CAFE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland March 21Thirtynine persons were injured today by a bomb that exploded without warning in a restaurant here.

title: Dave Anderson
description: CLEVELAND, March 21  When the Cleveland Cavaliers joined the National Basketball Association four seasons ago, their coach, Bill Fitch, somehow kept his sense of humor, which probably is why he also kept his sanity. After the Cavaliers opened with 15 consecutive losses, he said We're the only team to lose nine in a row and then 20 into a slump. He often sounded more like a standup comic than a standup coach. We're the only team who could play backtoback games on What's My Line and stump the panel. . . . Mission Impossible didn't even want us on their show . . . I feel like a guy whose ship came in only to find there was a dock strikeb .... I phoned DialaPrayer, but when they found out who it was, they hung up. . . . When we get to our rooms on road trips, there's always a message for us in the Bibles. But the message today that the Cleveland Cavaliers, with successive victories over the Washington Bullets and the Chicago Bulls, no longer are a laughing matter, especially to the New York Knicks in their struggle to qualify for the N.B.A. playoffs.

title: Allende's Sister in Mexico After Flight From Chile
description: MEXICO CITY, March 21 (AP)A commercial jetliner brought Laura Allende Pascal, sister of Chile's late Marxist President Salvador Allende Gossens, and 94 other political prisoners to Mexico today from Chile.

title: Red Gains at Saigon Seen As Key to a Victory Drive
description: Continuing Communist success in the critical Saigon area may lead to an allout offensive aimed at winning the war this spring, according to United States military sources.

title: Soviet Reschedules Fete of Academy of Sciences
description: MOSCOW, March 21  A commemoration of the 250th anniversary of the Academy of Sciences here, which was abruptly canceled last May, has been rescheduled for next October, the, Soviet Union announced today.

title: House Votes $1.3Billion Housing Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)The House passed today an emergency housing program that its sponsors said would revive the depressed homebuilding industry and ultimately help the entire economy recover.

title: Soviet Warns Roy Medvedev To Halt His Dissident Journal
description: MOSCOW, March 21 (Reuters)The dissident Soviet historian Roy, A. Medvedev was called to the Moscow public prosecutor's office today and warned to drop his new journal intended to voice loyal criticism of the Soviet system, friends said.

title: Alcoa to Drop 60 Workers At Massena, N. Y., Plant
description: MASSENA, N. Y., March 21 (UPI)The Aluminum Company of America announced today it would lay off 60 employes at its Massena operations because of a 20,000ton production curtailment caused by the lagging economy.

title: Article 2  No Title
Immaculata Gains Tournament Final
description: HARRISONBURG, Va. March 21Immaculata College, the threetime national champion, moved into the final of the fourth annual Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women basketball tournament tonight with a 6354 victory over California State at Fullerton.

title: Kissinger Efforts Focus On a Territorial Question
description: JERUSALEM, Saturday, March 22The negotiations for a new EgyptianIsraeli agreement on Sinai seemed to have narrowed today to a crucial question of how much occupied territory Israel would agree to give up in return for Egyptian political assurances that fall short of Israel's original demand.

title: Israelis Report Gunfire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 21 (Reuters) Israeli troops and Palestinian guerrillas exchanged fire today near the southern Lebanese village of Kafr Shuba residents said. No casualties were reported. The village was heavily damaged by artillery in January and is being rebuilt.

title: Red Gains in Portugal Upsetting Leftists Groups in Rest of Europe
description: PARIS, March 21  Portugal's sharp swing to the left and the way it has come about have startled and upset Western Europe's leftist parties They are watching for the problems the developments may cause them at home.

title: Hanoi Reports Sweeping Gains By the Vietcong Over 2 Weeks
description: TOKYO, March 21 (AP)The Hanoi Radio said today that within the last two weeks the Vietcong had taken over approximately a quarter of South Vietnam with a population of nearly one million. It also said that they had established governing bodies in Ban Me Thuot, capital of Darlac Prowince in the Central Highlands.

title: ;Famine Speeds Somalia's Drive to Resettle Nomads in Communes
description: HALIN, Somalia  Dislocations caused by the drought and famine besetting Somalia have been seized upon by the governing military council to speed up a timetable for resettling nomads.

title: SCOVILL INCREASING BRASS ITEM PRICES
description: The Scovill Manufacturing Company said it was increasing the price of its freecutting brass rod alloys and the mill purchasing price for freecutting brass chips by 3 cents a pound.

title: 2 CHILDREN SOUGHT IN 17STATE ALARM
description: The police in Union City, N.J., broadcast a 17state alarm yesterday for an 11yearold girl and her 6yearold brother who apparently were abducted on their way to school.

title: Identification Apparatus Relies on Body Vibration
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 The president of an Ohio company has invented identification apparatus that relies on the characteristic vibration of the human body. Acoustical wave energy can be transmitted from one finger to another and be recorded for later reference. James H. Ott, who heads the Novar Electronics Corporation, Barberton, was awarded Patent 3,872,443 this week for the apparatus and method, which deal with frequency response.

title: CRASHED JET SEEN AS WEATHER CLEARS
description: QUILCENE, Wash., March 21 (AP)The Forest Service headquarters at Quilcene said today that a sudden clearing of weather had allowed aircraft to spot a downed Air Force C141 Stadirlter that crashed in the rugged Olympic Mountains last night.

title: Market Place
description: Under a littlenoticed section of the Keogh pension legislation, a few commercial banks have set up trusts under which selfemployed individuals have been able to direct the investment of their own taxsheltered pension money.

title: Kidnapped Girl, 11, Brother, 6, Are Sought in a 17State Alarm
description: The police in Union City, N.J., broadcast a 17state alarm yesterday for an 11yearold girl and her 6yearold brothel who apparently were abducted on their way to school. The children, Elsi and Robert Hall, were last seen about 8:20 A.M. yesterday on their way to the Edison school from their home at 721 Seventh Street. According to three children who told the police basically the same story, a man grabbed Elsi in the parking lot of the Washington Towers apartments next to the school and dragged her into his car.

title: CALLENDER QUITS URBAN COALITION
description: Dr. Eugene S. Callender has resigned as president of the New York Urban Coalition, which has sharply cut back its activities because of financial stress.

title: MESKILL BACKED FOR U.S. BENCH
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Senate Judiciary Commit tee approved today by a vote of 8 to 6 the controversia Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Conjudical nomination of forme Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut, amid predictions of a floor fight.

title: City Asks for Federal Aid To Get Cash in 30 Days
description: City officials appealed to the Federal Government at a meeting here yesterday for an infusion of what one of them called a massive amount of cash into the city's treasury.

title: Ford Backs Science Study
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)President Ford conferred today with 21 members of the National Science Board and called on Federal agencies to concentrate scientific research on projects with the highest priority.

title: Bayonne Cheers a Hometown Product
description: BAYONNE, March 21The telephone rang constantly at Churchill's Inn, the Good Times Cafe and at Johnny Di's Bar over the last few days until it seemed like half of this industrial town was heading for Cleveland to cheer Charles (Chuck) Wenner in his longshot bid to defeat Muhammad Ali, the heavyweight boxing chainpion.

title: City Moves to Curb Illegal Dumping
description: A City Council committee moved to stiffen penalties for illegal dumping of construction debris and household refuse, a problem that is said to be growing in all five boroughs. After hearing Sanitation Commissioner Robert T. Groh testify that the current antidumping law is not effective, the Council's Committee on Environmental Protection reached agreement in principle to raise the minimum fine to $250 from $100 and add a system of civil penalties to the criminal enforcement already in effect.

title: Church Music: LowKeyed
description: Frank Spoto sings at St. James' Episcopal Church during Sunday services and at Temple EmanuEl on Fridays. Saturdays and weekdays. He also sings at funeral masses in Roman Catholic churches whenever he gets a chance.

title: Hull Sets W.H.A. Mark
description: HARTFORD, March 21 (AP) Bobby Hull of Winnipeg, with a goal and two assists, set a World Hockey Association record of 127 points for a single season tonight as the Jets won, 63, from the New England Whalers. Hull has 69 goals and 58 assists.

title: Amtrak Sets a $99 Fare For Florida RoundTrip
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)Amtrak has announced a spring season roundtrip coach excursion fare of $99 between New York or Chicago and all Florida cities served by Amtrak.

title: About the Rangers.
description: Brad' Park,.the Ranger captain who has been out of the lineup since last Feb. 16 when he strained his left knee, is set to skate against Boston tomorrow during power plays. . . . Starting time for the Bruins game at the Garden is set for 8:05 P.M. . . . Ron Greshner broke a club record for rookies by registering his 34th assist of the season in Buffalo. The 20yearold defensman is three shy of the National Hockey League mark set by Denis Potvin of the Islanders. . . . I don't think I embarrassed myself, said Dunc Wilson, who played only his third game in goal for the Rangers Thursday night, though losing to the Sabres, 63. Wilson admitted that being on a team with three goalies wasn't the best way to keep one's timing sharp. . . . The way I judge a goalie, said Coach Emile Francis, is how he plays when behind. Dune played vary well after those three quick ones by Buffalo.

title: Phones Ringing Again
description: The sweet sounds of jangling telephones were heard once again yesterday evening in the 300block area in Manhattan that has been without telephone service for more than three weeks, as the New York Telephone Company met its 11:59 P.M. deadline for full restoration of service to the area. Page 49.

title: U.S. AGENCY ADMITS EVADER LIST ERROR
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)The Justice Department has decided to drop draftevasion cases against 50 to 75 persons whose names were inadvertently omitted from a final list of those still subject to prosecution.

title: ROAD OUT OF HUE: LONG NIGHTMARE
description: HAI VAN PASS, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 22By the thousands, the people are abandoning Hue, the former capital of Vietnam, and the road south from the city is a scene of human suffering.

title: DOUGLAS TO RECALL 1,000 IDLE WORKERS
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., March 21 (UPI)About 1,000 of 7,000 furloughed workers at the Douglas Aircraft plant here will be called back to work Monday, the company announced today.

title: Strip Mine Struggle
description: Strip mining of coal is commercially profitable and environmentally reckless. In Appalachia, countless hillsides bear the savage scars of mining which gouged away the topsoil and vegetation to get at the seams of coal. Once the coal had been extracted, the strip operators moved on, leaving huge heaps of excavated debris and causing mountain streams to be polluted with silt and chemically toxic elements.

title: PENNSYLVANIA SEEKS FUNDS FOR STRIKERS
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21 (AP)The Governor of Pennsylvania, Milton J. Shapp, said today that the state would seek funds to help finance a raise for Philadelphia's striking transit workers.

title: 20,042 Watch Golden Gloves
description: A near capacity crowd of 20,042 fans saw 49th edition of the Golden Gloves parade of champions at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: FMC IS INDICTED IN A PRICING SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)A Chicago company and five foreign companies were indicted today on a Federal charge of fixing prices of chemicals used in making plastics.

title: Amnesty and Calley
description: The reversal of Lieut. William Calley's My Lai conviction shows that Congress in effect granted amnesty to Lieutenant Calley. Congress did so, moreover, in a backhanded way that was not known to most Americans and probably even most Congressmen.

title: Selecting Judges, After All the Debate, Is Still an Inexact Thing
description: After decades of debate among politicians, lawyers and goodgovernment groups, the selection of judges is still a haphazard, imperfect business.

title: ADVANCE SHOWN BY GRAIN FUTURES
description: Grain and soybean futures contracts rose sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. There was talk of heavy export buying by a major grain company possibly hedging its sales to the Soviet Union.

title: MILLER DANCES GET A MUSICAL BOOST
description: A dance concert by Joan Miller's Chamber Arts/Dance Players is as much a collaborative venture in music and dance because of the strong role played by Gwendolyn Watson in the company. Miss Watson, a zany but serious musician, was on hand again when the troupe performed Thursday night in a Hunter College gymnasium.

title: McCreary Leads Rout By Flames
description: ATLANTA, March 21 (UPI) Keith McCreary, in a spectacular scoring outburst at the end of a unspectacular season, scored four goals tonight to lead the Atlanta Flames to a 124 drubbing of the Vancouver Canucks in a National Hockey League game.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 75 Nations Finish Talks on Methods For Cuts in Tariffs
description: GENEVA, March 21Seventyfive nations completed today a first exchange of views on how they would go about negotiating for tariff cuts at the new round of trade talks.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: DR. JOSEPH BOLTON

title: Fresh Allegations Of Torture Made Against Rio Police
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 21 New accusations of torture and other abuses were leveled today against Brazilian security services.

title: Jeisey School Aide Warns on Tenure For PartTimers
description: TRENTON, March 21Ralph A. Dungan, Chancellor of Higher Education, warned today that granting tenure on the basis of parttime teaching could create chaos in New Jersey colleges, high schools and elementary schools by filling them with more teachers than they wanted.

title: $12.7 Million Housing Aid Announced
description: The state's Housing Finance Agency announced $12.7million in mortgage loans to finance the construction of housing developments in Newark and Hazlett. The agency sells taxfree bonds and then lends the proceeds at low interest rates for the development of lowincome housing and housing for the aged.

title: ... A.M.A.'s Militancy
description: The American Medical Association's statement backing the New York strike was a clear reversal of position. It must have shocked many of the older and more conservative physicians, but it doubtless responded to the new militancy among a large proportion of the nation's doctors. The A.M.A. leadership probably interprets the current situation more accurately than does George Meany, aging president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., who last month publicly decried the possibility of organizing medical men and added that there's no place for them in his union federation.

title: DECISION ON SENATOR APPEALED BY JERSEY
description: The New Jersey Senate asked the Federal Court of Appeals in Philadelphia yesterday to reverse a lower court's decision ordering the Senate to reinstate Senator Alene S. Ammond, Democrat of Camden, to her party's majority caucus.

title: Utility Held Responsible for Fish Kill
description: The Superior Court's Appellate Division ruled that the Jersey Central Power & Light Company was responsible for the death of half a million menhaden near its Oyster Creek nuclear plant in 1972 and upheld the state's right to collect damages. However, the court said the state was entitled to only $935 for the fish and not a greater unspecified amount for damage to the environment. The court ruled that the fish died from thermal shock when the power company shut the plant and stopped pumping warm water into the tidal creek, causing the water temperature to drop 13 degrees in 24 hours.

title: FIGHTING ERUPTS WEST OF SAIGON; BASE CAMP LOST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, saturday, March 22Heavy fighting flared near Saigon yesterday, as tens of thousands of refugees streamed south in a panicky exodus from advancing North Vietnamese troops.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Today, March 21

title: CARRILLO CENTENARY MARKED BY CARNEGIE
description: Although Maurice Ravel is getting most of the centenary attention this year, he was nott the only noted musician born in 1875. Another was Julien Carrillo, a Mexican of Indian extraction who devoted much of his life to experimentation with quarter tones and other aspects of ultrachromaticism.

title: Pasadena. Birthplace of the Rose Parade, Fights Decay, Unemployment and Smog
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 21 Eightyfive years ago, in the first blush of local boosterism, the proud residents of Pasadena discovered that they could advertise their marvelous country to a snowbound nation with a rose. It was decided that on New Year's Day there would be a parade down Colorado Boulevard of buggies festooned with fresh roses.

title: BAKER IS GUILTY IN JUDGE'S DEATH
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., March 21David J. Vervaet, a 19yearold baker, was convicted of manslaughter today in the sniper shooting of Magistrate Joseph J. Crescente during a court recess in Wanaque.

title: Butler Describes View From the Pantry
description: Henry Burke doesn't think he Missed an installment of Upstairs, Downstairs, and scarcely a week went by that he didn't enjoy a shock of recognition and recollection.

title: NEW BOSTON PLAN SAID TO CUT BUSING
description: BOSTON, March 21Experts named by the Federal District Court here to draw up next fall's citywide school desegregation disclosed a draft plan today that they said would desegregate more classrooms with less busing than the interim plan, which has led to controversy and sporadic violence.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE HOUSE OF MEDICI: Its Rise end Fall. By Christopher Hibbert. Illustrated. 364 pages. Morrow. $12.50. THE MEDICI: A Tale of Fifteen Generations. By James Cleugh. 397 pages. Doubleday. $9.95.

title: DEMOCRATS AVERT CLASH AT PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Democratic National Committee picked its way through a pair of ideological minefields without mishap today.

title: STOCKS WEAKEN ON PROFIT TAKING
description: Profit taking continued to weaken stock prices yesterday for the fourth consecutive session as volume decreased sharply.

title: FIGHTING ERUPTS WEST OF SAIGON; BASE CAMP LOST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 22Heavy fighting flared near Saigon yesterday, as tens of thousands of refugees streamed south in a panicky exodus from advancing North Vietnamese troops.

title: 3 Politicians Named in NursingHome Testimony
description: BUFFALO. March 21  The names of three prominent politicians figured today in testimony before the State Temporary Commission on Living Costs and the Economy about nursing home to be built here by a Queens construction company.

title: Troops Parade in Nairobi As Kenya Unrest Continues
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, March 21 (AP)Jet fighters roared low over Nairobi and hundreds of troops paraded through the city today in an unannounced display of might.

title: SENATE, 60 TO 29, PASSES TAX CUT OF $29.2BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Saturday, March 22The Senate passed a $29.2billion taxreduction bill today, after adding some more amendments including one that would remove all limitations on the deductions that working parents may take for childcare expenses.

title: U.S. Aide Cites Great Progress in Cancer Fight, Disputing Critics
description: SAN DIEGO, March 21The director of the National Cancer Institute said here today that substantial progress had been made under the 1971 National Cancer Act, but that it would take at least a decade for the benefits of this progress to be reflected in overall national survival statistics.

title: Doctors' Return...
description: The formula that settled the strike of internes and residents at a score of New York City hospitals brings to a dignified and constructive end an unhappy confrontation in a field where labormanagement confrontations should not occur.

title: Hospitals Back to Normal; Strike Effect Called Mixed
description: Internes and resident physicians were back at work yesterday in 21 hospitals here after a fourday strike that their leaders said had won them, for the first time in the country's history, a limit on the number of hours that internes and residents could be required to work.

title: Ethiopia's Military Government Abolishes Monarchy and Titles
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, March 21 (Reuters)Ethiopia's leftwing military Government abolished the crown tonight in an apparent move to prepare for the eventual establishment of a socialist republic.

title: Reuben B. Gryzmich, 89, Boston Philanthropist. Dies
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., March 21 (AP)Reuben B, Gryzmich, a philanthropist of Boston and a founder of the United Jewish Appeal, died here yesterday. He was 89 years old.

title: DOLLAR ADVANCES IN MODERATE DAY
description: LONDON, March 21 (AP)The dollar rose against major European currencies today, but again selling from New York trimmed its gains late in the day. Turnover appeared to be moderate.

title: Coded Cards Secure Big Share In BusinessProtection Systems
description: Coded cards are replacing keys as the device to unlock doors in many of the security systems proliferating in offices and factories throughout the country.

title: Funeral for Perle Mesta Is Private in Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, March 21A private Christian Science service attended by seven members of her family and two friends marked the funeral today of Perle Mesta, the internationally known Washington hostess and former Minister to Luxembourg.

title: STEREOTYPERS HALT TALKS WITH PAPERS
description: Stereotypers Union No. 1 announced yesterday that it had broken off negotiations with the Publishers Association of New York City and that it would seek the assistance of a mediator.

title: Joyriding Soviet Engineer Is Called Spy
description: An alleged Soviet intelligence agent who was arrested here last week on charges of intoxication, stealing a taxicab and sideswiping another car is now planning to return to the Soviet Union tomorrow.

title: Sutton Says He Paid Fee For Cash in Fort Lee Plot
description: NEWARK, March 21They key prosecution witness in the Fort Lee bribery trial in Federal Court here testified today that he paid a $20,000 premium for a 560.000 loan last spring from a man whose name he did not know.

title: Opera: Newin Turandot
description: Puccini's Turandot is as thin as a mandarin's fan, but the New York City Opera's new production with its fanciful sets and costumes by Bent Montressor can make one overlook many of its deficiencies. The fourth performance, on Thursday night at the State Theater, enjoyed a splendidly lyrical and cohesive orchestral reading under Julius Rudel's baton, and passable singing in all major roles.

title: ARGENTINE TOLL 16 IN 2DAY VIOLENCE
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 21Political violence in Argentina has stepped up sharply, with the death of 16 people in the last two days.

title: Accused Slayer Convicted
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 21 (UPI)Donald Jones, 21 years old, of Pittsburgh, was found guilty yesterday of thirddegree murder in the Christmas night slaying of Robert Bedney. 31, of New York.

title: Antiques: Now, 3 Centers
description: When Norman Crider's Antiques Center of America opened at 415 East 53d Street five years ago, there were high hopes that the establishment designed to accommodate 80 dealers would be the first of several offering onestop shopping for everything from period aviaries to vintage zithers.

title: Harassed Lisbon Party May Quit Race
description: LISBON, March 21The only remaining Portuguese conservative party still authorized to participate in the election scheduled for next month has come under such heavy attack that its leaders are sleeping in different places each night.

title: People in Sports
description: Marty Riessen, who has never seen a World Team Tennis match, signed a threeyear contract yesterday worth $250,000 to be the playercoach of the Cleveland Nets. The thirdranked player in the United States has been out of action recently because of an injured right forearm, but plans to return to the Red Group of World Championship Tennis next week in Atlanta.

title: Soviet Paper Accuses Finland Of AntiCommunist Campaign
description: MOSCOW, March 21 (Reuters)  Pravda asserted today that an antiCommunist campaign was under way in neighboring Finland and accused the largest Finnish newspaper of taking part in it.

title: What Eleanor Did
description: Is there a way of speeding up a crackdown on the unlawful use of guns?

title: 6th Earth Day Loses Out to Spring's 1st
description: Once upon a time, when the environment was a hot issue, you could get a crowd for Earth Day, though people in the crowd were always somewhat puzzled about what they were supposed to do. Nowadays, you can't even get the crowd.

title: People and Business
description: Volkswagen's consideration of a plan to build a plant in the United States is not subject for discussion any more  the matter is finished, Erich Keupker, a member of Volkswagenwerk's supervisory board and economics minister of the state of Lower Saxony, said yesterday in West Germany.

title: The Shah (II): Authority
description: TEHERAN, Iran  Fourteen years ago Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlavi wrote a book in which he strongly defended multiparty (basically twoparty) politics for Iran and asserted his duty as a monarch to work for this Now he has decreed that henceforth only a single organization, the new National Resurgence party, will be tolerated. Why, I asked him, the change?

title: House Unit Is Told That C.I.A. Spied on Mail to Red Countries
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)The Central Intelligence Agency, with full cooperation from the Postal Service, illegally opened some mail that was sent between the United States and Communist countries between 1953 and 1973. Congressional testimony disclosed today.

title: ExMeat Dealer Jailed for Lying to U.S.
description: Benard Feldman of Yonkers, a former meat wholesaler, was sentenced to 18 months in jail and fined $10,000 for making false statements to the Agriculture Department.'Mr. Feldman, 51 years old, pleaded guilty last month to lying to the department on an application for meat and poultry inspection for his Manhattan concern, the House of Benard. The defendant had been convicted in 1949 of bribing an Army sergeant to accept substandard meat and in 1969 for forging a Federal Agriculture Department inspection seal. Judge Keven T. Duffy in Federal Court, Manhattan, directed that Mr. Feldman, now a real estate dealer and antique dealer, be jailed immediately.

title: Opera: Wagner at Met
description: All in fashionable Wagnerian darkness, the Wolfgang WeberGnther SchneiderSiemssen Gtterdmmerung received its first performance last night as the last of the current Metropolitan Opera's Ring cycle.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FOR SAIL The coal and wood burners that once took New Yorkers about the harbar havecome and gone, but sailing vessels, an answer to fuel shortages, may go on forever. There's a 70foot doubleplanked (mahogany over cedar) yawl, the Petrel, that is taking passengers for twohour harbor cruises out of Gangway A in Battery Park (near the Statue of Liberty boat) on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays. The Petrel takes 35 fares at a tiine for excursions around the bay. Her skipper is Nick van Nes, a 30year old Yonkers man, who heads a fourman crew and had the Petrel in the same trade last summer at Cape Cod, Mass. She was built in 1938 to a Sparkman and Stevens design. You sit on cabin tops and skylights and should wear warm clothing and softsole shoes. The fare is $8, and the Petrel starts her regular schedule next Wednesday (March 26). She leaves the Battery on Wednesdays at noon and 3 P.M.; Saturdays and Sundays at 9 A.M., noon and 3 P.M. The boat's phone number is 8251964; if she's not in, call 8764900 for information.

title: Coliseum Show Offers Finished Crafts Now
description: There's almost too much happening here, said Michael Heller, a glass collector. I could walk down that aisle on people's shoulders.

title: Yellow Baby Is Its NameIt's a Yellow Watermelon
description: Derek Fell, who remembers how they laughed at red lettuce, predicts a much more decorous reception this year for the nation's first yellow watermelon.

title: Joe Medwick Dies
description: Joe (Ducky) Medwick, the Hall of Fame outfielder who starred with the St. Louis Cardinals, died yesterday at the age of 63. Obituary on Page 34.

title: Clurman Urges Reshaped Arts Council
description: A new administration for the New York State Council on the Arts was urged yesterday by Richard Clurman, chairman of Governor Carey's Task Force on Arts and Cultural Life in New York State.

title: Contract Award
description: The OwensCorning Fiberglas Corporation announced yesterday it had been awarded a $25million contract to supply largediameter Fiberglasreinforced plastic pipe to the Khuzestan Water and Power Authority of Iran for dual18mile underground water pipelines. The lines, each 65 inches in diameter, will transport water as part of a pipecanal system for the Karun River to Bandard Shahpour, a coastal city on the Persian Gulf. The pipe, to be made the OwensCorning plant in Conroe, Tex., will be delivered in mid1975 through early 1976.

title: Cyprus: The Turks Stall
description: The special representative of United Nations Secretary General Kurt Waldheim has returned to Cyprus to try to break the impasse that has prevented resumption of negotiations between the island's Greek and Turkish communities. This trip should not have been necessary. A resolution adopted unanimously by the Security Council March 12 called on the two sides to resume their intercommunal talks under Dr. Waldheim's personal auspices.

title: BENJAMIN BECKHART, BANKING ECONOMIST
description: Dr. Benjamin Haggott Beckhart, an economist and professor emeritus of banking at the Graduate School of Business at Columbia University, died yesterday in a hospital in Poughkeepsie. He was 77 years Did and lived on the Vassar College campus with his wife, the former Margaret Good Myers, professor emeritus of banking at Vassar.

title: Thousands Cheer as Ma Bell Puts Her Rings Back On
description: The sweet sounds of jangling telephones were heard once again yesterday evening in the 300block area in Manhattan that has been without telephone service for more than three weeks, as the New York Telephone Company met its 11:59 P.M. deadline for full restoration of service to the area.

title: Bridge:
description: HONOLULU, March 21The Vanderbilt Knockout Team Championship continued here this afternoon at the American Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals, with eight teams battling for semifinal places. The toughest struggle is likely to be between the fifthseeded quartet headed by Ira Rubin of Paramus, N. J., winners of the Reisinger Teams in December, and a powerful squad headed by Malcolm Brachman of Dallas.

title: CITIZEN UNIT SCORES TOCKS ISLAND STUDY
description: TRENTON, March 21 (AP)A citizens' advisory commission today criticized the first two parts of a $1.5million study on the proposed $400million Tocks Island darn and recreation area.

title: U.S. Officials Say They Lack Data on War
description: WASHINGTON, March 21High Administration officials say they have inadequate information about what is happening in Indochina and little control over events in Saigon.

title: 2d Death in 24 Hours in Dutchess Jail
description: A 19yearold youth was found strangled in his cell yesterday at the Dutchess County jail in Poughkeepsie, the second such death by hanging at the jail in 24 hours. As guard found the body of Gary A. Davis, who authorities said had used a towel to hang himself. He had been arrested Wednesday on a burglary charge. On Thursday, Russell Fleck, 22, serving time for burglary and grand larceny, hanged himself with a necktie, according to authorities. The medical examiner's office listed both as apparent suicides.

title: SeaMine Rivals Did Not Suspect Sub
description: The Central Intelligence Agency's covera Howard Hughes deepsea mining operationfor its mammoth effort to raise a Russian submarine From the Pacific seabed three miles below the surface was melt a realistic one that even rival seamining companies did not seriously question the operation.

title: Donovan Resigns
description: Walter Kennedy, Commissioner of the National Basketball Association, announced yesterday that he would hold a hearing here April 3 on a charge that the New York Knicks tampered with Eddie Donovan, the Buffalo Braves' general manager. Paul Snyder, owner of the Braves, has accused the Knicks of trying to rehire Donovan as their general manager while he was still under contract to Buffalo.

title: South African Free in Mercy Killing of Father
description: CAPE TOWN, March 21 (Reuters)A South African physician found guilty of murder in the death of his fatally ill father, was sentenced today to one year's imprisonment.

title: Emily B. Kaufman, Teacher, Wed
description: Emily Barbara Kaufman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Kaufman of Rockville Centre, L. was married yesterday afternoon to Antoine Willem van Agtmael, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. M G. van Agtmael  Verhulst of Bloemendaal, the Netherlands. The Jewish ceremony took Place at the New York apartment of the bride's grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Max Arthur Borden of Palm Beach, Fla., and Lenox, Mass.

title: FORD AND CHRYSLER RECALL 221,603 CARS
description: DETROIT, March 21Two automobile companies, the Ford Motor Company and the Chrysler Corporation, announced today recalls of 221,603 of their cars and trucks because of possible safety hazards.

title: BIRTHPILL MAKER REBUTS TESTIMONY
description: NEWARK, March 21A woman who is seeking $4.5million in damages from two manufacturers of oral contraceptives could have suffered brain damage from congenital or other causes not related to her having taken the pills, a lawyer for one of the companies contended today.

title: McCord Surrenders at Prison To Begin Watergate Sentence
description: ALLENWOOD, Pa., March 21 (AP)James W. McCord Jr., one of the original seven defendants in the Watergate breakin, surrendered at a minimum security Federal penitentiary here today to begin serving a onetofiveyear term.

title: LEFFERDINK GROUPS CHARGED IN FRAUD
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)  A Federal grand jury charged today that five mutual funds and a bank chartered abroad by Allen Lefferdink, an American, were designed solely to fleece the unwary and enrich Mr. Lefferdink and his associates.

title: Rock Island Close Put Off to April 12
