description: Contracts between nine newspaper unions and the city's three major daily newspapers have termination dates at midnight tomorrow, but negotiations have been suspended until next week.

title: Theater: Guardsman
One Tax Benefit Could Prove Costly
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Unless they are careful, millions of American taxpayers may find that they owe the Government money in 1976 because of benefits in the 1975 taxcut bill.

title: Ford Plans a Speech On U.S. Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON March 28 (Reuters)  President Ford is tasking Congress to arrange a joint session so he can deliver a major foreign policy speech on April 9 or 10, the White House announced today.

title: John W. Leahy, Promoter of Danbury Fair, Dies at 79
description: DANBURY, Conn., March 28 (AP)  John W. Leahy, who owned the Danbury Fair's grounds and helped make the fair a national institution, died today at the age of 79.

title: VEBAGelsenberg Looks For Expansion in Europe
description: DUSSELDORF, West GermanyWest Germany's new energy giant, VEBAGelsenberg, though not even three months old, is looking for ways to expand its operations in Europe at a time when most multinational oil companies are considering retrenching in the European market.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: ExOlympians Say F.B.I. Asked Them About Hearst Case
description: LOS ANGELES, March 28 (Reuters)  Two Olympic gold medalistsOlga Connally and her former husband, Haroldsaid today that they had been questioned by the Federal Bureau of Investigation in connection with the hunt for Patricia Hearst, the fugitive newspaper heiress.

title: ARMS LEFT BY U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 28The South Vietnamese have lost more than $1billion in American military weapons and other equipment over the last two weeks, according to qualified Vietnamese sources.

title: 2d Title To Naber In Swim
description: CLEVELAND, March 28 Tim McDonnell of the University of California, Los Angeles, and an Indiana relay team broke American records this afternoon and tonight and John Hencken of Stanford broke a collegiate record in the 52d annual National Collegiate swimming championships.

title: FIRE UNION WINS CASE AGAINST CITY
description: A hearing officer of the State Public Employment Relations Board ruled yesterday that the city was guilty of an improper labor practice because it had refused to put into effect the terms of an agreement negotiated last July with the Uniformed Firefighters Association.

title: Market Place
description: When Harry Browne, an author and lecturer, came to Carnegie Hall last year to expound on economics and give his remedy for America's worst depression, which he said was then rapidly overtaking the nation, most of the seats for which tickets had been bought were in the balcony.

title: Dance: Posin Satire Has Premiere
description: Like many young modern dance choreographers who began composing dances in the late nineteensixties, Kathryn Posin has been increasingly attracted to plotless pieces that require and display a strong technical base.

title: Mrs. King 3Set Loser
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 28 Virginia Wade may be beginning to think they named the Virginia Slims circuit after her. The Briton scored an uphill victory ever Billie Jean King tonight at the Palestra and has only Chris Evert to beat in tomorrow's final to take her secand tournament in two weeks and her second $15,000 first prize. She would be the only player to win consecutive tournaments on the circuit.

title: SNIPER IN JERSEY SLAYS 2 OFFICERS
description: A sniper spraying gunfirel from the attic bedroom window of his home killed two policemen and wounded two others in Mount Holly, N.J., last night before the man was shot by the police and seized in the house, authoritles said.

title: Strikes in Greece Spread
description: ATHENS, March 28 (Reuters) Technicians of Olypmpic Airways began a 48hour strike today, grounding all domestic and foreign flights. It followed 48hour strikes that closed Greece's 1,000 grammar schools and crippled public transport in Athens yesterday. Athens journalists began a 24hour strike at midnight.

title: Hysteria Over Da Nang Flight Priority Caused Suspension of Refugee Airlift
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 29We were loading the refugees in an orderly fashion, said the airline official, when the Vietnam Air Force trucks arrived full of their families. Then people started shoving and pushing and failing and clawing and climbing and fighting. There were thousands of them. It was a mob scene and we pulled out.

title: FORD TO ANNOUNCE TAX PLAN TONIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 President Ford will announce in a speech tomorrow evening his decision on whether to veto or sign the $22.8billion taxcutting bill passed by Congress earlier this week, Ron Nessen, the White House press secretary, announced today.

title: Books of The Times
description: YOU CAN GET THERE FROM HERE. By Shirley MacLaine. 249 pages. W. W. Norton & Co., Inc. $7.95.

title: Radioactive Water Spill at Plant Alarms Residents in Connecticut
description: Residents and public officials in the town of Waterford, Conn., expressed concern yesterday on learning that 1,200 workers had been evacuated Thursday from the nearby Northeast Utilities nuclear power plant after radioactive water spilled from a waste concentrator.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)The Securities and Exchange Commission said today, the competitive bid requirement for underwriting public utility issues would reinstated Tuesday.

title: 17 RESIST WAIVERS IN TRANSIT INQUIRY
description: Five highranking Transit Authority police officers and two sergeants have declined to sign waivers of immunity in connection With a grand jury investigation into charges of corruption on the authority's force, in authority spokesman said yesterday.

title: Network Coverage
description: President Ford's address will be carried live on television tonight at 7:30 on Channels, 2, 4 and 7 and on radio by stations WCBSAM, WINS and WNYCAM.

title: First Part of Oil Pipeline Buried in Alaskan Plain
description: VALDEZ, Alaska, March 28 (UPI) The first stretch of the Alaska oil pipeline has been buried under the frozen flood plain of the Tonsina River.

title: Abe Moffat, 78, a Leader In British Communist Party
description: LONDON, March 28  Abe Moffatt, a leading member of the British Communist party for more than 50 years and former president of the Scottish section of the National Union of Mineworkers, died yesterday in Edinburgh. Scotland.

title: Coaches Reject Use of Ali's Camp
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., March 28 (AP)  The nation's amateur boxing coaches rejected today a proposal to use Muhammad Ali's Deer Lake Pa., camp as a training site for amateur boxers.

title: Washington Weighs Role In Evacuation of Da Nang
description: WASHINGTON, March 28The Ford Administration was trying today to decide how far the United States could and should go in evacuating civilian refugees and possibly troops from the surrounded South Vietnamese port city of Da Nang.

title: Isle Is Vital to Da Nang Refugees
description: RE ISLAND, South Vietnam, March 28With the collapse of Government authority in the city of Da Nang, this volcanic isle in the South China Sea has become the last place in the vicinity of central Vietnam where American helicopters and, small airplanes can land safely.

title: Public Windfall at City Hall
description: Several passersby on Broadway near Murray Streetjust across from City Hall  were startled shortly before noon yesterday when a score of $1 bills fluttered onto the sidewalk. One man said he thought a youth on a bicycle had simply flung the bills into the air. Another, stopping to pick up a bill, said the money might have come from a passing taxi. Oh well, I guess it was meant to be, he said, pocketing the bill and hurrying off.

title: Film: 'Homo Eroticus,' an Italian Farce
description: "Homo Eroticus," an Italian farce filmed in 1971 that arrived at the Eastside Cinema yesterday, is, like the Leaning Tower of Pisa, unusual but unlikely. The film's basic idea may be scientifically possible, but as a light-hearted attempt to detail the amours and trials of a young man endowed with extraordinary genitalia and drives, it doesn't kid sex so much as leer at it.As the title and English subtitles make plain, "Homo Eroticus" focuses largely on the dark and handsome Lando Buzzanca and his effect on the women and men of Bergamo. Let's just say that our contemporary Casanova is more than equal to his rare anatomical attributes. Up to a traumatic point, that is, which leads to a fairly happy ending.Mr. Bazzanca is athletic, if nothing else, as the peasant who has fled from his native Sicily and quickly adjusts to the romantic needs of Bergamo's society women and their maids. And he cannot be faulted for rushing from boudoir to boudoir and economic improvement, since the affluent women, including Rossana Podesta, Sylva Koscina and Adriana Asti, are revealingly photogenic even if they do not expose much character.In having him speed through a succession of affairs and double entendres. Marco Vicario, the producer-director, and his associates are not guilty of a crude, pornographic approach. Their "Homo Eroticus," which occasionally may be funny and a voyeur's dream, is essentially a small joke that doesn't really need all this amplification.

title: SYMPHONY POST TO ROSTROPOVICH
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP) Mstislav Rostropovich, the Rus sian cellist, will become music director and conductor of the, National Symphony Orchestra beginning with its 197778 season.

title: Mt. Laurel's Poor Flail Zoning Ruling
description: MOUNT LAUREL  Poor families in this sprawling residential township are hailing as beautiful, just and wonderful Monday's landmark ruling by the State Supreme Court requiring zoning for lowincome housing. But they have no illusions that the decision will be swiftly translated into action by the township council.

title: Waldheim Says Cambodia Effort Failed
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 28Secretary General Waldheim has advised the United States that Prince Norodom Sihanouk has turned down his offers to bring together the warring Cambodian sides and try to restore peace to the country.

title: FISH PRICEFIXING WEIGHED BY JURY
description: A Federal grand jury in Florida is investigating an alleged conspiracy between fish dealers in Florida and wholesalers at the Fulton Fish Market in New York to fix the price paid for fresh fish, a person close to the investigation said yesterday.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GREAT EGGSPECTATIONS Today is rolling day for all eggminded children 5 to 13 years old who care to trek to Central Park, their elders in tow, for the 29th annual Easter contest on the Great Lawn, in midpark between 80th and 84th Streets. The idea is to get there before 1:30 P.M. and register. Young contestants will then be supplied with wooden spoons and brightly colored wooden eggs to be rolled over a measured course, starting at 2 and continuing to about 5 o'clock. The event traditionally draws a small army of eagereyed youngsters competing for trophies and gift certificates. Officials of the Parks Administration and Gimbels East, the cosponsor, will present the awards in three age divisions: 5 to 7, 8 to 10, and 11 to 13 years. If rain wins out, the alternate date is next Saturday.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: FRANK J. ROONEY
description: MIAMI, March 28 (AP) Frank J. Rooney, chairman of Frank J. Rooney, Inc., a large contracting concern that built many wellknown Miami buildings, died Wednesday at the Miami Heart Institute. He was 70 years old.

title: Saigon Arrests a Judge And 4 Student Leaders
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 28 (AP)The Government today arrested a judge opposed to President Nguyen Van Thieu and also four leaders of student demonstrations against the lowering of the draft age from 18 to 17, Government officials refused to comment.

title: Pope Carries a Cross In Good Friday Rite
description: ROME, March 28Pope Paul VI, in a Good Friday enactment of the Passion and death of Jesus, carried a large cross in an outdoor rite near the Colosseum late tonight.

title: Louisville Wants More Than a Crum
description: The coach's name is Crum, as in what's left of the cake. When it comes to national recognition, that's about all the University of Louisville gets; when it comes to state recognition, too. Maybe if we win the N.C.A.A., says Denny Crum, they'll vote us No. 1 in the AP poll. Last week we beat Maryland to win the Midwest Regional and we dropped from No. 3 to No. 4. If there is any romantic justice in the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament, Louisville will take the cake. To do so, it today must surprise the University of California, Los Angeles, where Denny Crum learned how to roll up a program as John Wooden's assistant brain; then it must conquer either Kentucky or Syracuse in Monday night's championship game. But win or lose today, Louisville hopes Kentucky does the same in order to create a matchup Monday night either for the national title or, in the thirdplace game, for the state title.

title: Israel Tells of Sea Incident During Kissinger Mission
description: TEL AVIV, March 38 (AP)An Israeli Navy gunboat opened fire on an Egyptian fishing vessel, killing one of the crew, during Secretary of State Kissinger's peace mission last week, the military command said today.

title: HALFIAN LEE
description: Halfian Lee, a principal officer of Eastern Gas and Fuel Associates, a Bostonbased utility, for more than 30 years following its formation in 1929, died Thursday in Peterborough, N.H. He was 87 years old and lived in Greenfield, N.H.

title: KORVETTE TO GET SIX KLEIN STORES
description: The Korvette stores division of the Arlen Realty and Development Corporation announced yesterday that it had received approval from the Federal Trade Commission to acquire six store sites now operated by S. Klein Department Stores.

title: Mackell Family Rejoices At End of the Nightmare
description: With pizza, liquor, soft drinks and song, former Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell, his family and friends, rejoiced yesterday over the unanimous opinion by the Appellate Division that cleared him of his conviction on charges of official misconduct, conspiracy and hindering prosecution.

title: State Layoff Notices Issued to Only 274 Of Projected 1,084
description: ALBANY, March 28Two months after Governor Carey said 1,084 state employes would lose their jobs by the end of the fiscal year, dismissal notices have gone out to only 274, according to the state's Office of Employe Relations.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: Fukuoka, JapanKumiaki Shibata, 129 pounds, outpointed Ould Makhloufi, 129, Algeria, 15 rounds; Shibata retained World Boxing Council junior lightweight title.

title: Peruvian Pipeline Loan
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 28 (UPI)A $50million, sevenyear loan has been arranged for the Peruvian Government Petroleum Corporation to fund construction of the North Peruvian pipeline, the Wells Fargo Bank announced yesterday.

title: Iron Mike O'Daniel Dead; A General in Three Wars
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., March 28 (AP)Lieut. Gen. John W. (Iron Mike) O'Daniel, U.S.A., retired, commander of the Third Infantry Division, Seventh Army, in Europe in World War II, died yesterday at the age of 81.

title: REUBEN BROWER, EDUCATOR, CRITIC
description: Dr. Reuben A. Brower, author and Cabot Professor of English at Harvard University, died Thursday of a heart attack in Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston. He was 67 years old.

title: Good Things From All Over
description: Whenever Henry Kissinger fails to pass a miracle in Egypt and turns up on Page One looking as glum as a failed Moses, and there is another assassination in the headlines, and the Congress passes me a peanut and calls it a tax break, and somebody charges me $4.50 for a hamburger and dares me to have a nice day, I retreat to the bottom of the newspapers' inside pages to find out what is happening in the real world and feel better in time.

title: Nicklaus's 63129 Leads by 6 Shots
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., March 28When Jack Nicklaus left the 12th green today, 12 under par after 30 holes, the woman scorer apologized: I'm sorry, Mr. Nicklaus, I don't have any red numbers beyond 11. And so for the rest of the way, the traveling scoreboard that accompanies players around the course carried a blank space after Nicklaus's name.

title: Thais Stress Policy Flexibility To Cope With Indochina Shifts
description: BANGKOK. Thailand, March 28A Foreign Ministry spokesman said here today that Thailand wanted to withdraw from the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization because it served no useful purpose.

title: E.P.A. Calls for Comments On Safety of Pest Strips
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)The Environmental Protection Agency has asked for public and scientific comment on whether pest strips, which hang indoors to kill insects, are safe.

title: . . . a Time for Prudence
description: Once the stimulative effects of the tax bill begin to be felt, Congress will have to demonstrate that it has sufficient judgment and selfcontrol to keep the economy moving forward without a disruptive new zoom into inflation.

title: F.T.C. Halts Inquiry on Sales Abuses in Condominiums
description: WASHLNGTON, March 28The Federal Trade Commission chas secretly voted to break off an 18month national investigation of abuses in the sale and management of residential condominiums.

title: FRENCH ENVOY FREED IN EXCHANGE IN ADEN
description: PARIS, March 28 (UPI) Nationalist guerrillas released the kidnapped French Ambassador today, exchanging him, in Southern Yemen for two guerrillas who had been jailed in France and 19 gold bars worth $100,000, Government, officials said.

title: Defense Affidavit Accuses Authorities In Six Deaths at San Quentin in 1971
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 28 An affidavit filed with the California Supreme Court says that various law enforcement agencies had advance knowledge of and participated in an escape attempt at San Quentin prison on Aug. 21, 1971, in which George Jackson, the black revolutionary writer, and five other persons were killed.

title: 24 Babies Perish In Yugoslav Fire In Maternity Ward
description: RIJEKA, Yugoslavia, March 28 (AP)A fire killed 24 babies and critically injured four others in the maternity wing of a Rijeka hospital early today, officials said.

title: An Airlift Halted
description: In the meantime, the United States Embassy in Saigon, using its contingency funds, contracted with Air Vietnam to start flying refugees out of Da Nang. But the State Department said today that of ter the 1,800 were taken out the airlift was temporarily halted because of the large numbers of persons crowding the, Da Nang airport and runways.

title: National's NoFrills Flights At 35% Saving Approved
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board gave National Airlines the goahead yesterday for a no frills service that will slash many fares 35 per cent for passengers willing to forgo meals and liquor, fly on weekdays, and buy tickets a week in advance.

title: ACQUITTAL DENIED IN TEXAS KILLINGS
description: HOUSTON, March 28 (UPI) state judge denied today a defense motion for an instructed verdict of acquittal in the capital murder trial of Ignacio Cuevas.

title: U.S. Seeks to Join Alabama Prisoner In Jail Rights Suit
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 (AP)The Justice Department sought today to charge officials of all 232 county and municipal jails in Alabama with violating the constitutional rights of prisoners.

title: U.S. Beginning an Airlift Of Military Aid to Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 29The United States Embassy announced toIday that an airlift of urgently needed military and medical supplies had begun to Vietnam. The first plane loads reportedly began landing by noon today.

title: Soviet Closes Lon Nol Embassy, Tells Sihanouk of Recognition
description: MOSCOW, March 28The Soviet Union has ordered the Cambodian Government of President Lon Nol to close its embassy here and to withdraw the staff, the embassy said today.

title: DEFICIT IS FORECAST BY TODD SHIPYARDS
description: In a letter to shareholders, the Todd Shipyards Corporation said yesterday that it expected to sustain a loss of approximately $35million for its fiscal year ending March 31, 1975.

title: Antiques: Chinese Jade
description: The period Chinese jades seen most often today are the precious tits of jewelry, the fussy figurines and the elaborately carved vessels of the late 19th century.

title: Briton, 103, Dies From Fall
description: LONDON, March 28 (Reuters)  James Chapman, who was 103 years old and had in the last three years traveled in a submarine, a hot air balloon, a racing car and a light aircraft, died today after a fall at his home at Wisbech, 90 miles north of London.

title: F.D.A. DELAYS MOVE ON ANTIPERSPIRANTS
description: WASHINGTON. Mardi 28 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration has decided to take no immediate action on a plea from its own experts to prohibit the sale of three aerosol antiperspirants.

title: Telex Denied Review by Court Of Ruling Upsetting I.B.M. Case
description: DENVER, March 28 (UPI)The Telex Corporation was denied today its request for a full panel review of a lower court decision overturning a $259.9million damage award against the International Business Machines Corporation. Telex said it intended to appeal the decision to the Supreme Court.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Rutgers Still Uneasy as the State University
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the president of Rutgers University keeps a stone head of Socrates, near his desk. He offers hemlock to me every day at 4, said Dr. Bloustein.

title: The U.S. to Finance A Regional Survey Of L.I. Water Supply
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 28The NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board will direct a federally financed $5.5million program to study Long Island's underground drinking  water supply and surface waters, a spokesman for the Federal Environmental Protection Agency said today.

title: S.E.C. to Investigate 36 Bergman Homes
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has ordered a formal investigation of MedicHome Enterprises, Inc., a chain of 36 nursinghome properties founded by Bernard Bergman.

title: MELVIN COPELAND, HARVARD PROFESSOR
description: Melvin Thomas Copeland, professor emeritus of marketing at the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration, died Thursday at his home in Annisquam, Mass. He was 90 years old.

title: A Figure in Theft of Documents From Howard Hughes Gives Up
description: ST. LOUIS, March 28 (UPI)Donald Ray Woolbright, a key figure in the theft of documents believed to be related to the Central Intelligence Agency's efforts to salvage a sunken Soviet submarine, surrendered to the authorities today.

title: 2 Bombs Explode In Busy Jerusalem And 13 Are Injured
description: TEL AVIV, March 28Two time bombs exploded in busy intersections in Jerusalein today as the city was crowded with Christian pilgrims observing Good Friday and Jews celebrating the second day of Passover. Thirteen persons were injured, none seriously.

title: Exchanges Are Closed
description: Major securities and commodities exchanges in the United States, Canada and Europe were closed yesterday in observance of the Good Friday holiday.

title: Saudis See Planning in the Assassination
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, March 28A security investigation into the assassination of King Faisal of Saudi Arabia has uncovered, evidence that the killing was carefully planned and was not the unreasoned act of a lunatic, according to official sources.

title: Biaggi Is Sued on Venture In Group Legal Insurance
description: The Security Insurance Company of Hartford, asserting it was bilked of $100,000 by Representative Mario Biaggi and his law partner in a fruitless venture into the littleexplored field of prepaid legal insurance, filed suit in Federal Court here yesterday to retrieve the money land collect $250,000 in damages.

title: Many Welcome the Rebates in Tax Bill But Doubt Sum Would Aid Them Much
description: Interviews with Americans across the country indicate a widely held belief that taxpayers rebates of $100 to $200, a key provision of the $22.8billion antirecession tax cut bill now on President Ford's desk, are too small to be meaningful.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 3.0 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 200.8 from 197.8 last week.

title: Vasquez Wins at Aqueduct And Flies to Florida Derby
description: Jacinto Vasquez was in a great hurry to get away from the Aqueduct track yesterday, so he rode Brookmeade Farm's Resident Nurse to victory in the eighth race, the $22,775 Searching Stakes. Then, without changing from his racing silks, he was driven to Kennedy International Airport to board a plane for Florida. Today the Panamanian is slated to ride the undefeated Foolish Pleasure in the $157,400 Florida Derby at Gulfstream Park. The triumph of Resident Nurse came as a mild surprise to the 33,314 fans at Aqueduct for they had made Ogden Mills Phipps' Alpine Lass the evenmoney choice in the onemile test for 3yearold fillies. But Alpine Lass showed little, while Resident Nurse took the lead early, stayed in front the rest of the way, and won by 4 lengths over Somethingregal, a long shot, with Slip Screen next in the field of seven.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Nineyear old Debbie Bogardus, who died of leukemia before she could fulfill her wish to visit Disney World, was buried in a short and simple service. About 75 family members and friends attended the 15minute service in the First Presbyterian United Church in Medford for the young girl, who had been the focus of a community fund drive that raised $7,000 for her trip to Orlando, Fla.

title: SUSAN SAXE HELD ON $350,000 BAIL
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 28 (UPI)Susan Edith Saxe, a student radical who spent nearly five years on the Federal Bureau of Investigation's 10 most wanted list, was ordered held on $350,000 bail today for a hearing on bank robbery charges. She was the third antiwar terrorist arrested this month.

title: Robinson Scores Easter Bowl Upsets
description: David Robinson of Westfield, N. J., scored two surprise victories yesterday in the 18's division of the Easter Bowl junior tennis tournament at Tennis 59 here.

title: Retirement Exemption
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)President Ford issued an executive order today exempt ing Walter C. Sauer, first vice president and vice chairman of the ExportImport Bank of the United States, from mandatory retirement.

title: ARMS LEFT BY U.S
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 28The South Vietnamese have lost more than $1billion in American military weapons and other equipment over the last two weeks, according to qualified Vietnamese sources.

title: CITY NOW IN CHAOS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 29  North Vietnamese troops, closing in on the northern city of Da Nang, have now seized a provincial capital only 15 miles away, a Saigon Government spokesman said early today.

title: Environmental Groups Win Suit Over Development of Wetlands
description: WASHINGTON, March 28A Federal judge here ruled yesterday that developers of coastal wetlands and inland swamplands must obtain permits for their projects from the Army Corps of Engineers.

title: Yanks Win As Medich, Oliver Star
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 28 (AP)Bob Oliver's tworun homer and the continued strong pitching of Doc Medich tonight helped the New York Yankees defeat the Atlanta Braves, 41.

title: Syracuse Five Seeking N.C.A.A. Upset Today
description: SAN DIEGO, March 28More than 125 happy Syracuse University fans are enjoying themselves in the warm sunshine following their charter flight from snow country yesterday. They are in a world of their own, convinced that their fastmoving team is about to manage the biggest upset in the 37 years of the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championship tournament by winning the title.

title: Isle Is Vital to Da Nang Refugees
description: RE ISLAND, South Vietnam, March 28With the collapse of Government authority in the city of Da Nang, this volcanic isle in the South China. Sea has become the last place in the vicinity of central Vietnam where American helicopters and small airplanes can land safely.

title: Suffolk Judge Accused of Soliciting Sex Was Warned Before on Court Conduct
description: BELLE TERRE, L. L, March 28Judge William M. Higgins of Suffolk County Family Court, who was indicted yesterday on charges of soliciting sexual favors from a young woman in return for a favorable decision in a childsupport case, had been warned previously by State Judiciary Relations Committee about his blunt language and forceful conduct in court.

title: Antitrust Aspect Is Sought In Deals Tied to Arabs' Ban
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)  Attorney General Edward H. Levi has told members of Congress that the Justice Department is seeking to determine whether American companies have violated Federal antitrust and other laws in connection with an Arab business boycott.

title: Iran's Air Force Is on a Quiet Mission Here
description: The Imperial Iranian Air Force has landed and taken over a brick building downtown. Mission: purchasing. Logistics: confidential.

title: Young Audience Finds Opera Lesson Easy as (A)ida, (B)arber, (C)armen
description: PARAMUS, March 28A clown named Dokey drew shouts of delight today as he introduced scores of New Jersey kindergarten and elementary school children to the joys of opera, in a program being performed here at the PlayhouseontheMall through tomorrow.

title: Gains Are Forecast in Easter Sales
description: The Easter shopping season, which began about three weeks ago, is winding up in a strong flurry of consumer buying despite unseasonal weather in many parts of the East and Midwest. The season is two weeks shorter this year than usual. Easter Sunday fell on April 14 last year.

title: Knicks' Playoff Hopes Jolted by Loss to Jazz
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 28 The New York Knicks are not too happy over the visits they have made here.

title: People in Sports
description: Because of recent acts of vandalism on his home in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Larry Csonka may move several hundred miles north to escape the ire of Miami Dolphin fans who are presumably angry at the star fullback's decision to jump to the World Football League from the National Football League.

title: N.B.A. East WildCard Battle
description: REMAINING GAMES

title: Flames Win, 32 For 5th Straight
description: ATLANTA, March 28 (AP) Tom Lysiak's powerplay goal at 13 minutes 38 seconds of the final period tonight lifted the Atlanta Flames to a 32 victory over the Buffalo Sabres in a National Hockey League game.

title: Tax Bill Rebates Called Too Little to Help Much
description: Interviews with Americans across the country indicate a widely held belief that taxpayers rebates of $100 to $200, key provision of the $22.8billion antirecession tax cut bill now on President Ford's desk, are too small to be meaningful.

title: Where Are the Snows . . . ?
description: PARIS, March 28 (AP) Snow flurries swirled through Paris for about 30 minutes today, but the flakes melted quickly and the sun soon shone brightly.

title: China's Generation of the 800
description: PARISIn a moment of reminiscence, in 1960, Chairman Mao Tsetung remarked to Edgar Snow: There were 50,000 of us at the start of Chiang Kaishek's counterrevolution in 1927. After the killing there were only 10,000 left. Today, there are about 800 of us survivors of all the years between. By and large the country is being run and for some years will be run by those 800.

title: Animals Get Lots of Attention as Children's Zoo Reopens in Bronx
Books of The Times
description: The artist as activist, particularly the performing artist as political activist, is often greeted ambiguously by the public. People may scoffwhat right does an artist have to give us an opinion?at the same time they ask for an autograph. A political candidate may be short on charisma, but there is usually an ample supply in his celebrity entourage. These thoughts go through one's mind while reading Shirley MacLaine's new book, You Can Get There From Here. Some of the book deals directly with show businessthe absurd and amusing saga of how Miss MacLaine fell into the cesspool of television, and climbed outbut mostly this is an insider's view of American political campaigning and an intelligent tourist's view of China.

title: Art: French Views of Warfare in the Late 1800's
description: French military painting in the eighteenseventies and eighties will never rank high in the history of art. It was conformist in its social attitudes, tight and needly in its mode of expression, and preordained in its nostalgia for campaigns that might better have been forgotten.

title: HIGH COURT TO RULE ON TV TRUST SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)  Justice William O. Douglas today ordered a halt to civil antitrust proceedings in Los Angeles against the three major broadcasting networks pending a Supreme Court decision on whether the cases can go ahead at all.

title: Easing of Net Loss Seen By Chrysler for Quarter
description: DETROIT, March 28  The Chrysler Corporation expects to have a firstquarter loss that will be less than the record. $73million loss in the fourth quarter of 1974 according to Lynn A. Townsend, chairman of the company.

title: Mortgage Money Is Plentiful, But Home Sales Fail to Revive
description: LOS ANGELES, March 28Many of the nation's banks and savings institutions are suddenly trumpeting an unfamiliar message to potential middleincome home buyers: There's money for mortgages again.

title: Excerpts From Opinion in Mackell Case
description: Following are excerpts from the Appellate Division opinion reversing the convictions of and dismissing the indictments against Thomas J. Machell. James D. Robertson and Frank R. DePaola:

title: It's Glass, but It's Not Cheap
description: Steuben Glass is introducing its first piece of jewelry a twopart crystal pendant held in an 18karat gold frame and suspended from a gold necklace. This particular design with engraved laurel leaf motif will not be duplicated. However, the master craftsmen at the Corning Glass Center will be making other pendants. The engraving will be different, though.

title: Weinberger Names Six to Study Charges of F.D.A. Harassment
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Caspar W. Weinberger, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, appointed a sixmember panel today to investigate charges that the Food and Drug Administration harassed employes who tried to block approval of new drugs they felt were unsafe.

title: SNIPER IN JERSEY SLAYS 2 OFFICERS
description: A sniper spraying rifle fire from the windows of his home, killed two policemen and critically wounded a third officer last night in Mount Holly, N.J., before he was captured in the house.

title: Award of $15Million Camden Contract And $1.2Million Legal Fee Studied
description: TRENTON, March 28High state officials disclosed today that the State Attorney General was investigating a $15million sewerengineering contract in Camden County that resulted in a legal fee of $1.2million for former State Senator Ralph DeRose, New Jersey's member on the bistate Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor.

title: Prime Rate Is Pared To 7% by Citibank
description: The First National City Bank reduced yesterday its prime rate on corporate loans to 7 per cent from 7 per cent, effective Monday.

title: Award of $1 5Million Pact In Camden Under Inquiry
description: TRENTON, March 28High state officials disclosed today that the State Attorney General was investigating a $15million sewerengineering contract in Camden County that resulted in a legal fee of $12million for former State Senator Ralph DeRose, New Jersey's member on the bistate Waterfront Commission or New York Harbor.

title: Middle of World, Profound and Subtle Screen:
description: The Middle of the World (La Milieu du Monde) was shown last year at the 12th New York Film Festival. The following excerpt is from Nora Sayres review, which appeared in The New York Times last Oct. 7. The film is being shown at the 68th Street Playhouse, Third Avenue.

title: PENTAGON ASSAILED ON AID TO CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, March 28The Defense Department was criticized today b the General Accounting Office' for its recent discovery that it had an additional $21.5million available for military aid to Cambodia this year as a result of pricing Terrors in 1974.

title: JOHN H. BEGLEY
description: John H. Begley, a vice president of RKO General, Inc., died Wednesday evening, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 105 East 38th Street. He was 62 years old.

title: Radar System Advance Devised
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 A procedure invented by a Columbia University professor is aimed at more sensitive and accurate radar tracking and spacecraft communication. It automatically compensates for the Doppler shift in signals received from rapidly moving objects. Patent 3,875,399 will be granted next week to Malvin C. Teich of the department of electrical engineering and computer science for what is called the multifrequency optimum heterodyne system.

title: Hathaway Scored by Environmentalists
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 Environmental and conservation groups charged today that President Ford's expected nomination of former Gov. Stanley K. Hathaway of Wyoming to be Secretary of Interior would place a man with a proindustry bias and a poor environmental record in charge of the nation's natural resources.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: CORRECTION
description: It was incorrectly reported in The New York Times last Saturday that the Sri Chinmoy Center had set up a table at the Earth Day celebration at Battery Park. Actually, the followers of Sri Chinmoy, a meditation leader, were working at the table of another organization.

title: News Summary and Index
description: North Vietnamese troops, closing in on the northern city of Da Nang, seized a city only 15 miles away, a Saigon Government spokesman said early today. He termed the situation in Da Nang, the last remaining Governmentheld area in the northern part of South Vietnam, very serious, and said both the city and its principal airport were shelled. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: 60 at Princeton Devour A 4Foot Easter Bunny
description: PRINCETON, March 28 (UPI)A Princeton University student wanted to do something different for Easter, so he ordered a 4foothigh chocolate Easter bunny.

title: Reaction, Overreaction
description: A few critical remarks from Washington about a fateful Israeli government decision threaten to stir up a brushfire of extravagant interpretationsby Arab sympathizers as well as Israelisfar in excess of good sense. This is not a healthy situation.

title: Chains' Volume in February Up 5.6%
description: The nation's chain stores registered a gain of 5.6 per cent in their February sales over volume in the corresponding month a year earlier, according to data gathered by Chain Store Age magazine. The gain, one of the poorest in the last 34 months, compares with gains of 5.8 per cent in January and 5.5 per cent in November.

title: JAMES E. MARKHAM JR.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 28 (AP)James E. Markham Jr., assistant chief counsel of the Internal Revenue Service in Washington, died Thursday at a hospital here. He was 51 years old.

title: Special Radio Station Keeps Handicapped in Touch
description: The idea began in Minnesota but, like many good ideas, it was picked up around the country and it wasn't long before it found fertile ground in New York with the help of James R. Jones.

title: Salonika Basks in the Warmth of Detente
description: SALONIKA, Greece  For centuries the Slavic peoples of southeastern Europe have yearned for an outlet onto the warm waters of the Aegean Sea, preferably at Salonika, an important port since it became the in capital of Macedonia 2,300 years ago.

title: Big Quake Strikes Rocky Mountains With Little Damage
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 28 (AP)The strongest earthquake in the United States in four years rumbled through a 400mile wide area of the Central Rocky Mountains last night. But no serious injuries and only minor property damage were reported.

title: Bridge
description: A bunch of bridge experts who like to count autochickens before they are hatched have a rare arithmetical problem to ponder this morning: How should five Lancia cars be fairly divided between six bridge players?

title: In Memoriam
description: DELOTTJennie. Beloved mother of daughter Masha. You were my friend and teacher of life. I miss you.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
11AN GETS 10 YEARS FOR STOCK SWINDLE
description: Judge Constance Baker Motley sentenced a stock swindler in Federal District Court here yesterday to 10 years in prison primarily as a warning to others that this kind of activity will not be tolerated.

title: Rutgers Still Uneasy as the State University
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the president of Rutgers University, keeps a stone head of Socrates, near his desk. He offers hemlock to me every day at 4, said Dr. Bloustein.

title: A Bill to Sign. . .
description: As an exercise in psychological warfare to restrain future excesses in Congressional spending, there may be some point to White House hints that President Ford might veto the tax bill. But if the comments from the Oval Office signify a genuine intention to kill this antirecession measure, the President will be committing an act of reckless irresponsibility.

title: ANGOLANS AGREE TO HALT FIGHTING
description: LISBON, March 28 (Reuters)  Angola's rival liberation movements agreed today to end the recent fighting between them that killed more than 60 people and wounded 200.

title: Rise in Drinking Age Killed
description: CONCORD, N. H., March 28 (AP) The New Hampshire House killed a bill yesterday that would have restored the state's minimum legal drinking age to 21 from 18.

title: Jan P. Schinhan, Composer, Taught at North Carolina U.
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., March 28 (AP)Jan Philip Schinhan, composer and professor emeritus of music at the University of North Carolina, died Wednesday at the age of 87.

title: Dillon Helps Toros Defeat Oilers, 54
description: TORONTO, March 28 (UPI)  Wayne Dillon scored a pair of powerplay goals and set up Frank Mahovlich's 35th goal and Tom Simpson's 5Ist to lead the Toronto Toros to a 54 victory over the Edmonton Oilers in World Hockey Association play tonight.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: Philemon, one of the new musicals from Tom Jones and Harvey Schmidt that was prerented last winter at their 99seat Portfolio Studio, 341 West 47th Street, for weekend performances only, will return April 8. This time the show will have a limited run of six weeks on a schedule of eight performances each week.

title: Lisbon's Socialist Leader Says Communists Oppose Democracy
description: PARIS, March 28The Portuguese Socialist leader, Mrio Soares, in an interview published by the French Socialist party publication, has bitterly attacked the Portuguese Communists for declaring bourgeois democracy to be outdated in Portugal.

title: The Screen
description: FILMS BY ROBERT BREER: FORM PHASES 1, 2 minutes; FORM PHASES II, 3 minutes; UN MIRACLE, 30 seconds; RECREATION, 2 minutes; CATS, 2 minutes; A MAN AND HIS DOG OUT FOR AIR, 3 minutes; HOMAGE TO JEAN TINGUELY'S HOMAGE TO N.Y., 10 minutes; BLAZES. 3 minutes; HORSE OVER TEA KETTLE, 6 minutes; PAT'S BIRTHDAY, 13 minutes; FIST FIGHT. 11 minutes; PBL NO 2, 1 minute; 69, S minutes; 70, 5 minutes; GULLS AND BUOYS, 6 minutes; FUJI, 8 minutes. March 2730 and April 36, 8 PM. At the Film Forum, 256 West 88th Street. If the spirits of Piet Mondrian and Saul Steinberg took possession of the imagination of Walt Disney and set up shop on Sesame Street, the result would likely be the films of Robert Breer.

title: U.S. Military Men Expressing Concern About South Vietnam's Air Strength
description: The precarious position of South Vietnam's air force has raised doubts among United Stctes military men of that force's effectiveness in supporting ground troops in the expected battle for Saigon. That battle appears appreciably nearer as a result of North Vietnamese succosses northwest and north of Saigon. Communist forces are renorted moving out of the southern hills of the Central highlands toward the low country around the capital.

title: Rockets Defeat Cays And Gain Tie for 2d
description: HOUSTON, March 28 (AP) The Houston Rockets pulled into a tie for second place with Cleveland in the National Basketball Association's Central Division tonight with a 112105 victory over the Cavaliers in their downtothewire fight to gain the playoffs.

title: De Forest Amuses With His Fantasy Art
description: There are artists who would rather die, or at least forfeit five minutes of their fame, than attempt to characterize their work in words, but Roy De Forest is happily not among them. He is delightfully frank, amusing and garrulous in speaking of the artistthat is, himselfas an eccentric individual creating fantasy art with the amazing intention of totally building a miniature cosmos into which the artful alchemist could retire with all his friends, animals and paraphernalia.

title: U.S. CHALLENGING BISHOP AS CITIZEN
description: An assistant United States Attorney in Detroit said yesterday that the Government would file suit to revoke the citizenship of the Rumanian Orthodox Bishop of America. Valerian D. Trifa, following allegations that he played a role in atrocities in Fascist Rumania more than 30 years ago and misrepresented his record to the immigration authorities.

title: Saudis See Planning in the Assassination
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, March 28A security investigation into the assassination of King Faisal of Saudi Arabia has uncovered evidence that the killing was carefully planned and was not the unreasoned act of a lunatic, according to official sources.

title: 21 Arrested in Gambling Raid
description: The police and immigration agents arrested 21 men on gambling charges, including six believed to be illegal aliens, in a raid at the Kimlau Post 1291 of the American Legion in Chinatown. A police spokesman said that because of an elaborate alarm and electronic surveillance system at the post, at 193Canal Street, it had taken about 10 minutes to break down the front door. He said that $4,181 had been seized by the police, along with a bulletproof vest and two loaded handguns. It could not be determined whether any of those arrested were members of the post, he added.

title: Mortgage Money Is Plentiful, But Home Sales Fail to Revive
description: LOS ANGELES, March 28Many of the nation's banks and savings institutions are suddenly trumpeting an unfamiliar message to potential. middleincome home buyers: There's money for mortgages again.

title: 3 Drivers Arrive For World Trot
description: BRISBANE, Australia, March 28 (UPI)  Three North American harness drivers arrived here today to lead a contingent coming to Australia for the 1975 world trotting championship. The three are Joe Marsh and Joe O'Brien of the United States and Shelly Goudreau of Canada.

title: Col. Wendell W. Fertig, Led Mindanao Guerrillas in '41
description: LAKEWOOD, Colo., March 28 (UPI)Col. Wendell W. Fertig, who commanded guerrilla forces that held the island of Mindanao in the Philippines in World War H, died Monday in Lutheran Hospital: He was 74 years old.

title: Spring Trash Collection in Illinois Town: Testimonial to Modern LifeStyle
description: HINSDALE, Ill., March 28 A stranger traveling the streets of this comfortable old Chicago suburb this week might think he had arrived in the wake of a violent storm.

title: Led Vietnam Vanguard
description: Iron Mike O'Daniel was a twofisted infantry commander who raised his personal Stars and Stripes over the ruins of, Nuremberg on Hitler's 56th birthday and, as his final assignment, led the vanguard of this country's direct involvement in Indochina 20 years ago.

title: 6 MEN CONVICTED IN FTLEE BRIBERY
description: NEWARK, March 28The six men and two corporations on trial here for bribery in Fort Lee were found guilty tonight by a jury in Federal Court here. The verdict was returned after the jury had deliberated for six hours and 40 minutes.

title: FORD TO ANNOUNCE TAX PLAN TONIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 President Ford will announce in a speech tomorrow evening his decision on whether to veto or sign the $22.8billion taxcutting bill passed by Congress earlier this week, Ron Nessen, the White House press secretary, announced today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, MARCH 29, 1975

title: Cancer Porkbarrel
description: The conquest of cancer program that Congress passed with much hullaballoo but little thought and less knowledge back in 1971 is coming under attack from such outstanding figures as Nobel Prize laureate biologist Dr. James Watson and Dr. Charles C. Edwards, who recently resigned as Assistant Secretary for Health in the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: CITY NOW IN CHAOS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, March 29  North Vietnamese troops, closing in on the northern city of Da Nang, have now seized a provincial capital only 15 miles away, a Saigon Government spokesman said early today.

title: Nets Bow To Sounds By 111106
description: MEMPHIS, March 28 (AP)Mel Daniels came off the bench with two minutes left in the third quarter tonight to spark Memphis to a 111106 victory over the New York Nets in an American Basketball Association game.

title: FRANK D. ANDRUSS
description: Frank D. Andruss, a vice president of the Alco Standard Corporation, a conglomerate, died yesterday at his home in Philadelphia. He was 58 years old.

title: CITY TROUPE SHIFTS CAST OF IDOMENEO
description: The cast of Mozart's Idomeneo had a large infusion of fresh blood in Thursday night's, performance by the New York'l City Opera, but it did not vitalize the production beyond what it had been. The new singers were Barbara Hocher as Ilia, George Livings as Idamante and Patricia Wells as Elektra, Joseph Blanton, who had been scheduled to take over the title role, had to bow out, and he was replaced by Richard Taylor, the production's first Idomeneo.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Westmoreland Urges Aid to Vietnam
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., March 28Gen. William C. Westmoreland, the former commander of United States forces in South Vietnam, said today that the American people had incurred a moral obligation to see the Indochina war through to the end, though he called United States involvement the inevitable result of an overextended policy of containment.

title: On Kreativ Righting
description: PATERSON, N. J.The mere fact that the younger American literary generation has come to the schools, instead of running away from them, Prof. Wallace Stegner, of Stanford, assures us about Creative Writing Workshops, is an indication of a soberer and less coltish spirit.

title: Newcombe Is Toppled; Misses Wade, Evert Win
description: JACKSON, Miss., March 28 (AP)Earl (Butch) Buchholz, 35yearold former top pro, unveiled a powerful service and ground strokes to upset John Newcombe, 76, 61, in the semifinals of the Tennis South invitation indoor tournament today.

title: KATHLEEN E. ALLEN
description: Kathleen E. Allen, a professional socialwork counselor at Cancer Care, Inc., and a pioneer in medical social work, died of cancer Thursday at New York Hospital. She was 86 years old and lived at 31 East 12th Street.

title: Builders Are Shaken by Failure of a Bank
description: MELVILLE, L.I.Patty Smith turned off the ignition on his new Cadillac, but the motor kept sputtering.

title: Snakes Do It. So Must Man.
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass.Snakes can grow only by bursting their skin. Molting has to be a painful process, and should it fail the snake would die. Mankind also grows by now and then bursting its outgrown skin of antiquated ideas, thinking and institutions.

title: French Inflation Eases
description: PARIS, March 28 (AP)The inflation rate in France continued to drop during February, the Finance Ministry said today, with retail prices rising 0.8 per cent compared to 1.1 per cent in January. A slowdown in the advance of prices for manufactured goods aided in stemming the price rise, the ministry said.

title: Cambodian Airlift Is Off But Resumption Today Set
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Saturday, March 29American officials ordered the airlift of rice, fuel and ammunition suspended again yesterday, but a United States Embassy spokesman said that it would resume today.

title: Islanders, Rangers: No Love Lost
description: Animosity  not simple, professional competitiveness describes the feelings held by the New York Islanders for the New York Rangers.

title: COURT OVERTURNS 1914 CONVICTIONS OF MACKELL AND 2
description: A state appeals court yesterday unanimously reversed the conspiracy convictions of Thomas J. Mackell, the former Queens District Attorney, and two chief aides, and dismissed their indictments on the ground of insufficient evidence.

title: EMANUEL J. FREIBERG
description: Emanuel J. Freiberg, who retired recently as special counsel to the Pennzoil Company, died Thursday at Doctors Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived here.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Suffering Seems Endless in Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 28The hospitals are running out of plasma, the electricity comes on for only about four hours every to days, the telephones rarely work any more and the Pepsi Cola plant says it will soon be out of syrup.

title: His Kurds, and Why
description: BAGHDAD, IraqThe rise of thirsting young Saddam Hussein to dominant political power in this tightlyrun, securityconscious Arab state has virtually coincided with the climax in Baghdad's long struggle to stamp out a Kurdish insurrection led by the redoubtable tribal leader, Mulla Mustapha Barzani.

title: Pope Names Philadelphia As Site of 1976 Congress
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 28 (AP)  Philadelphia was designated Thursday by Pope Paul VI as the site of the Roman Catholic Church's 41st International Eucharistic Congress next year.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ACAPULCO, Mexico, March 28 (AP)Armando Muniz realizes the greatest opportunity of my life tomorrow night when he fights for the welterweight title against Jose Napoles, the 35yearold Cubanborn Mexican citizen. Napoles is favored to make the collegeeducated beer salesman from Los Angeles his 13th victim in 14 title fights. Napoles lost to Billy Backus in his fourth title defense in 1970, but regained the crown six months later.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: I retreat to the bottom of the inside pages.
description: although not necessarily, has just occurred in Palo Alto, Calif., where Mrs. Fiorine Marguerite O'Shea, 81, had written a will granting $5 to each person who attended her funeral, with a bonus of $45 more to anyone who cried.

title: Date Is to Be Set Monday On AutoEmission Rules
description: The State Department of Environmental Protection is scheduled to drop the other shoe Monday in a decision on automobileemission standards that could preserve the status quo or result. in longerthanever waiting lines at motorvehicleinspection stations.

title: Meaning of Passover
description: During a special prePassover seder at the Stephen Wise Free Sy??agogue last Sunday, 65 Pro??estant children from Riverside Church joined 200 Sunday School students from the synagogue in the symbolic act of dipping parsley sprigs in salt water. Through the act they were recalling a central element in the Passover story, remembrance of the bitterness of life suffered under Egyptian bondage.

title: Best Sellers
No Road Back to Natural Materials
description: With the advent of the energy crisis, a new chorus of Cassandras has emerged who would have us believe that the nation is teetering on the edge of disaster.

title: Billions for Protection
description: In Alaska, where construction recently started on the controversial billion  dollar crossstate oil pipeline, private security guards are to be on hand to protect property and lifefor a price that exceeds $15million in the case of one company alone.

title: Ballet Master Wins Cup Chase
description: CAMDEN, S. C., March 29 (AP)  Ballet Master, a longshot gelding owned by Mrs. John H. O'Keefe, beat eight rivals today to win the 27th annual Carolina Cup, a steeplechase that offers more prestige than money.

title: Xaverian Wins Relay Carnival
description: Xaverian won a close team battle yesterday in the raindrenched 24th annual Fordham Prep relay carnival on Mount St. Michael's track in the Bronx.

title: Group to Save Fare Contends State Aid Must Be Increased
description: A new citizens committee to save transit and commuter fares contended yesterday that fare levels could not be held through this year unless the Legislature made a major increase in the aid package now being discussed.

title: Boat Makers Elect Parker
description: David R. Parker, Jr., president of AMF Hatteras Yachts, has been elected for a oneyear term as head of the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers. Parker succeeds Charles F. DeWait, the former president of the Pacemaker Corporation.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Thus, Ruth Currier was exposed to the choreographic techniques of both Humphrey and Limn. She was in the enviable position of having absorbed the style and working methods of two of the moderndance world's leading exponents.

title: Another Louisiana Bayou Is Caught in Middle of Government's Battle With Mississippi River
description: BAYOU BENOIT, La., March 27Paul Daigle's Cajun accent thickened as his anger rose.

title: Faisal: He Changed the Balance of Power
description: In the spring of 1973, King Faisal of Saudi Arabia summoned Frank Jungers, chairman of the Arabian American Oil Company (Aramco) to the palace in Riyadh.

title: The Jos Limn Company Is Back On Its Feet
description: When Jos Limn, the Mexicanborn choreographer. died in December, 1972, he left behind one of the oldest and most important moderndance companies in the country. Admirers of Limn and his troupe wondered what would become of the 30yearold company without its founder.

title: Dave Anderson
description: For too long in sports, game officials have been virtually immune from public scrutiny within their major league. Referees or umpires have hidden their mistakes, and often their relative incompetence, behind that immunity. Players and coaches have hesitated to criticize game officials publicly because of the threat of automatic finesthe gag rule. But now, with a $300 fine due Tuesday in the National Basketball Association office, Kareem AbdulJabbar of the Milwaukee Bucks threatens to take that immunity for N.B.A. officials to court with an American Civil Liberties Union attorney defending his freedom of speech. It's about time. Sports shouldn't be above acknowledging that its game officials aren't infallible. The gag rule has protected the worst officials. Without it, the best officials would be more apparent and more appreciated. The worst officials would disappear quicker, instead of being able to hide in the immunity that has protected them from justified criticism.

title: CONGRESS SNARLS AIDBANK FINANCE
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Congress has further complicated the already difficult United States relations with the major international lending institutions by imposing for the first time earmarking provisions on how the United States contribution to one of these banks can be used.

title: Trade Paperbacks
description: Trade paperbacks are sold, for the moat part in bookstores. This analysts is band on reports from ch??ns with more than 850 stores across the United States.

title: The Primitive Charm of Chinese Peasant Art
description: PEKING New socialist art is visible everywhere in China  on billboards, in magazines, on posters and even on postage stamps. But none impressed me as much as the peasants' art of Huhsien County in Shensi Province, in northwest China. These paintings, also seen in reproductions throughout the country, shine with a vivid charm that Westerners would probably call primitive in the complimentary sense. They portray visions of an exemplary China: people working collectively, sharing struggles and fulfilling promises of the fiture.

title: Air Fare Mystery
description: Two decisions by the Civil Aeronautics Board on successive days must further mystify the air traveler who looks for rationality and consistency in this field.

title: Religion, With Credentials, in the Board Room
description: The surprise nomination of Sister Jane Schully as a director of the Gulf Oil Corporation bolsters a trendalbeit minorof putting religious figures in corporate board rooms.

title: Danger: Signs ahead
description: When the policeman in the patrol car heading south toward Washington on the BaltimoreWashington Parkway saw the dark green Mercury with Minnesota plates JB 888 swing across the grass median and roar north, he spun in pursuit and pulled the car over. The driver stuck his head out the window while the cop was still approaching on foot.

title: This Week in Sports
description: This popular California sport is coming to the East Coast for the first time. Starting on Saturday, the American Bicycle Association will present weekend programs through October on the Flying Wheels Track at Hofstra University, Hempstead, L.I. Races will be held from 9 A.M. until dark every Saturday and Sunday. The cost for participants (boys and girls, ages 7 through 16) is $2.75 per rider with bikes and equipment supplied. The program is supervised by Oliver Martin, the U.S. Olympic cycling coach.

title: Lobster Fishermen Aided
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)The Commerce Department has announced that it has approved a $250,000 grant to help lobster fishermen in Newport, R. I., replace gear lost in a January incident involving Soviet trawlers.

title: A. Alvarez describes a triangle
description: The eternal triangle is at its most bleakly geometric in this novel of sex and selfcontempt at an ancient and famous British university. In one corner is Sam, a graduate student on the verge of abandoning the academy with a bitter Goodbye to All That. Opposed to him are his mentor Charles Stone, an eminent literary scholar, and Julie, Stone's cool and wayward German wife. The young man is hungryand sardonic, the older worried about keeping his power and prestige intact; Julie, a thirtyish mother uncertain of what comes next in her life, vacillates between the rival claimants to her devotion. A prize for others, she wonders what she can be for herself.

title: Doctors Here Decry Lack Of Center for Burn Cases
description: A year and a half ago in Brooklyn, 4year  old Joshua Miele was rushed to Methodist Hospital with acid bums covering 25 per cent of his body. A deranged neighbor bad thrown sulphuric acid in the boy's face.

title: Phone Tap Is Linked to Chicago Police
description: CHICAGO, March 29Investigators for Cook County States Attorney Bernard Carey have disclosed that they have been informed that the Chicago police illegally tapped telephones in Mr. Carey's office and home.

title: Reversal of Mackell's Conviction Called Biggest Blow to Nadjari
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, who is responsible for prosecuting city law enforcement officials in corruption cases, has received his severest setback as a result of the reversal of the conviction of Thomas J. Mackell, the former Queens District Attorney, according to judges, prosecutors and defense lawyers who have been interviewed since the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn handed down its decision Friday.

title: Brandt's Easter Message
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Willy Brandt, the former Chancellor of West Germany, flew into Washington the other day bright as an Easter lily, demanding to know why so many people were moaning about the future of the human race.

title: After Cuts and Firings and More Taxes, Then What?
description: Like the onehoss, shay, it's all falling apart at one time. That comment from a banker, emerging dispirited from a round of conferences on New York City's financial crisis, stretched beyond the confines of the five boroughs to the money pinch at every level of government.

title: Ford Admits Newsmen To His Hideaway Office
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)President Ford admitted reporters and photographers for the first time today to the small, crowded hideaway office where he does much of his work.

title: TV VIEW
description: They killed off Henry (McLean Stevenson) the other Tuesday night on M*A*S*H. It was the final episode of the series for the seasonreruns are upon us, like a hamper of used sweatsocksand next year Stevenson will have a variety program of his own, and so they just deepsixed him. Henry was to have returned from Korea to the United States, to his wife and children. His plane crashed. There were no survivors.

title: Danger: OPEC Might Not Invest Here
description: The concern' about the Arab financial invasion of the United States should not be over the possibility that it will take placebut that it will not. Because any takeover story, particularly one involving exotic figures from the Middle East, is a media natural, the movement of Arab money into American stocks and properties has been grossly exaggerated.

title: The Sentence
description: Dr. Henry Morgentaler is a Montreal physician who says he has performed more than 5,000 abortions at his own clinic. Under Canada's abortion law, abortions may be performed only at a licensed hospital, and then only when a committee of doctors has agreed that the pregnancy is likely to endanger life or health. Dr. Morgentaler was arrested for violating the law in 1973, and began a twoyear legal fight which eventually went to the Supreme Court of Canada. Now the Court has upheld his conviction, opting for a strict interpretation of the abortion statute. Though Dr. Morgentaler must now serve an 18month prison term, his supporters vow to intensify their struggle for further liberalized legislation. Dr. Morgentaler in jail, said his lawyers, is a lot more dangerous than Dr. Morgentaler free.

title: Woman in Episcopal Rite
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, March 29 (UPI)The Rev. Carter Heyward, one of 11 women who have been ordained in the Episcopal Church in a ceremony that the church says violates canon law, will again celebrate communion at Christ Church here tomorrow. The invitation was extended by the church's pastor, the Rev. L. Peter Beebe, who goes on trial May 14 for breaking church law when he allowed the woman to celebrate communion last December.

title: THE LAVON AFFAIR REVIVED IN ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, March 29 The incident occurred more than 20 years ago, but to this day it arouses Israelis like nothing else.

title: Youth Killed by Elevator
description: CHICAGO, March 29 (UPI)Julius Allen, 17 years old, was crushed and killed between an elevator and the wall of the shaft yesterday. The police said that the victim was apparently teaching his friends how to rob elevator occupants.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: to Switzerland in 1959 and, a year later, sold his Verve Records catalogue to MGM Records for $2,750,000, his only American venture has been a JATPtype tour in 1967 which led him to declare, Never again . . . it's no fun anymore, at least not in the States (he still puts on jazz tours regularly in Europe).

title: Greg Jones Takes Giant Slalom
description: OBERSDORF, West Germany, March 29 (AP)Greg Jones of Tahoe City, Calif., outraced a field of 176 skiers today to win the men's giant slalom in the Nebelhom Cup competition.

title: Correction
description: In the review of Mark Monsky's Looking Out for #1, Criminals at Large, March 16, Mr. Monsky was referred to as former news director of WNEWTV. He is in fact news director of WNEWTV.

title: Notes: Bus Bargains Going the Distance
description: A NEW ticket entitling holders to 15 days of unlimited bus travel in the United States and Canada for $87.50 is currently on sale across the country. One side effect is expected to be a quickening of the running battle for the unofficial title of world's greatest longdistance bus rider.

title: Violence in Athletics: An International Blight
description: Athletic violence must be stopped at all costs. Perhaps it must begin with the junior high school coach who says, On the first play of the game hit the man across from you as hard as possible and let him know who the boss is. This is elevated to the high school coach who tells His players to go out there and fight. The last time I heard this there was a riot, with a basketball player hospitalized for a month.

title: Transcript of President Ford's Address on Tax Bill
description: Following is a transcript of President Ford's broadcast address last night on the tax reduction bill as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Estimates on Illegal Aliens
description: LOS ANGELES, March 29 (AP)Illegal aliens may make more than $1billion a year in wages and pay $170million in taxes in Los Angeles County, a study prepared for county supervisors says.

title: PHILLIPS CHIEF KNEW OF POLITICAL FUND
description: BARTLESVILLE, Okla., March 29 (AP)The chief executive of the Phillips Petroleum Company has admitted that he knew of a cash fund used for illegal corporate political contributions by previous officers of the company, according to a proxy statement mailed to stockholders.

title: Molin in Final Of Easter Bowl
description: Ricardo Ycaza of Ecuador, the topseeded player, was beaten by Jon Molin of Yonkers, 76, 62, in the 18's semifinals of the Easter Bowl junior indoor tennis championships at Tennis 59 here last night.

title: LILCO Atom Plant Hearings Delayed
description: ALBANYHearings on the application of Long Island Lighting Company for a permit to build two nuclear generating plants in the North Fork community of Jamesport will be delayed a second time so that all parties interested in crossexamining LILCO witnesses can study technical material the company could not provide until last week.

title: Office Building Converting to Housing
description: The owner of a 16story office building on the west side of Union Square is planning to convert the 73yearold structure into an apartment house.

title: Athletes Find Spark in Transcendental Meditation
description: The world of athletics is a world of constant innovation. Athletes are under tremendous pressure to perform at their maximum capabilities in situations of splitsecond intensity, and for this reason they are quick to pick up new techniques that improve their performance.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Under the taxcut bill, rebates for 1974 and changes in the 1975 tax structure would provide benefits for the average family ranging between $300 and $500. The new negative tax feature weights the largest percentage of relief toward those near or below the poverty line. In actual dollars, 85 per cent of the cuts would go to those earning $20,000 or less.

title: VIETCONG REPORT RETURN OF CALM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 29Vietcong officials said here today that life was returning to normal in the newly liberated areas of South Vietnam, including the former imperial capital of Hue, which the Communists occupied almost a week ago.

title: Fjellman Resigns as Upsala President
description: EAST ORANGEThe resignation of Dr. Carl Fjellman as president of Upsala College, effective June 2, has been announced by John D. Horn, chairman of the college's Board of Trustees.

title: Arabs in West Europe: Unseen but Not Unsensed Economic Force
description: LONDON, March 29Along Harley Street the Arabs pay their daily visits to their private doctors. In the gambling casinos each night young Arab men try to beat the system at the blackjack and roulette tables.

title: Elizabeth Warne To Marry May 31
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Parsons Warne of Richmond, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Morgan Warne, to David Lawrence Nowak, son of Mrs. George Nowak, of North Haven, Conn., and the late Mr. Nowak. The wedding is planned for May 31 in Rye, N. Y.

title: Brooklyn Man Is Charged In Fatal Beating of Girl, 2
description: A 32yearold Brooklyn man was arrested yesterday and charged with murder in connection with the beating death of the 2yearold daughter of his commonlaw wife.

title: Capital Retaining Aura of Prosperity
description: WASHINGTON, March 24John A. Johnson, 23 years old, stood shivering in the biting March wind in front of the gray Government building at 500 C Street, N.W., and talked about how life was in a city long known as recessionproof.

title: GOLD MINE STUDY DISCLOSES PERIL
description: A study by a Federal health agency in one United States gold mine has disclosed an abnormally high rate of lung canter among miners who were exposed to asbestos  bearing are similar to that mined by the Reserve Mining Company in Silver Bay, Minn.

title: Step Nicely Takes Westchester Mile
description: Even though he almost tripped approaching the finish, Step Nicely of the Hobeau Farm succeeded in taking the $56,500 Westchester Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: U. S. Vessels Are Named
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (UPI)A Pentagon spokesman said tonight that the four ships dispatched by President Ford to South Vietnamese waters were all big amphibious transportsthe deepdraft, tanklanding Frederick, the cargo ship Durham, Blue Ridge.
