description: SAILING TOMORROW TransAtlantic

title: 2 Biologists Honored
description: WALTHAM, Mass., March 29 (AP)Brandeis University has announced the award of its fourth annual Lewis S. Rosenstein Award to two American molecular biologists for their research into enzyme regulation mechanisms. Honored were Dr. Arthur B. Pardee of Princeton University and Dr. H. Edwin Umbarger of Purdue University. They will share a $5,000 award, to he presented with a bronze medallion at ceremonies April 9.

title: Judge Upholds Pardon of Nixon Under Power to Calm Rebellion
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., March 29 (AP)A Federal judge sitting in President Ford's hometown has ruled that Mr. Ford's pardon of former President Richard M. Nixon was constitutional.

title: HomeSwap Clubs Gear Up for Summer
description: It sounds like a perfect cottage industry: no experience necessary, a small cash outlay and plenty of leisure time.

title: Millions in Arizona Land Frauds Alleged
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 29National investors lost more than $500million to dishonest land promoters in the last decade, the state's Attorney General says.

title: Ford Statement
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (UP)Following is the text of President Ford's statement on the dispatch of United States vessels to evacuate refugees from South Vietnamese ports, as read to reporters by the President's press secretary, Ron Nessen:

title: Rutherford Platt Dead at 80; Nature Writer, Photographer
description: Rutherford Platt, nature writer, photographer and lecturer, and former advertising executive, died Friday in Boston at the age of 80.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Plant: rosebushes, evergreens, fruit trees, berries, hardy vegetablez such as peas, spinach, lettuce, onion sets, cabbages.... Fertilize: evergreens, rosebushes, fruits, lawns and shrubs. ... Cleanup lawns, shrub and flower borders.

title: Productivity at City Zoos Spurs a Sale of 90 Animals
description: Overcrowding and enthusiastic reproductive behavior at the three city zoos has produced a bumper crop of 90 surplus animals to be sold by sealed bid.

title: CHARLES V. MOREY JR.
description: Charles V. Morey Jr., merchandise manager of the New York group of the home improvement department of Sears, Roebuck & Co., died of an aneurysm Friday evening in Somerset Hospital in Somerville, N.J. He was 42 years old and lived in Somerville.

title: New Quake Shakes Utah
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 29 (AP)A moderate earthquake shook Utah ana southern Idaho at 7 A.M. today; but no injuries or damage were reported. It was an aftershock of a quake two days ago that was the strongest in this country in four years, scientists said. Its epicenter was near the UtahIdaho border community of Blue Creek, Utah, within five miles of the center of Thursday's more powerful tremor.

title: Devon to Hold Show On a Sunday First Time
description: For the first time in its 79year history, the Devon Horse Show will operate on a Sunday.

title: A new wave from the old India
description: NEW DELHI. A great multitude stretches away from a platform draped in the saffron, white and green colors of the Indian flagmen and women squatting on the ground, waiting. Against a canvas backdrop depicting a fiery sun rising over turbulent waves, a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi smiles down from the dais. A group of students sings into a microphone to the accompaniment of drums and cymbals.

title: The Critic
description: Kim Young Sam, head of South Korea's opposition New Democratic party, has called for the resignation of President Park Chung Hee and a revision of the South Korean Constitution. His remarks repeated many themes common to his party's long campaign against the Park regime, but they came the day after a new censorship law went into effect. The law forbids criticism of the Park government from abroad or through any foreigners, especially foreign newsmen, on penalty of seven years in jail.

title: Fishing Season Is Opening
description: ALBANYThe 1975 troutfishing season will open on Wednesday throughout the state with prospects for fishing on Long Island freshwater streams and ponds described as slightly better than average.

title: STAMPS
description: Albert Schweitzer  doctor, musician, humanitarian, winner of the Nobel Peace Prize, and Harry S. Truman, Presidentpiano player, humanitanzin, snaper of the postwar worldhave been accorded philatelic tribute in new commemorative issues. Both sought to better the condition of their fellow man.

title: I.R.S. May Have More Bad News for REITs
description: As if the real estate investment trusts were not in enough trouble from bad loans to builders and developers, the Internal Revenue Service may decide to subject them to further embarrassment because the prices of their stocks are so low.

title: Fashion
description: This month Julie Harris celebrates 30 years of life in the theater. During that time she has played such widely varied roles as 12yearold Frankie in Carson McCullers's The Member of the Wedding, Joan of Arc in The Lark and bohemian Sally Bowles in I Am a Camera. At the moment Miss Harris is playing in Terence Rattigan's In Praise of Love.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, MARCH 30, 1975

title: Cambridge Easy Victor Over Oxford
description: LONDON, March 29 (AP) Steve Tourek, the big American oarsman, pulled through some of the roughest water of his rowing career today and powered Cambridge University to victory Over Oxford in the 121st varsity boat race.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: China, after weeks of silence on the health of two musk oxen that it had received from the United States Government in return for two pandas, announced 13 days ago that the male musk ox, Milton, had died. He succumbed Feb. 20 to what zoo officials call hardware disease  the swallowing of sharp objects, such as nails.

title: Nicklaus, Weiskopf At 203
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., March 29And now for the good newsJack Nicklaus is human after all.

title: Congress Faces 3 Key Decisions on Nuclear Reactors
description: WASHINGTON, March 29The question of whether nuclear reactors will become a major source of electricity in the United States during the next 25 years may depend on how Congress decides three key issues now pending before it, nuclear power supporters and opponents agree.

title: Results in British Football
